* Several years building production web applications (full-stack or strong single-stack with willingness to work across the stack).
* Comfortable owning features end-to-end: API design, frontend UX, data models and production monitoring.
* Product-minded: you prioritise user outcomes and measurable impact over vanity metrics.
* Strong communicator: you’ll work directly with founder, CPTO and cross-functionally across teams.
* Curious about AI and agentic workflows — hands-on LLM/vector DB experience is a plus but eagerness to learn matters most.
* TypeScript experience is a plus but not mandatory.
* English is the working language; Swedish is a bonus.


 How we work & how you’ll grow
   

  

 Helping SimpleSign win helps you win. Practically that looks like:
   

  

* Care about your work, your team and our users - that perspective guides our priorities, engineering trade-offs and roadmap choices.
* Ship fast toward team and company objectives.
* Give and receive direct feedback; learn quickly and iterate.
* Fix problems when you see them - early course corrections are expected.


 Our product team is small and highly visible: your work will be directly tied to company outcomes and expansion.
   

  

 Why SimpleSign?
   

  

* Real ownership on customer-facing product areas.
* Stability + autonomy: 12+ years, bootstrapped and cash-positive, yet still nimble.
* Direct collaboration with management - strong product influence for engineers.
* Modern, learning culture that experiments responsibly with AI and new tooling.
* Hybrid office in Stockholm (Karlavägen 20), friendly team and competitive compensation.


**Practical note**
 We’re unable to provide relocation assistance or sponsor work permits at this time. Please apply only if you already have the right to work in Sweden (a valid Swedish work permit).
   

  

 In the application message (or cover note) please include a
 **short note** 
 about a technical or product project you’re proud of — links to GitHub, a portfolio, or a live demo are welcome. Also tell us which parts of the stack you enjoy owning and any AI/agent experiments you’ve worked on or explored.

title: AI Developer
description:
**AI DEVELOPER**
 Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.
   

  

 At
 **Permobil** 
 , the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are building an intelligent AI platform on Microsoft Azure to transform how our teams work, learn, and deliver value. As an
 **AI Developer** 
 , you will design and implement secure, real-time backend systems that connect large language models, knowledge graphs, and business applications. Collaborating with integration developers, data scientists, and product teams, you will help turn innovative ideas into scalable, production-ready AI features within the Azure ecosystem, empowering our teams and driving intelligent automation across the organization.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain scalable Python microservices, deployed in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) or App Services,
* Implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines leveraging Azure OpenAI Service, Cognitive Search, and Azure Storage,
* Build and optimize integrations with Azure Machine Learning, AI Foundry, and Microsoft Fabric datasets,
* Collaborate with integration developers to securely expose LLM-driven functions and actions via Azure API Management,
* Work with MLOps engineers to automate model deployment, evaluation, and monitoring,
* Contribute to internal SDKs and libraries for prompt orchestration, embeddings, and evaluation.


**Qualifications & Skills**
* Master/Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or similar education,
* 3+ years of professional Python development experience,
* Strong understanding of Azure services (App Services, Key Vault, Storage, Service Bus, OpenAI),
* Experience with LangChain, Semantic Kernel, or other orchestration frameworks,
* Familiarity with vector databases such as Azure AI Search, Pinecone, or Redis Vector,
* Solid grasp of asynchronous programming, REST API design, and OAuth 2.0 / Entra ID authentication,
* Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions),
* Experience in agile methodologies,
* Fluent in English; proficiency in Swedish is a plus.


**Meriting Skills**
* Experience with Azure ML or MLOps pipelines,
* Background in prompt engineering, model evaluation, or RAG optimization,
* Knowledge of data governance and responsible-AI best practices.


**Who are you?**
 You inspire and motivate those around you, while encouraging collaboration and clear communication with stakeholders at all levels. You actively support experimentation and see failure as a valuable learning opportunity, helping to create an environment where curiosity and continuous improvement thrive.
   

  

**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day. Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future. We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **December 5th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Christoffer Stigson, Director Digital Transformation, christoffer.stigson@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: Senior Frontend Developer (React)
description:
Tacton is looking for a
 **Senior Frontend Developer (React)** 
 to join our R&D department.
   

  

 We're on an exciting journey and have just launched the first version of our analytics platform, and in this role, you’ll play a key part in developing and maintaining state-of-the-art frontend applications that enable data exploration, dashboard visualization, and automation. If clean architecture, modern tech stacks, and creating real impact through data excite you, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develop new features for our analytics tools using modern frontend technologies
* Maintain performance and stability by fixing bugs and optimizing code
* Refactor legacy components and enhance existing systems Continuously improve our architecture, testing frameworks, and developer tools
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Product Managers, Architects, and Developers


**Our Tech Stack Includes**
* Frontend: React (functional components), TypeScript (TSX), Redux Toolkit
* Build tools: Webpack 5 (with migration to Vite on the roadmap)
* CI/CD: GitHub, Buildkite, Docker
* Testing: Cypress (end-to-end), Jest (unit), Percy (visual regression)


**Requirements**
* 6+ years of experience in frontend development
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and React
* Experience working on large-scale frontend applications
* Deep understanding of modern web development paradigms (e.g., functional programming, predictable state management, component-based architecture
* A track record of writing testable, readable, and maintainable code
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
* Proactive mindset with a focus on continuous improvement
* Ability to work independently and comfortable working on-site 3 days per week


**Who You Are**
* Passionate about creating clean, efficient, and user-focused interfaces
* Detail-oriented with a strong understanding of performance and optimization
* A collaborative team player who values a feedback-friendly environment
* Eager to take initiative and ownership of technical challenges
* Curious and always looking to learn new tools and techniques


**Preferred But Not Required**
* Experience with Redux Toolkit (RTK), Vite, Docker, React Hooks, and Sentry
* Basic knowledge of Python to collaborate on backend API adjustments
* Strong sense for modern UI/UX design principles


**What We Offer**
* A solid and trusted company with over two decades of experience, global customers — and an exciting journey of continued growth!
* A collaborative engineering culture – work with a senior team that helps you grow, shares knowledge, and challenges you to do your best work.
* 33 days of paid time off – 30 vacation days plus 3 extra to make sure you get the rest you deserve
* Generous wellness allowance – to support your health and wellbeing.
* Private healthcare insurance – Skip the waiting lines and get quick access to private medical care, including specialist consultations and treatments.


**We’re Excited To Hear From You**
 If you have any questions or just want to know more about the role — don’t hesitate to reach out. We’d love for you to apply as soon as possible,
 **apply no later than 1:st of February.**
**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Code test & technical interview
* Final interview with our CTO
* Reference checks


**About Tacton**
*Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help manufacturers overcome their most critical product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we’ve grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.*
 Learn more at
 **tacton.com/about**
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: iOS Developer - Shape Games, Stockholm or Copenhagen
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
 iOS Developer – Shape Games
   

  

 Contract type: Full time
   

  

 Location: Hybrid Working (Copenhagen office)
   

  

 Shape Games is looking for an experienced iOS Developer to join our talented team and help build world-class sports betting applications. You’ll work in a cross-functional team to craft smooth, scalable, and feature-rich iOS experiences using cutting-edge native Apple technologies.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an iOS Developer at Shape Games, you’ll be working with a team of 5–8 cross platform engineers in a trust-based, collaborative environment. You’ll be mentored regardless of your experience level to ensure a smooth onboarding and deep understanding of our modular product platform and development culture.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

  

* Participate in the development of scalable software
* Collaborate in a cross-functional team environment (5–8 engineers)
* Be able to operate in an open, inspiring and trust-based environment, where your voice will be heard in matters concerning your team
* Be assigned a mentor, regardless of your experience level, for the first weeks at work, just so you can get familiar with the product and the Shape Games ways of working
* Join us in achieving the best user experience using native technologies from Apple
* Fully embrace the Swift programming language and follow the Swift Evolution closely, taking advantage of any new features that we can see providing value
* Contribute to expand our modular architecture: this has so far resulted in more than 50 swift packages that can be combined to create highly customisable sports betting apps (we use Swift Package Manager for dependency management)
* Join us in using many exciting technologies including Reactive Programming with the framework developed by some of our colleagues, ReactiveKit (We also started using Swift Async Sequence which we see as a future of Reactive Programming in Swift)


 What we’re looking for
   

  

  

* Proven experience in developing native iOS applications using Swift and the iOS SDK
* Motivation to learn and grow within a team of experienced and passionate iOS, Android, and web developers
* Interest in design patterns and well-structured code and workflows
* Commitment to maintaining high code quality, performance, and documentation standards
* Clear, structured, and timely communication
* Adaptability to fast-changing circumstances and requirements
* Strong collaboration and teamwork mindset
* Interest in learning new things and sharing knowledge with others
* Experience working in Scrum or Agile development environments
* Comfortable collaborating with product managers, designers, and QA engineers


 Location
   

  

 Hybrid (Copenhagen office)
   

  

 Why join Shape Games?
   

  

  

* Work with modern technologies in a fast-moving iGaming industry
* Be part of a skilled, diverse, and collaborative team
* Flexible remote work options
* Competitive salary
* Relocation package


 Ready to shape the future of iOS development in iGaming?
   

  

 Apply now!
   

  

 Shape Games is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply, regardless of age, gender, religion, ethnicity, disability, or sexual orientation. We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace in accordance with Danish and EU equality standards.
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Engineering Manager - Data Platform
description:
We’re launching two brand-new teams within the Data Collection Product Area of Spotify’s Data Platform Studio, each made up of 4–5 engineers across a mix of experience levels.
   

  

 Team Palico will shape the future of developer experience for data collection at Spotify. By building a unified layer of intuitive, powerful tools on top of our core platforms—Gabito for event delivery and UBI for user-behavior instrumentation—the team will empower engineers across Spotify to build with confidence and speed.
   

  

 The second team, whose mission is now coming into focus, will take end-to-end ownership of Spotify’s Event Sender SDKs across Android, iOS, JavaScript, and C++—software that sits at the very edge of our ecosystem and underpins how data flows from every Spotify client. Together, these teams offer a rare chance to build foundational systems from the ground up, influence technical strategy from day one, and leave a lasting mark on how Spotify understands and evolves its products through data.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* You will build and lead a team of engineers through hiring, coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development.
* Create and maintain an opinionated Technical Strategy that aligns with the rest of the Platform Mission and Spotify.
* Drive and be accountable for technical delivery and work with your team on strategy and execution.
* Facilitate collaboration with other engineers and product managers in solving exciting and challenging problems across the platform.
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices.
* Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the things we value.
* Be an active part of the Product Area leadership team and collaborate with other leaders in the organization.
* Grow the technical expertise of the team.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You will build and lead a team of engineers through hiring, coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development.
* Create and maintain an opinionated Technical Strategy that aligns with the rest of the Platform Mission and Spotify.
* Drive and be accountable for technical delivery and work with your team on strategy and execution.
* Facilitate collaboration with other engineers and product managers in solving exciting and challenging problems across the platform.
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices.
* Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the things we value.
* Be an active part of the Product Area leadership team and collaborate with other leaders in the organization.
* Grow the technical expertise of the team.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden or London, UK
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-notice
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Snowflake Developer
description:
Snowflake Developer is responsible for designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines using Snowflake and IDMC. Build and maintain ETL/ELT workflows and data pipelines using Snowflake and IDMC to process large datasets efficiently. Design data models, create and maintain views, stored procedures, and other database objects in Snowflake, optimize data storage, and ensure scalability in Snowflake. Implement data governance, access controls, and encryption to protect sensitive information.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Analyse business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Design, develop, and implement ETL/ELT pipelines to migrate data from Teradata to Snowflake.
* Optimize migration processes ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and performance.
* Create and manage Snowflake objects (tables, views, schemas, stages, procedures).
* Implement partitioning, clustering, and performance tuning strategies.
* Implement and manage Snowflake features such as Snowpipe, Streams, Tasks, and Time Travel
* Develop and maintain data models, schemas, and stored procedures in Snowflake SQL
* Monitor and tune Snowflake performance, including warehouse sizing and query optimization and ensure efficient resource utilization and cost optimization.
* Manage external stages, storage integrations, data security, access controls, and role-based permissions in Snowflake
* Automate data ingestion from various sources using Snowflake connectors and external stages using different file format, code pages, and any integration with Saas tools (e.g. dbt cloud, Fivetran, Databricks etc).
* Rewrite and optimize Teradata SQL scripts, macros, and stored procedures for Snowflake compatibility.
* Develop reusable scripts for automation of migration tasks (Python, Shell etc.).
* Conduct data reconciliation between Teradata and Snowflake post-migration.
* Work closely with data architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand requirements.
* Document migration processes, best practices, and technical solutions.


**Technical Skills**
* Strong hands-on experience with Snowflake cloud data warehouse.
* Knowledge of Snowflake features: Time Travel, Cloning, Micro-partitions, Streams & Tasks.
* Hands on experience in Snowflake features like external stages, Snowpipe, storage integration, File Formats, RBAC etc
* Strong experience with SQL and various database technologies (Oracle, Teradata SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.).
* Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD practices for data pipelines and workflows.
* Experience in data engineering or database development, particularly with data migrations.
* Experience in different batch processing and data loading/transformation strategies.
* Proficiency in scripting for automating regular or repeating task (python, shell scripting etc).
* Understanding of Teradata architecture, SQL, and utilities (BTEQ, FastLoad, MultiLoad, TPT).
* Experience in analysing and converting Teradata-specific functions to Snowflake equivalents.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Snowflake SnowPro Certification is a plus
* Experience in banking and financial services will be preferred.

title: Area Tech Lead
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Area Tech Lead - Finansiera**
 Fortnox är på en resa för att bli Sveriges häftigaste FinTech-bolag, drivet av modern teknik och skalbara system. Vi vill bygga en utvecklingsorganisation i absolut världsklass och söker nu en Area Tech Lead som vill vara med på den resan och tekniskt forma nästa generation av våra produkter.
   

  

 Produktområde Finansiera tillhandahåller finansieringslösningar (Fakturaköp, Betala senare, Företagslån) till små och medelstora företag. Detta är ett av våra snabbast växande områden, vilket ställer höga krav på skalbarhet och arkitekturell kvalitet. Som Area Tech Lead kommer du att vara en nyckelperson för att säkerställa att vi möter dessa krav tekniskt.
   

  

**Ansvar**
* Tekniskt ansvarig för produktområdets leveranser, kvalitet och arkitektur.
* Ansvar för kontinuerlig teknisk förbättring, innovation och kunskapsspridning inom produktområdet.


**Uppgifter**
* Aktivt arbeta med kod för att kunna säkerställa relevanta och innovativa lösningar.
* Driva teknisk kompetensutveckling och vara mentor för utvecklare inom området.
* Agera tekniskt bollplank och stöd till områdets team.
* Arbeta nära områdets produkt- och designledare för att balansera tekniska förbättringar mot funktionsutveckling i områdets backlog.
* Utveckla, dokumentera och kommunicera en tydlig arkitekturell plan och teknisk strategi för området.
* Representera områdets teknik i samtal och möten med interna och externa parter.
* Leda tekniska intervjuer vid rekrytering.


**Kompetens / Erfarenhet**
* Högskoleexamen inom Datateknik, Mjukvaruteknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling, varav minst 3 år i en ledande teknisk roll, Tech Lead, Senior Developer, Arkitekt eller motsvarande.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att designa och implementera skalbara, distribuerade system.
* Erfarenhet av att framgångsrikt coacha och mentorera utvecklare och driva teknisk kompetensutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av Domain Driven Design (DDD) och dess tillämpning vid design och utveckling av distribuerade system.
* Erfarenhet av JVM-baserade språk i allmänhet och Kotlin i synnerhet är meriterande.
* Flytande svenska i såväl tal som skrift


**Fortnox - mitt i företagslivet**
*Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.*
*Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Senior Security Engineer (Application Security)
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The Role**
 At Legora, we prioritise security. Always.
   

  

 We are looking for Application Security Engineers who can think like an attacker, build like a developer, and operate like an SRE. In this role you will work across our whole tech stack, from our Azure cloud infrastructure, JavaScript and Python services, to our AI integrations and workflows. Your goal is to ensure everything we ship and build is secure-by-default and resilient to evolving threats.
   

  

 At Legora we don't believe that “shifting left” is sufficient, our goal is to build a secure and resilient ecosystem for our engineers so that they can build tomorrows features with confidence and speed.
   

  

* This is a Stockholm-based, 5-day in-office role, we believe building together in person drives better outcomes.


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Embed security into our software development lifecycle; conduct design reviews, threat modelling, and secure code reviews for our JavaScript and Python codebases.
* Architect and implement security controls for our cloud infrastructure, ensuring Zero Trust principles in across our networks, identities, and service-to-service communication.
* Build and maintain secure-by-default tooling, templates, and guardrails for our developers.
* Ensure our AI workflows and pipelines are secured and resilient against prompt injection, data leakage, and abuse.
* Develop and maintain vulnerability management pipelines, triaging and driving fixes with engineering teams.
* Automate security processes in CI/CD, including secret scanning, artifact signing, and policy-as-code checks.
* Partner with our information security team to ensure compliance and automate evidence collection efforts.


**Who You Are**
* You have 7+ years in Software Engineering with a strong interest in Cyber Security, and/or
* 10+ years as in Security Engineering or Product Security roles, ideally in a cloud-first, high-growth tech environment.
* You are able to produce production grade code.
* You have experience building and securing AI workflows, with an interest in adversarial AI threats and mitigations.
* You have hands-on experience securing cloud environments (Azure strongly preferred) and working with Infrastructure-as-Code (Pulumi, Terraform, or similar).
* You understand Zero Trust architecture and can design systems with identity-centric, least-privilege access controls.
* You have experience with secure SDLC practices, application security testing, and vulnerability management.
* You thrive in cross-functional work, explaining security risks to engineers, influencing design choices, and collaborating to deliver secure features on time.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Head of Community Marketing
description:
**About Lovable**
 Lovable is building the world's most loved AI software development platform, empowering builders to ship real products faster than ever before. We've grown to 150K+ community members in our first year, with passionate builders across 80+ countries creating everything from side projects to production applications. Our community is our competitive advantage—they validate us, amplify us, and help us build the best product in the market.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As Head of Community Marketing, you'll own the strategy and execution of all community-led growth initiatives at Lovable. This role sits at the intersection of product, marketing, and community—driving measurable impact through authentic relationships with our builder community. You'll manage a team of community managers and be responsible for hosting events, driving engagement, moderating forums, and scaling community programs from 0 to 1.
   

  

 This is a player-coach role. You'll be hands-on building and running programs while also setting strategy and managing a growing team. You'll report directly to the Head of Product Marketing and work cross-functionally with Growth, Product, Sales, and Brand teams.
   

  

**Key Success Metrics:**
* Number of users who both build in Lovable AND engage in community (online and/or IRL) within 30 days / Total active users
* Community program participant retention and activation rates
* Event attendance and post-event conversion to paid users
* Quality and frequency of user-generated content and advocacy


 What You'll Do
   

  

 Community Programs & Scale (40%)
   

  

* Build and scale Lovable's community programs including Ambassadors, Champions, Campus Leaders, and future initiatives
* Design onboarding experiences, rituals, and benefits that make community members feel valued and drive meaningful participation
* Establish clear selection criteria, application processes, and success metrics for all programs
* Create playbooks and systems that allow community programs to scale globally without sacrificing quality
* Manage community platforms (Discord, forums, etc.) strategy and engagement


 Events & Activations (30%)
   

  

* Own end-to-end event strategy from ideation to execution: hackathons, workshops, meetups, and flagship moments (e.g., World Hackathon Tour, SheBuilds)
* Partner with external organizations, universities, and companies to host community-led events globally
* Build event playbooks, marketing materials, and support systems for community members hosting local events
* Track event ROI including attendance, participant activation, conversion to paid, and brand impact
* Manage event budgets, sponsorships, and in-kind support (credits, swag, resources)


 Community Engagement & Content (20%)
   

  

* Drive daily community engagement across Discord, social platforms, and online forums
* Develop content strategies that showcase community wins, user stories, and builder spotlights
* Create systems for community-generated educational content (tutorials, courses, templates)
* Foster relationships with power users, champions, and advocates who amplify Lovable organically
* Monitor community health metrics and sentiment; surface product feedback to relevant teams


 Team Leadership & Cross-Functional Collaboration (10%)
   

  

* Hire, mentor, and manage a team of community managers
* Partner with Product Marketing on launch activations, customer stories, and positioning insights from community
* Collaborate with Growth on community-led acquisition and activation strategies
* Work with Brand and Social teams on community content amplification
* Align with Customer Success and Sales on enterprise community engagement opportunities


 Who You Are
   

  

 Must-Haves
   

  

* 5-7+ years in community marketing, developer relations, or community-led growth roles with proven track record of building programs at scale (ideally 0 to 1)
* Technical enough to understand and use Lovable deeply—you should be able to demo the product, troubleshoot issues, and speak the language of builders
* Charismatic and authentic communicator who builds genuine relationships with community members from diverse backgrounds
* Execution-oriented with strong project management skills—you ship fast, iterate based on feedback, and drive results
* Data-driven approach to community strategy with ability to set KPIs, analyze performance, and optimize programs
* Experience managing teams and mentoring community managers
* From the community—ideally you've been an active participant or leader in developer, tech, or builder communities yourself


 Nice-to-Haves
   

  

* Experience in the AI/ML, no-code, or developer tools space
* Previous experience at a high-growth startup (especially during rapid scaling phases)
* Background in event production or large-scale hackathon organization
* Familiarity with community platforms (Discord, Slack, forums) and community analytics tools
* Content creation skills (writing, video, social media)
* Experience with product-led growth (PLG) or community-led growth (CLG) motions


 Key Traits We're Looking For
   

  

* Builder mentality: You don't just manage—you roll up your sleeves and build alongside your team
* Deeply empathetic: You genuinely care about people and create experiences that make them feel valued
* Strategic AND tactical: You can zoom out to set vision and zoom in to execute details flawlessly
* Startup resilience: You thrive in ambiguity, adapt quickly, and stay focused on impact over perfection
* Natural networker: You connect people, create energy, and build movements


 Why Join Lovable
   

  

* Category-defining company: We're building the future of software development and have the fastest-growing AI coding community globally
* Passionate community: Work with 150K+ builders who love what we're building and want to help us succeed
* High impact: Your programs will directly influence product-market fit, growth, and brand strength
* World-class team: Learn from experienced leaders from Ramp, Figma, Shopify, Anthropic, and other top companies
* Generous package: Competitive salary, meaningful equity, and benefits
* Stockholm hub + global flexibility: Beautiful new office in Stockholm with support for remote collaboration


 Our Values
   

  

* Role-Modeling: We lead by example and set the standard for excellence
* Build in Public: We share our journey transparently and learn in the open
* Speed & Iteration: We ship fast, learn quickly, and continuously improve
* Care Deeply: We're invested in our users, our product, and each other

title: .NET utvecklare inom Dynamics 365 CE
description:
**Att jobba som .NET utvecklare inom Dynamics 365 CE**
 Som .NET-utvecklare i vårt Dynamics 365 center of excellence team arbetar du i ett affärskritiskt område där kund- och ärendehanteringsflöden står i centrum för både våra bank- och försäkringskunder. Plattformen är en molnbaserad Microsoftlösning som vi anpassar och bygger vidare på utifrån standardfunktionalitet inom Dynamics 365. Plattformen är en viktig del av Skandias målarkitektur och vi expanderar kontinuerligt vår funktions- och användargrad. Utifrån den centrala placeringen i Skandias systemlandskap är integrationer och eventdriven arkitektur en viktig del av teamets arbete.
   

  

 Att utforska nya och spännande förmågor inom plattformen, t.ex. AI, Copilot och Agenter, är en viktig del av vår framtida roadmap.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av 12 personer: produktägare, mjukvaruarkitekter, utvecklare och testare där alla utgår från kontoret på Lindhagensgatan 86 i Stockholm. Vi är ett sammansvetsat och högpresterande gäng som värdesätter nyfikenhet, samarbete och kvalitet. Vi hjälps åt, delar kunskap och ser till att du får rätt förutsättningar att växa både tekniskt och som kollega.
   

  

**Några Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter i Vardagen Är**
* Skapa och optimera integrationer mellan Dynamics och andra system.
* Utveckla och konfigurera lösningar som bygger på Dynamics 365 CE.
* Säkerställa att vi ligger i teknikens framkant – både inom plattformen och i arbetssätt.


 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT Kund.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Ser vi att du har flerårig erfarenhet av systemutveckling i .NET och C#. Du har arbetat i tekniskt komplexa miljöer och du är nyfiken på att utvecklas inom Dynamics 365 området.
   

  

 Du har tidigare jobbat med moderna tekniker som React, TypeScript eller JavaScript och har erfarenhet av automatiserade enhetstester, Azure DevOps och Azure Pipelines. Det är ett grundkrav att du kan svenska flytande, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av att utveckla och konfigurera i Dynamics 365 CE, Power Platform, Dataverse, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions och/eller SQL. Har du dessutom arbetat med Copilot eller andra AI-drivna funktioner inom Dynamics 365 är det ett extra plus.
   

  

 Som person ser vi att du är nyfiken och vill utforska nya områden, en problemlösare med stort engagemang som gillar att samarbeta med både verksamhet och IT.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet.
   

  

 Läs mer om hela vår rekryteringsprocess här.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen vänligen ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Jonas Olsson på jonas.olsson@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen, ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer (Java/Javascript)
description:
**Välkommen till B3 Innovation – där teknik och trivsel går hand i hand!**
 Välkommen till B3 Innovation, hjärtat av systemutveckling inom B3 Consulting Group! Här kombinerar vi den familjära känslan från ett småföretag med storbolagets resurser.
   

  

 Vi är ett engagerat gäng med konsulter som specialiserar oss på systemutveckling inom Java och moderna JavaScriptramverk. I en miljö där du får möjlighet att växa både professionellt och personligt i en inkluderande gemenskap. Oavsett om du är en passionerad cyklist eller en bokslukare, så finns det plats för dig hos oss.
   

  

**Om rollen som fullstackutvecklare inom Java/** 
 Javascript på B3 Innovation
   

  

 Som Senior fullstackutvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* utveckla högkvalitativa och skalbara lösningar
* samarbeta med ett tvärfunktionellt team av experter
* Delta i design och arkitektur av nya system.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet och arbetat i fullstackrollen under en längre tid. Du som har hunnit både göra misstag och även lära av dem. Förhoppningsvis tycker du om att arbeta i team, dela med dig av dina kunskaper och vill fortsätta att lära dig nytt.
   

  

 Våra krav för att du ska passa i denna roll:
   

  

* Du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av utvecklarrollen.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med Java, Javascript, Kotlin, Spring, Microservices.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med olika ramverk som React, Angular och Vue.
* Du har erfarenhet av att jobba i agila team.


**Varför B3 Innovation?**
* Innovativ Kultur: Vi uppmuntrar kreativitet och nya idéer.
* Inkluderande miljö: Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna.
* Balans och flexibilitet: Flexibilitet är centralt, vilket gör att du kan forma din arbetsdag för att få livspusslet att gå ihop. Vi förstår vikten av balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder därför flexibla arbetstider.
* Gemenskap: Hos oss blir du en del av ett stöttande team som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Det handlar inte bara om “jobb jobb jobb” hos oss. Vi anordnar allt från tech-workshops till sociala aktiviteter som stickcaféer, spelkvällar och AW.


**Om B3 Innovation**
 Vi är kända för vårt fokus på innovation och förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Genom att kombinera djup teknisk expertis med en stark förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet, skapar vi lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vår kultur bygger på öppenhet, samarbete och en passion för teknik.
   

  

 Vi prioriterar personlig utveckling och erbjuder verktyg som B3 Academy, TechTalks och "Lunch & Learn" för att du ska kunna växa.
   

  

 Upptäck möjligheterna med B3 Innovation. Som utvecklare får du arbeta inom spännande branscher som media, bank och finans, energi, offentlig sektor, telekom och e-handel. Oavsett om du optimerar TV-sändningar, utvecklar digitala banktjänster eller skapar smarta hem, hjälper vi dig att hitta det perfekta uppdraget som matchar dina intressen.
   

  

 Våra toppbetyg i medarbetarundersökningar visar att nöjda kollegor är kärnan i vår framgång. Är du redo att kliva in i en miljö där utveckling och trivsel går hand i hand?
   

  

 Som sagt, välkommen till B3 Innovation – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?**
 Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade och innovativa team!
   

  

 Om du är mer nyfiken på oss så kan du läsa mer om oss här: https://www.b3.se/innovation
   

  

 Om du har funderingar så hör gärna av dig till Kenneth Andersson på +46706678050 alt mail kenneth.andersson@b3.se.

title: Lösningsarkitekt till offentlig sektor
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Just nu söker vi en IT-arkitekt med fokus på lösnings- och systemarkitektur till uppdrag inom offentlig sektor i Stockholm. Du blir en del av CGI:s arkitektteam och arbetar nära affärskonsulter, verksamhetsexperter, utvecklare och andra arkitekter för att skapa hållbara och verksamhetsnära IT-lösningar.
   

  

 Rollen passar dig som vill arbeta kundnära, med fokus på arkitektur på lösnings- och systemnivå, snarare än infrastruktur och hårdvara. Du kommer att stödja våra kunder i att analysera deras befintliga systemflora, identifiera förbättringsbehov och ta fram tydliga arkitekturella riktningar och lösningar – från nuläge till genomförande.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som IT-arkitekt hos CGI arbetar du brett och tvärfunktionellt med arkitekturfrågor hos våra kunder inom offentlig sektor. Du är en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att lösningar är långsiktiga, ändamålsenliga och i linje med verksamhetens behov.
   

  

**I rollen ingår bland annat att:**
 Ta fram lösningsförslag och arkitekturella beslutunderlag
   

  

 Definiera och dokumentera icke-funktionella krav såsom säkerhet, prestanda och förvaltningsbarhet
   

  

 Analysera och strukturera befintliga systemlandskap samt föreslå förbättringar och modernisering
   

  

 Arbeta med förstudier, målarkitekturer och roadmaps
   

  

 Stötta kunder i genomförande och implementation av lösningar
   

  

 Arbeta med integrationer, informationsflöden och systemberoenden
   

  

 Bidra till metodutveckling och arkitekturarbete inom CGI
   

  

 Du arbetar i nära dialog med kundens verksamhet och IT, med fokus på att översätta behov till tekniskt hållbara lösningar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT-arkitekt i komplexa miljöer och som trivs i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och IT. Du har ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt och är van att skapa struktur och tydlighet i systemlandskap.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

 Flera års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt, med fokus på lösnings- och/eller systemarkitektur
   

  

 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med offentlig sektor
   

  

 God förmåga att analysera och dokumentera befintliga systemfloror
   

  

 Erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete kopplat till verksamhetsbehov och implementation
   

  

 Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Snowflake Developer
description:
Snowflake Developer is responsible for designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines using Snowflake and IDMC. Build and maintain ETL/ELT workflows and data pipelines using Snowflake and IDMC to process large datasets efficiently. Design data models, create and maintain views, stored procedures, and other database objects in Snowflake, optimize data storage, and ensure scalability in Snowflake. Implement data governance, access controls, and encryption to protect sensitive information.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Analyse business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Design, develop, and implement ETL/ELT pipelines to migrate data from Teradata to Snowflake.
* Optimize migration processes ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and performance.
* Create and manage Snowflake objects (tables, views, schemas, stages, procedures).
* Implement partitioning, clustering, and performance tuning strategies.
* Implement and manage Snowflake features such as Snowpipe, Streams, Tasks, and Time Travel
* Develop and maintain data models, schemas, and stored procedures in Snowflake SQL
* Monitor and tune Snowflake performance, including warehouse sizing and query optimization and ensure efficient resource utilization and cost optimization.
* Manage external stages, storage integrations, data security, access controls, and role-based permissions in Snowflake
* Automate data ingestion from various sources using Snowflake connectors and external stages using different file format, code pages, and any integration with Saas tools (e.g. dbt cloud, Fivetran, Databricks etc).
* Rewrite and optimize Teradata SQL scripts, macros, and stored procedures for Snowflake compatibility.
* Develop reusable scripts for automation of migration tasks (Python, Shell etc.).
* Conduct data reconciliation between Teradata and Snowflake post-migration.
* Work closely with data architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand requirements.
* Document migration processes, best practices, and technical solutions.


**Technical Skills**
* Strong hands-on experience with Snowflake cloud data warehouse.
* Knowledge of Snowflake features: Time Travel, Cloning, Micro-partitions, Streams & Tasks.
* Hands on experience in Snowflake features like external stages, Snowpipe, storage integration, File Formats, RBAC etc
* Strong experience with SQL and various database technologies (Oracle, Teradata SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.).
* Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD practices for data pipelines and workflows.
* Experience in data engineering or database development, particularly with data migrations.
* Experience in different batch processing and data loading/transformation strategies.
* Proficiency in scripting for automating regular or repeating task (python, shell scripting etc).
* Understanding of Teradata architecture, SQL, and utilities (BTEQ, FastLoad, MultiLoad, TPT).
* Experience in analysing and converting Teradata-specific functions to Snowflake equivalents.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Snowflake SnowPro Certification is a plus
* Experience in banking and financial services will be preferred.

title: AI-First Product Engineer (“Vibe Coder”)
description:
**Pulse Penguin | Flexible, with Stockholm office presence expected**

You move fast. You ship. You use AI constantly. You care about taste.

Pulse Penguin is building a governed AI decision platform — a true business OS. Not a toy layer. Not a chatbot wrapper. This is operational AI with real workflows, financial grounding, auditability, and security.

We build the platform mostly inside an AI IDE. We want someone who genuinely gets that workflow: directing AI assistants, correcting when needed, and staying sharp during big implementations — without turning the codebase into spaghetti.

**What you’ll do** 

* **“Vibe Coder”**
* Explore and ship UI/UX and features — fast
* Pair deeply with AI to write, refactor, and polish
* Work directly with the founder on product direction

**You**

* Loves building and shipping
* High taste — you know what feels good to users
* Comfortable with ambiguity, speed, and ownership

**Compensation**  
Competitive salary (experience-based)

**Work setup**  
Flexible arrangements with an expectation for presence at our Stockholm office. We’re deliberately building an office that feels like home. No sterile “office-vibes”, no corporate theatre. It’s cosy, high-trust, and where fast decisions happen. Dogs are welcome energy :)

**Find all the details at https://pulsepenguin.ai/careers**

**Apply by**  
Emailing **jobs@pulsepenguin.ai** with your CV, cover letter, and proof you ship: links/examples of products you’ve built (anything real).

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Stockholm

title: Senior CRO & Personalization Manager
description:
Looking for a workplace for the future? At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you'll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most - relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.

**How you'll make a difference with us**


As Senior CRO & Personalization Manager, you will lead our end-to-end optimization and personalization strategy across digital sales touchpoints for our B2C customers. Your mission is to increase conversion, engagement, and customer lifetime value by delivering frictionless, relevant, and tailored experiences throughout the subscription journey.


You will combine experimentation expertise with data-driven personalization to create dynamic user experiences that respond to customer needs, behaviors, and lifecycle stages. Working closely with UX design, analytics, product, engineering, and marketing teams, you will build a scalable testing and personalization framework that continuously improves sales outcomes across acquisition, upgrade, and retention flows.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead the strategy, roadmap, and execution for CRO and personalization across all digital sales channels.
* Identify high-impact opportunities through behavioral analysis, segmentation, funnel diagnostics, and customer insights.
* Drive A/B and multivariate testing, personalization rules, and audience-based experiences.
* Implement personalization use cases across landing pages, product selection, checkout, and logged-in experiences.
* Develop a scalable experimentation culture, including prioritization models, documentation, and shared learning processes.
* Collaborate with marketing to align personalization with lifecycle campaigns and traffic strategies.
* Partner with product and engineering to ensure personalization logic and experimentation tools integrate smoothly into the tech stack.
* Track and report on the impact of optimization and personalization initiatives on key KPIs such as conversion, sales, churn, customer lifetime value and higher digital engagement for service errands.

**Experience & Background**

* 6+ years in CRO, personalization, digital growth, or related roles.
* Proven ability to improve conversion rates and revenue through structured testing and advanced personalization strategies.
* Experience in subscription-based digital businesses; telco experience is a strong advantage.
* Background in working with cross-functional teams within digital product and sales environments.

**Skills**

* Deep expertise in A/B testing, experimentation frameworks, and funnel optimization.
* Hands-on experience with personalization platforms (e.g., Dynamic Yield, Optimizely Personalization, Adobe Target, similar).
* Very strong analytical capabilities including segmentation, cohort analysis, and behavioral insights.
* Good understanding of customer data platforms (CDPs), tagging, and data layer concepts.
* Ability to translate insights into clear hypotheses, test designs, and optimization roadmaps.
* Solid understanding of UX/UI principles and how they influence behavior and conversion.
* Skilled in collaborating with product owners, developers, designers, and analysts.
* Can read and understand HTML, CSS, JavaScript, as well as able to make small front-end changes in testing tools and troubleshoot broken variations or selectors without relying on developers.
* Has understanding of DOM structure, dataLayer usage, and how personalization payloads are injected

**Personal Competencies**

* Hypothesis-driven thinker with excellent prioritization skills.
* Strong communicator capable of influencing stakeholders at all levels.
* Comfortable leading discussions around data, strategy, and technical implications.
* Curious, experimental mindset focused on continuous learning and improvement.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.

**Our promise to you**

**We are better together.**


Here, you'll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other's backs through ups and downs.

**We support relationships and societies.**


Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.

**We make room for life.**


Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.

**We invite you to a career in motion.**


Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you'll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.

**Apply today!**


Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don't wait-reach out today.


In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultant Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.


Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.

**Good to know**


As part of Telenor's policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: UX- och tjänstedesigner
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av UX-design, tjänstedesign eller motsvarande användarcentrerat designarbete.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av behovs- och intressentanalys i komplexa digitala tjänster med flera aktörer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i utforskande och tidiga faser där lösningen utvecklas iterativt.
* Erfarenhet av att visualisera och kommunicera komplex information och processer.
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera i tal och skrift på svenska.

  

**Meriterande**  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med informationsintensiva tjänster, exempelvis register, masterdata eller datadrivna lösningar.
* Vana att facilitera workshops och samverka med roller inom verksamhet, juridik och IT
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta nära arkitekter och tekniska specialistroller.

 **Sista ansökningdatum:** 06-02-2026

 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Product Manager, Routing
description:
**About the role**  

We’re looking for a Product Manager for Routing to join our Group Operations team at Instabee. In this role, you’ll own one of the most business-critical product areas in Instabee — routing, at the very core of our last-mile operations.


You’ll be the dedicated Product Manager for two engineering teams, working in a close collaboration together with an Engineering Manager and a Staff Engineer. Your mission is to set direction, priorities, and roadmap, and ensure we deliver solutions that drive real operational and financial impact across our markets.


This is not a traditional UX-heavy PM role. It’s a highly analytical, business-driven role where you’ll work close to operations, dig deep into data, build business cases, and translate complex real-world challenges into scalable product and operational solutions. The cost impact of your decisions will be visible directly in the P&L.

**Some of the things you will do**

* Own the product strategy, roadmap, and prioritisation for the Routing product area
* Act as Product Manager for two engineering teams, working closely with Engineering Manager and Staff Engineer
* Translate complex operational and optimisation challenges into clear product initiatives — both technical and non-technical
* Drive continuous improvements in cost efficiency, last-mile quality, and scalability across markets
* Define, own, and follow up on routing KPIs, dashboards, and data-driven performance insights
* Lead initiatives end-to-end: from problem discovery and analysis to rollout and measurable impact
* Act as the key interface between market operations and tech, ensuring adoption, alignment, and business value

 **Your future team**  

You’ll be part of Group Operations, a central team working across Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, and the Netherlands. You’ll collaborate closely with market operations, routing specialists, and engineering — often working very close to where things actually happen.


You’ll work with two dedicated development teams located across Stockholm and Norway, in an agile setup with short iterations and a strong delivery focus. You’ll report to the Head of Product in Operations, and work closely with senior routing and operations counterparts across the organisation.

**What we're looking for**  

You’re a strong analytical problem-solver with solid business acumen and a genuine interest in operations. You’re comfortable owning a large and complex scope, making trade-offs, and backing decisions with data and clear reasoning.

* 4–5+ years of experience in product management, business development, operations, or similar analytical roles
* Relevant academic background
* Proven ability to analyse complex optimisation or operational problems and turn them into actionable initiatives
* Strong business understanding and experience building business cases and prioritising based on impact
* Comfortable working with data, KPIs, and performance reporting
* Strong stakeholder management skills across functions and seniority levels
* Fluent in English; Swedish is beneficial

 **More about you**  

You’re structured, independent, and comfortable working in ambiguity. You don’t wait for perfect data — you know how to move forward, test, and iterate. You enjoy working close to operations, talking to stakeholders, visiting terminals, and validating insights in the real world — not just in dashboards.


You’re more driven by impact than process, and while you understand product frameworks, you’re equally comfortable driving operational change when that’s what creates the most value.

* Experience from last-mile delivery, logistics, or large-scale operations
* Background in analytical roles such as consulting, operational excellence, or strategy
* Experience working with tools such as Tableau, Snowflake, or similar data platforms
* Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills

 **What you’ll get**

* A role with direct and visible impact on cost, efficiency, and operational performance
* Ownership of a business-critical product area with real decision-making authority
* A highly competent, collaborative, and genuinely nice team to work with
* The opportunity to build, improve, and see results fast — at real scale

  

Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:

* Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
* Hybrid setup and flexible working hours


Diversity and inclusion are very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

**Get to know us**


In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.


We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: UX Designer
description:
We're looking for a UX Designer to join our Application Development Department in central Stockholm. This is an opportunity to shape the user experience of industry-leading aviation tools used by a large and passionate user base worldwide.

### **About Navigraph**


Navigraph is a Swedish SaaS company that provides the international flight simulation community with flight planning tools, navigation data, and aeronautical charts used in professional aviation. Our 1.7 million registered users care deeply about realism, procedures, and getting the details right.


We're a team of 50+, including software developers, UX and graphic designers, data analysts, content producers, motion designers, and support specialists. Navigraph was founded by Stephen O'Connell (CTO) and Magnus Axholt (CEO), both of whom are still active in the company. We've grown considerably but kept the collaborative, creative culture we started with.

#### **What makes us different**


Navigraph is privately held, profitable, and built on the principle that people come first. That means prioritizing product quality and employee satisfaction. Our employee NPS is 80, placing us in the top percentile across industries.


The problem space is unusual: professional aviation complexity, consumer-grade usability expectations, and platforms spanning mobile, web, desktop, and in-simulator environments, including VR. You won't find this combination elsewhere.

#### **The role**


Bring research, make the case, change the direction!


You'll play a key role in shaping the user experience across Navigraph's product suite, from our flagship Charts app to desktop utilities and in-simulator interfaces. The work centers on information-dense, timing-sensitive interfaces where clarity directly affects the user experience under cognitive load. The challenges include showing the right information at the right moment while making complex workflows feel intuitive.


You’ll lead the end-to-end UX process - framing complex problems, conducting research, validating ideas, and translating insights into intuitive solutions. You'll also contribute to our design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.


You'll manage multiple UX initiatives across products and help build our user research infrastructure, including the behavioral analytics we're establishing across products.

#### **The team**


You'd join the Charts Team within the Application Department as part of a small but growing design group. Design is embedded with engineering: same dailies, shared context, with dedicated time for UX-specific collaboration. You'd also participate in cross-department design councils, shaping how UX works across the company.

#### **The community**


Our users are deeply engaged, active on forums and Discord, vocal about what they need, and genuinely invested in the product. Navigraph has become one of the most recognized brands in flight simulation by listening to and serving this community. As a designer, you'll have direct access to user feedback and a user base that cares intensely about getting the details right.

### **What we're looking for**

#### **Professional experience**

* You have 5+ years in product/UX design, with experience across web, native mobile, and desktop platforms
* You're passionate about UX and care deeply about design quality
* You're genuinely curious about users and want to understand why they behave the way they do
* You plan and conduct research to identify opportunities, resolve usability issues, and to validate design decisions.
* You manage multiple UX initiatives across teams, balancing discovery, delivery, and iteration.
* You bring experience with data-dense, information-rich interfaces, ideally in professional tools, technical software, or specialized domains
* You're energized by complex problems, not frustrated by them
* You build good relationships with colleagues and create a positive team environment
* You help junior designers grow through feedback, guidance, and collaboration
* You express yourself clearly and precisely in English, both written and spoken

#### **Technical skills**

* You design wireframes, prototypes, and user flows in Figma
* You build and maintain scalable design systems, including components, tokens, typography, and iconography
* You translate abstract or complex ideas into simple, usable interfaces
* You create and test interactive prototypes to validate design decisions
* You apply usability principles, accessibility standards, and human-computer interaction fundamentals throughout the design process
* You navigate technical constraints and platform-specific considerations that affect implementation

#### **Nice to have**

* Aviation interest, pilot experience, or personal experience with flight simulation, though you'll quickly learn from colleagues and a user base that care deeply about realistic procedures and workflows
* Gaming UX background with understanding of feedback loops, progression systems, and player engagement
* Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML/CSS, React, or React Native)

### **What we offer**


Navigraph is built on an open, caring culture where people genuinely come first. The structure is flat, leadership is hands-on, and flexibility is based on trust. Innovation and creativity aren't just tolerated, they're expected. You'll join a team that genuinely enjoys what they do and takes pride in setting the standard for what flight simulation tools can be.

* **Flexible Work Options**: On-site and hybrid
* **A great benefits package**: please check out our career site.
* **Growth Opportunities**: We’ll support your professional development and give you the resources to excel.
* **Memorable experiences:** The Navigraph team is a tight-knit group with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We enjoy spending time together and our annual work trips are always combined with team-building activities that leave lasting impressions!

### **How to apply**


Send your application, along with a portfolio and case studies that demonstrate your design thinking and the outcomes of your work. We're actively hiring and reviewing applications on a rolling basis.

title: Content- och Webbkoordinator
description:
Brinner du för att skapa innehåll som både engagerar och guidar kunder, och som dessutom förbättrar den digitala kundupplevelsen? Vill du arbeta nära andra digitala specialister på ett bolag med en stark företagskultur, där du får vara med och påverka, utveckla och bidra tillsammans med engagerade kollegor? Då kan vi på Svedea ha rätt utmaning för dig!


Vi söker nu en Content- och webbkoordinator som vill ta ett helhetsgrepp om innehållet på vår webb och vara med och forma hur våra kunder möter oss digitalt. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta kundnära, ta ansvar och se till att våra texter på webben verkligen gör skillnad.

**Om tjänsten**  

Som Content- och webbkoordinator ansvarar du för att hålla samman och vidareutveckla innehållet på vår webb www.svedea.se och www.bilig.se, och säkerställer att informationen är tydlig, relevant och i linje med vårt varumärke.


Du kommer främst att arbeta med innehåll på våra produkt- och informationssidor, men också stötta i andra digitala projekt. Det kan handla om att uppdatera texter inför lanseringar till att skapa guider som hjälper våra kunder att förstå försäkring på ett enklare sätt, alltid med kundens behov i fokus.


I rollen kommer du att:

* Skriva och redigera texter för webb, framför allt produktsidor och informativa, guidande artiklar.
* Hålla ihop och planera innehållsproduktion tillsammans med kollegor på Marknad, Produkt och Digital.
* Säkerställa att allt innehåll följer Svedeas tonalitet och ger ett enhetligt intryck.
* Hitta sätt att förbättra och uppdatera innehåll utifrån data, insikter och kundfeedback.
* Hjälpa till i större digitala projekt, t.ex. vid nya produktsläpp samt identifiera behov av webbutveckling.
* Bidra med idéer och inspiration kring hur vi kan utveckla vårt digitala innehåll.


Du kommer att tillhöra vårt team Digital. Vi är ett härligt och glatt gäng på 7 personer, alla med olika expertiser men med ett gemensamt fokus på digital försäljning. Teamet består bl.a av digitala marknadsförare, konverteringsoptimerare, UX/UI-designers och webbanalytiker. Vi arbetar i skärningspunkten mellan kund, affär och teknik.

**Din bakgrund**  

På Svedea lägger vi stor vikt vid personlighet och potential. Vi söker dig som tycker om att skriva och du gör det riktigt bra. Du har ett öga för detaljer och brinner för att skapa innehåll som är tydligt, inspirerande och lätt att ta till sig. Du tycker om att samarbeta med andra och du gör det gärna tvärfunktionellt med olika delar av organisationen. Samtidigt är du trygg i att arbeta självständigt och tar egna initiativ och ansvar för att föra uppgifter i mål. Som person är du även nyfiken och positiv, och du har en naturlig förmåga att få saker att hända. Du uppskattar en kultur där man hjälps åt, där det finns utrymme för idéer och där förbättringar välkomnas. Och framför allt gillar du att skapa innehåll som faktiskt gör skillnad för våra kunder.


Vi tror att du:

* har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom media, kommunikation, journalistik eller motsvarande
* har minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med innehåll i digitala kanaler (gärna webb)
* har förståelse och ett intresse för SEO, UX och tillgänglighet
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta i CMS; vi arbetar i Umbraco
