* talar och skriver flytande svenska då all vår kommunikation sker på svenska samt har känsla för tonalitet


Gillar du dessutom att nörda ner dig i data eller har erfarenhet av verktyg som Google Analytics eller Clarity är det ett stort plus.


**Vi erbjuder dig**

* På Svedea blir du en del av ett gäng som gillar att tänka nytt, samarbeta och hela tiden förbättra oss. Vi har en kultur där man får ta ansvar, testa idéer och vara sig själv. Här kommer du in i ett team som brinner för digital utveckling och där innehåll är en viktig del av kundupplevelsen.
* En inspirerade företagskultur som kännetecknas av laganda med passionerade och engagerande kollegor som förstår vikten av att hjälpas åt och att ha kul tillsammans. Mer om vår kultur hittar du här!
* Möjlighet till visst distansarbete med minst 3 dagar på kontoret/vecka för att balansera privat- och arbetsliv
* En arbetsplats som befinner sig i en spännande expansiv fas där dina tankar och idéer uppmuntras
* Ett riktigt schysst förmånspaket och möjlighet till en årlig bonus. Läs mer om våra förmåner här!
* Kontor högst upp i ett av Kungsholmens häftigaste hus med 360 graders vy över stan och terrasser i flera väderstreck. Spana in vår Office tour nedan

**Låter det intressant?**  

Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi arbetar löpande med urval så vänta inte utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag, sista ansökningsdag är den 22 februari. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Observera att vi enbart tar emot ansökningar via länken i annonsen. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Caroline Sundvik på mejl Caroline.Sundvik@svedea.se eller telefon: 072-141 14 94.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 *Tester och arbetsprov kan förekomma i samband med rekryteringsprocessen.*

**Om Svedea**  

Svedea är en framgångssaga. Våra första 16 år har gjort oss till det ledande bolaget inom försäkring av fritidsfordon som motorcykel, båt och snöskoter och vi är en stark utmanare inom bil-, djur- och företagsförsäkring. Efter önskemål från våra kunder erbjuder vi nu även hem- och villaförsäkring. Idag har vi omkring 430 000 kunder, är över 300 anställda och fortsätter att växa snabbt.

  

Vår vision är att förändra försäkringsbranschen genom att finnas tillgängliga och göra allt för våra kunder. Hemligheten bakom vår framgång är engagerade medarbetare som trivs på jobbet i kombination med en tydlig företagskultur. Nu ökar vi tempot för att fortsätta växa, behålla de mest engagerade medarbetarna och de nöjdaste kunderna. Vår resa har bara börjat!

 *Svenskt Kvalitetsindex (SKI) har tilldelat Svedea utmärkelsen Sveriges nöjdaste kunder i kategorin fordonsförsäkring 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 och 2024 samt i kategorin djurförsäkring 2023. Vi är även stolta vinnare av SKI för båtförsäkring 2025.*

title: Product Designer (parental leave cover)
description:
Design is about creating clarity where there is complexity. At Hemnet and for this role, this means helping agents connect with the right customers, at exactly the right moment.  

In Team Agent Products, we build experiences that make Hemnet the obvious choice for real estate agents across Sweden. Our mission is to create the best possible conditions for successful sales, stronger relationships, and new business opportunities.  

You’ll work in a clear B2B context, shaping the experience of how users and agents find each other, connect, and move forward together.


We’re now looking for a Product Designer who is comfortable leading discovery, translating insights into impactful solutions, and being a strong voice for our users – while balancing business goals and technical feasibility.


This is a parental leave cover starting April 1st, for approximately one year.


Apply by February 14.

 **What you’ll do**  

In the Agent Products domain, we’re responsible for the tools and experiences that help agents succeed on Hemnet. You’ll help us to:

* Make it seamless for visitors to contact an agent – and easy for agents to follow up
* Improve the experience of finding the right agent through Hemnet’s agent search
* Develop marketing products that help agents and offices stand out and reach future customers


You’ll lead discovery and design work end-to-end – from research and insights to polished user experiences, advocating for both agents and visitors throughout the process. Working closely with product managers, developers, and analysts, you will:

* Plan and run continuous user research, combining qualitative and quantitative methods
* Turn insights into clear problem definitions, hypotheses, and design direction
* Design user flows, prototypes, and intuitive interfaces with strong attention to detail
* Contribute to and evolve our design system and UI patterns
* Facilitate workshops, collaborate with stakeholders, and actively share learnings within the design community
* Define success metrics, run experiments and A/B tests, and follow up on impact to drive continuous improvement.


We work in small, cross-functional teams of PMs, developers, analysts, and product designers. We collaborate closely with our users through frequent testing and a constant flow of qualitative and quantitative insights. Our approach mixes fast iterative product development with strategic projects that move from hypothesis to experiment and launch – always learning openly from our results.

 **Who you are**

* A confident design/UX generalist who enjoys leading discovery and staying close to the craft of UI design
* A strong advocate for the user who can clearly explain trade-offs when conversion, revenue, and user value intersect
* Experienced in hypothesis-driven design, measurement, and experimentation – without losing sight of the bigger picture
* Fluent in both Swedish and English (spoken and written), and comfortable in Figma (or similar), prototyping, and design systems
* Bonus if you’ve worked with B2B products, strong stakeholder management experience and worked with experimentation.

 **Hello from your future manager**  

Hi! I’m Andreas, Head of Product Design at Hemnet. We’re now looking for a Product Designer to help us create the best possible experience for all the real estate agents out there, a role where you’ll combine strategy, research, and sharp UI design for a product used by millions of Swedes every week.


I lead our Product Design team of 13 full-stack designers and researchers – a group that’s both highly skilled and genuinely kind. We support each other, keep learning, and stay curious about topics like AI and how it can strengthen our design process. We work closely with Product, Tech, and Data in cross-functional teams, with a strong focus on creating real user value while balancing business goals.


As a manager, I’m ambitious and curious, and I love helping others grow. I try to create clarity and direction, while giving freedom and space for individual initiative. My colleagues describe me as driven and forward-thinking – but most importantly, as someone who truly believes in the power of the team.


I’m looking for someone communicative and confident leading through design; comfortable managing many stakeholders and driving initiatives from early discovery to polished UI. If you’ve also explored how AI can support design, that’s a big plus.


Why Hemnet?  

For me, it’s the mix of heart and impact. We’re big enough to make things happen – but small enough to stay fast and creative. And maybe most importantly: people here care. About our users, about each other, and about building something truly great together.  

We can’t wait to welcome you to our product design team!  

  

**A note on inclusion**  

At Hemnet, we believe diversity – across gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background, and life experience – makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.


If you meet most, but not all, of the criteria, we still encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, purpose, and a drive to learn and grow, just as much as your skills and experience.

 **Salary range**  

SEK 55.000 - 62.000
company_description: At Hemnet we help people find their dream homes.

title: Creative Designer
description:
**Vill du skapa kampanjer, idéer och visuella uttryck som får varumärken att lyfta?**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Perfekt, det är det vi jobbar med. Här på IPM Brand & Commuinication utvecklar vi **strategier, varumärkeskoncept och kampanjer** i tätt samarbete med företag och organisationer i hela södra Sverige. Från hustillverkare till arbetskläder till industrier. Nu letar vi efter en designer som vill bidra med form och känsla till koncept kampanjer på en av Sveriges roligaste arbetsplatser (tycker vi).

**Designer på IPM Brand & Communication?**
------------------------------------------


Som designer på IPM arbetar du med allt det som gör ett varumärke levande: kampanjidéer, annonsmaterial, konceptuttryck, sociala flöden, webbdesign och visuellt innehåll som får människor att agera. Du har din hemvist i teamet Varumärke & Koncept, där du jobbar nära Art Director, Copywriter, Planner och Creative Director för att utveckla och förfina det visuella uttrycket i både projekt och löpande uppdrag.


Du blir en viktig del av arbetet med att forma visuella idéer och ta dem vidare för att producera kampanjer och design. Du samarbetar också tätt med teamet Marknad & Sälj, där din design används i publicering och löpande kommunikation, och med team Webb & Teknik, där du tar fram UI och webbdesign tillsammans med bland annat vår UX-designer.

**Rollen är skapande, idénära och praktisk –** ***du är den som skapar och producerar den design som ska göra skillnad.***

**Vad kan vi erbjuda för roll?**
--------------------------------


Som en del av en digital varumärkesbyrå med ett fullserviceerbjudande får du möjlighet att arbeta med design i hela kundresan mot alla kanaler som är aktuella för tillfället. Ett tight strategiskt varumärkesteam ser till att du får vara med från start in till din producerande designroll och därför kunna bidra ur ett brett perspektiv i din roll.

* Du arbetar med att förvandla riktning, koncept och idéer till konkret design som fungerar i kampanjer, sociala medier, hemsidor och andra kreativa uttryck.
* Du är en del av team "Varumärke & Koncept" och bidrar i arbetet med att utveckla visuella idéer, uttryck och koncept tillsammans med AD, Copywriter, Planner och CD.
* Du samarbetar med team "Marknad & Sälj" för att skapa material som används i kampanjer, flöden och innehållsproduktion.
* Du tar fram UI-komponenter, animationer och webbdesign i Figma och arbetar tillsammans med UX-designer och utvecklare i Webb & Teknik.
* Du arbetar i hela det visuella flödet – från skiss och idétolkning till färdig produktion som håller ihop uttrycket och fungerar där det ska användas.
* Du blir en del av ett team där design, koncept och idéarbete sker i nära dialog och där alla är med och bygger det kreativa uttrycket för våra kunder.

**Vem är du?**
--------------


Du är en designer som trivs mitt i det kreativa och producerande. Du kan ta en idé från någon annan och utveckla den vidare, men du kan också själv se möjligheter i det som redan finns och göra det bättre. Du är inte rädd för att prova nya trender, metoder och tekniker och det känns naturligt för dig att ta en idé, testa och vara snabb med att hitta något som fungerar. Du gillar att arbeta där idé, form och funktion möts och du vet hur design behöver anpassas för att fungera i olika digitala kanaler och till olika målgrupper.


Du trivs i samarbeten, funkar bra i tvärdisciplinära team och uppskattar att arbeta nära roller som AD, Copy, Planner, UX-designers och utvecklare. Du kan ta ansvar för både dina egna leveranser och för helheten i de projekt du deltar i.

**Relevant erfarenhet**
-----------------------

* Du har arbetat på byrå eller som frilans med digital design och kan producera visuellt material för olika kanaler.
* Du har erfarenhet av grafisk produktion och kan utveckla design från brief till leverans (och original).
* Du har arbetat i team med kreatörer och specialister och förstår dynamiken i ett byråprojekt.
* Du har en portfolio som visar att du har känsla för visuellt uttryck, digitala ytor och designprinciper.

**Krav på dig som söker rollen**
--------------------------------

* Cirka 3+ års arbetslivserfarenhet inom digital design, grafisk design eller visuell produktion.
* Vana att arbeta i Figma samt Photoshop/Illustrator.
* Erfarenhet av att utgå från konceptuella riktlinjer, idéer eller brief.
* En portfolio som visar bredd och förståelse för digitalt visuellt arbete.

**Det är ett plus om du också har:**
------------------------------------

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta nära film- och fotoproduktioner.
* Vana vid enklare rörligt eller animerade format.
* Arbetat med AI-verktyg som stöd i kreativ produktion.
* Erfarenhet av webbdesign i projekt där design och utveckling arbetar tätt.

title: Design Lead
description:
**Design Lead — Set the quality bar for a product used by thousands every day**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Location:** Malmö (Hybrid)  

**Salary range:** 58,000–66,000 SEK/month


If you’re a design leader who cares deeply about craft, clarity, and building people and systems, this could be your next move.


We’re looking for a **Design Lead** to own design excellence at Refined — developing designers, setting clear standards, and ensuring our product experience stays coherent, polished, and intentional as we scale.

**Key points about the role at a glance**
-----------------------------------------


**Primary purpose:** Ensure consistently high-quality product design by developing designers and owning the standards, systems, and practices that enable great work at scale.


**Impact:** Directly shapes how thousands of customers experience Refined — while enabling designers, PMs, and engineers to move faster with confidence and clarity.


**Growth & development:** Manager and function leadership role with clear ownership, influence on product strategy, and the mandate to shape how design works at Refined.


**Team & leadership:** You’ll manage the Product Design team and partner closely with the Head of Product in a outcome-focused leadership setup.


**Salary range:** 58,000–66,000 SEK/month, depending on experience.


**This might not be for you if:**

* You want to be embedded in one team primarily doing design work
* You’re not excited about developing people, setting standards, and owning systems and processes

**Why this role matters**
-------------------------


As Refined grows, so does product complexity. Without a clear design owner, the risk is inconsistency, growing UX debt, slower decisions, and diluted user experience.


This role exists to **set and protect the quality bar**, develop designers’ craft and confidence, and ensure our design system and practices scale with the product — not against it.

### **This could be a great next step if you want to:**

* Be accountable for design quality across multiple products, not just one team
* Develop designers into confident decision-makers and strong partners
* Shape how design systems, critique, and standards actually work in practice
* Influence product strategy through user experience and design judgment
* Build clarity and coherence in complex, ambiguous problem spaces

**What you’ll do**
------------------


As our **Design Lead**, you’ll operate across product initiatives to ensure strong design leadership, quality, and alignment.

* Own design excellence at Refined by setting the quality bar, standards, and decision frameworks for UX, UI, and end-to-end product experiences
* Lead, develop, and line-manage Product Designers — growing craft, judgment, confidence, and accountability
* Own and evolve the design system and design review practices to enable consistency, quality, and speed at scale
* Act as the final design decision-maker when alignment is unclear, trade-offs are complex, or cross-team consistency is at stake
* Partner closely with the Head of Product to shape product vision and strategy from a user experience perspective
* Establish design as a trusted, credible partner to Product and Engineering through clear communication and follow-through

**What success looks like — your first year at Refined**
--------------------------------------------------------

* **In 3 months:**


	+ Strong relationships established with designers, PMs, and EMs
	+ Clear understanding of current UX gaps, design debt, and system maturity
	+ Design review and critique cadence established and actively used
	+ Initial quality bar and expectations clearly communicated to designers
* **In 6 months:**


	+ Designers demonstrate improved ownership, confidence, and consistency in design decisions
	+ Design system ownership is clearly defined, actively used, and trusted
	+ Cross-team UX inconsistencies are actively being addressed
	+ Design is seen as a credible, structured partner in product discovery and planning
* **In 12 months:**


	+ Consistently high design quality across product surfaces
	+ Design system is a core enabler of speed, quality, and coherence
	+ Designers operate as strong, trusted partners in product trios
	+ Design contributes meaningfully to product strategy and customer value
	+ Clear reduction in UX debt and fewer escalations around design decisions

**What you’ll bring**
---------------------


We’re looking for someone who enjoys setting direction, developing people, and making thoughtful trade-offs in complex environments.

### **Must-haves**

* Experience leading and developing product designers through coaching and feedback
* Experience scaling design practices (e.g. design systems) and influencing product direction in complex environments
* Strong design judgment with a clear point of view on quality and design standards
* Systems thinking across UX, UI, and end-to-end product experiences
* Proven track record of shipping complex product work
* Experience working closely with Product and Engineering leadership

### **Nice-to-haves**

* Exposure to enterprise or complex SaaS products
* Experience influencing product vision or strategy at leadership level


Above all, you’re **calm, credible, and opinionated in the right way** — someone who raises the bar without micromanaging and helps others do the same.

**Who you’ll work with**
------------------------


You’ll join our Product organization and work closely with:

* Product Designers (your direct reports)
* Product Managers and Engineering Managers
* Head of Product (your closest leadership partner)


We’re a global team with hubs in Malmö, Helsinki, and colleagues across Europe, the US, and Brazil. We meet in person at least twice a year during company-wide gatherings.

### **Benefits & salary**


We value transparency. Here’s what you can expect when you join Refined – specific details may vary by location, and we’ll go through them with you during the hiring process.


All employees receive benefits based on **Scandinavian standards**, with small variations per country:

* **Core benefits:** Pension, health insurance, sick leave, and five weeks of paid vacation.
* **Parental leave:** Paid parental leave to support new parents.
* **Work–life balance:** Flexible hours, hybrid work (typically 2–3 office days per week), and the trust to manage your own schedule.
* **Development & wellness:** Learning budget, wellness allowance, and dedicated time to grow personally and professionally.
* **Culture perks:** Twice-yearly company offsites, optional team events, and offices where fika and darts are part of the rhythm.
* **Global team:** This role is based in Malmö. Most colleagues are in these hubs, but we also have teammates in Brazil, New York, the Netherlands, Czech Republic, Germany, and Portugal.
* **Salary:** This role offers a salary range of **58000-66000 SEK** depending on experience. We share salary bands transparently in the hiring process to ensure clarity and fairness.

**About Refined**
-----------------


We make Atlassian tools simple, branded, and user-friendly – helping more than 5000 companies worldwide, from startups to Apple and Spotify, build sites their teams actually love to use. Read more about our products here>>


Refined is a **70-person SaaS company**, founded in Malmö in 2009 and now working across Malmö, Helsinki, and globally. We’re built on **Scandinavian roots** but our team represents **30+ nationalities**.


We value **freedom and autonomy**, which for us means taking initiative, gathering context, focusing on impact, and driving things forward. It’s about **getting it right over being right.**


People thrive here when they lean into challenges, learn by doing, and care about the impact of their work – on colleagues, customers, and the wider ecosystem. Every role has a **direct line to customer outcomes**, and you’ll see your work shaping how thousands of people experience Atlassian every day.


We’re also proud members of Pledge 1%, giving back to people and the planet.


**In short:** we’re product-led, human-centered, and impact-driven – a startup-minded SaaS company filled with passionate people who care deeply, challenge directly, and continuously improve together.


Learn more about life at working at Refined>>

### **Recruitment process**

**We are** reviewing applications on a rolling basis.


For any questions, reach out to **Chloe** for a confidential chat about the role. chloe.nauta@refined.com


After submitting your application, here’s what to expect:

* Fill out a pre-screening **logic and personality test** via Alva Labs.
* The next steps include **an introductory call and two interviews** focusing on competence and cultural fit.
* Finally, if we believe it’s a good match both ways, we’ll give you **an offer.**


We look forward to your application and potentially welcoming you to Refined!

*We started Refined in 2009 with a simple idea: Enterprise software doesn’t have to be boring. Since then, Refined has evolved from a handy theming tool into a full-fledged site builder, helping more than 5,000 companies worldwide transform their Atlassian Confluence and Jira instances into beautiful, branded sites users love.*

title: Creative Intern
description:
**✨ Creative Intern — Storytelling, UX, and Visual Design - Praktik** 




  





*Do you enjoy taking work that already has soul and completely reimagining it — not just a facelift, but a new life? Are you a content creator or design talent, a distinctive website builder, a visual thinker, or a media creator with a Nordic soul and a sharp creative eye? Do you blend cinematic intuition with AI-native tools like Runway, ElevenLabs, and ChatGPT — turning deep ideas into bold, visually intelligent narratives that move brands and audiences alike?* 




  





 We’re looking for a creative intern to join Freja North Studios — a newly launched, boutique Scandinavian creative house focused on visual storytelling, web design, media, and feminine brand building. A creative intern who can blend UX/design craft with multimedia storytelling and AI-driven content repurposing.
 



  





**🌿 About Us** 




  





**Freja North Studios** 
 is a multidisciplinary creative studio built for a new generation of thinkers and makers. We create beautiful, intelligent experiences across
 **branding, design, writing, UX, and short-form media, content creation** 
 , blending myth, emotion, and minimalism into everything we touch.
 



  





 Founded by the creators of
 **Swiss Finance Academy** 
 and
 **Britannica Capital** 
 , our studio operates at the intersection of
 **creativity, education, and entrepreneurship** 
 , with a strong international and digital presence.
 



  





**✨ What You’ll Do** 




  




* Assist with visual and UX design for websites and brand touchpoints.
* Turn archival Freja, Rogue Billionaire, Britannica and Swiss Finance Academy content into short multimedia case studies, narratives, and lesson modules using tools like ElevenLabs, Runway, Claude, ChatGPT, Google Flow/Veo, etc.
* Collaborate on short-form storytelling and content (e.g., Instagram, LinkedIn, Notion, YouTube shorts, Substack).
* Support story development, campaign ideas, and narrative voice.
* Contribute to moodboards, user journeys, or simple Figma flows.
* Learn to work in an aesthetic-driven, feedback-rich, fast-moving environment.



  





**🌸 You’re a great fit if you:** 




  




* Are based in Sweden (or Nordic-adjacent) and fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).
* Love beautiful, thoughtful design, storytelling, and emotionally intelligent brands.
* Have an eye for detail and care about visuals, spacing, tone, and mood.
* Want to work in a small, independent, values-driven team where your ideas matter.
* Are excited to repurpose long-form archival material into polished multimedia case studies using generative-AI workflows.



  





**🌿** 
 Bonus If You:
 



  




* Have experience with Wix, Runway, Google Veo 3, Flow, Figma, Webflow, Canva, or Notion.
* Enjoy writing or have experience in brand voice, social captions, or content design.
* Are familiar with Scandinavian or feminine aesthetics, branding, or visual storytelling.



  





 🕊 What We Offer:
 



  




* Östermalm studio setting.
* Mentorship within a respectful team. Predictable rhythm, Swedish/English communication, and portfolio-worthy proof of work.
* A creative studio that prioritizes depth, quality, and emotional clarity over corporate buzzwords.
* Close mentorship from a founder with deep entrepreneurial and creative expertise.
* Potential to grow into a larger role in branding, content, or design leadership.



  





 We’re the Stockholm-based creative arm of a global fund with roots in New York, now shaping a new kind of brand voice — one that speaks through cinematic storytelling, immersive visuals, and intuitive design, not just pitch decks and PDFs.
 



  





 Ideal for candidates with experience in writing, editing, video production, social media, website design, CMS, animations, brand creation, story-telling and AI tools for social presence.
 



  





 This is not
 *just* 
 a Canva project. This is your chance to create a visual story that conveys gravitas, edge, and global strategic intelligence.
 



  





**🌿** 
 What you will also get to contribute to:
 



  




* You’ll help create entertainment and educational modules, stories, and case studies.
* Improving and enhancing websites including mobile versions.
* Creating CMS and other dynamic content.
* Improving design for direct email and investor newsletters.
* Leveraging tools like Runway, Pika Labs, ChatGPT, and ElevenLabs to storyboard, animate, voice, and fine-tune the final deliverable.
* Working directly with the founder — a globally traveled Wall Street pro and builder — to refine message, tone, and visual intensity.
* Ensuring all output feels institutional-grade, not templated or commercial.
* Designing and producing short-form documentary teasers that presents a hedge fund story like no other — combining finance, geopolitical depth, and frontier-building narrative.



  





  





**🌸** 
 You should have:
 



  




* Desire to create or improve content
* Strong visual taste and creative judgment (this is more “Vice docu-meets-Wall Street elite” than startup explainer video).
* Experience (or fast-learning capability) with AI video tools like Runway or Pika, plus voice tools like ElevenLabs.
* Ability to use ChatGPT to prototype scripts or narratives, then refine beyond the generic.
* High self-direction and brutal attention to detail — this is a serious deliverable.
* Communication and Marketing skills
* Video Production and Photography skills
* Wix, AI and CMS skills.



  





 Internship Details:
 



  




* Onsite based in Östermalm, Stockholm
* Can be part time or full time
* Unpaid. This is Swedish
 **Praktik** 
 : This has an educational and professional development component so it is unpaid.
* Tailored for those ready to step beyond the academic and into the world of real storytelling.
* Our company's or affiliates locations include New York, Connecticut, London, Zurich and Stockholm.



  





 Portfolio submission encouraged

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Ready to make a paws-itive impact in the pet world? Join
 **Lassie** 
 , the InsurTech company growing fast across the Swedish, German, and French pet markets. With €23 million in Series B funding, we are on a mission to build the best pet insurance experience out there.
 


  


 As we continue to scale, we are looking for a
 **Senior Product Manager** 
 to help shape what comes next. If you enjoy building products that solve real customer problems and drive measurable impact, we would love to hear from you. You will report to the Head of Product.
 


  


**Location requirement:** 
 This role is based in Stockholm, and candidates must either be located in Stockholm or be able to visit our Stockholm office at least twice per week.
 


  

 Tasks
   


**What you’ll lead:** 



  


**End-to-end product management.** 
 You will identify high-impact opportunities, define the right problems to solve, and work closely with Design and Engineering to deliver solutions that move key metrics.
 


  


**Strategic product planning.** 
 You will partner with the Head of Product to shape how Lassie evolves into a broader pet care ecosystem.
 


  


**Multi-track execution.** 
 You will keep several initiatives moving at the same time, while staying clear on priorities and impact.
 


  


**Cross-team collaboration.** 
 You will connect product direction with Marketing, Country Managers, Claims, and Customer Support, making sure decisions are understood and executed well across the organisation.
 


  


**Impact measurement.** 
 You will define success metrics, run experiments, track outcomes, and bring learnings back into the roadmap quickly.
 


  


**No job is too small.** 
 Whether it is improving content, updating translations, or drafting customer comms, you will step in where needed to keep momentum high.
 


  

 Requirements
   


**Who you are:** 



  


**Strategic and decisive** 
 . You can move between long-term thinking and hands-on execution, and you know how to make smart trade-offs.
 


  


**A proactive owner.** 
 You spot opportunities and act on them without waiting for someone to ask.
 


  


**Data-informed and insight-driven.** 
 You use data well, but you also trust judgment and customer insight.
 


  


**Comfortable with structure, but not dependent on it.** 
 You use frameworks when they help, and you know when to keep things simple.
 


  


**Collaborative.** 
 You work well with engineers and designers and know how to get the best out of a team.
 


  


**Customer-focused.** 
 You build a deep understanding of pet parents and bring that into product decisions.
 


  


**Hands-on.** 
 You are happy to jump into whatever gap exists today so the team can ship value fast.
 


  

 Benefits
   


**What we offer:** 



  

  
2. Health & wellbeing - Monthly contribution toward employees’ health and wellbeing
  
4. Flexible working - Hybrid working model with flexibility to balance home and office work
  
6. Equipment - Company-provided laptop, headset, and mouse
  
8. Pet-friendly perks - Employee discount on our pet insurance
  


  


 Culture & community
   

  

 - The opportunity to be part of a dynamic company in an early growth phase
   

  

 - A flexible, welcoming, and ambitious company culture
   

  

 - A collaborative, international working environment
   

  

 - Working on a unique product that helps pets live longer, healthier lives
   

  

 - Regular social events and team-building activities
 


  


***We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Lassie. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.***

title: Communication Officer – Branding and Design Lead - based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General Directorate (SG), Communications Department (COM), Publishing Division (PUB) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **Communication Officer – Branding and Design Lead\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark Officer Corporate Communication


***Panel interviews are anticipated for end of February 2026.***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will manage and coordinate the branding direction and visual identity across the EIB Group’s digital and physical content, as well as its branded items, in line with the corporate communication strategy and action plan, in order to ensure attractiveness, brand recognition and visual consistency across all design outputs and the delivery of high-quality visual solutions, thereby contribution to the increased awareness and understanding of the EIB Group activities and to protect and enhance the EIB’s external identity and reputation.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The Communication Department ensures the EIB Group’s activities are known and valued by its stakeholders and the general public. It interacts with external and internal audiences and ensures the EIB Group engages with them in an open and accountable way.
   

  

 The Publishing division is the content powerhouse of the department. Its mission is to develop engaging, timely and relevant content to support the EIB Group’s interaction with its audiences across all communication channels.
   

  

 You are responsible for setting the branding direction and visual identity across the EIB Group’s digital and physical content, as well as its branded items. You ensure attractiveness, brand recognition and visual consistency across all design outputs and the delivery of high-quality visual solutions. You act as a guardian of the EIB Group’s visual identity and ensure the proper use of the logo both internally and externally. You oversee creative agencies, consultant graphic designers, and composition / typesetting companies to design and produce some 150 publications a year, all branded items (such as gift and stationery items) and conference materials (such as physical or digital backdrops, marketing materials, and roll-ups). You provide branding direction for the corporate website, social media channels, audiovisual materials, and corporate presentations. You introduce new graphic design technology and AI tools. You ensure the proper functioning and ongoing development of the EIB Group web shop where staff members can order their branded items. You ensure effective planning, contract and budget management.
   

  

 This is an exciting role that requires proven design ability and sensitivity, the desire and motivation to coordinate in-house consultants and external service providers towards continued visual excellence, an interest in working on both physical and digital products, and the willingness to research and adopt the best tools available for top-quality online publishing.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Develop and maintain the EIB Group’s visual identity, ensuring consistency across all platforms.
* Prepare and periodically update EIB logo guidelines.
* Oversee the supply of branded materials for events, meetings, and conferences, and manage the ongoing development of the Web shop.
* Provide art direction and coordinate designers, creative agencies (digital, web, print), and typesetting companies to ensure quality and brand coherence.
* Manage day-to-day design and production operations, ensuring timely delivery to the highest standards.
* Conceptualise and implement innovative designs for physical and digital products and content.
* Create and maintain reusable visualisation templates — static and animated — for social media production.
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies, particularly AI, in digital graphic design and animation.
* Work closely with editors, marketers, social media and audiovisual specialists, and other colleagues to develop impactful visual stories that inspire engaging content across all media.
* Encourage a culture of creative innovation within the team by sharing examples and facilitating experimentation with new formats and tools (e.g., AI-assisted design, data storytelling).
* Regularly monitor and benchmark design and communication practices from leading institutions and brands to identify best practices, trends, and innovative formats for publications, digital products, and campaigns.
* Ensure effective planning and budget management for design and production activities.
* Contribute to the development and implementation of the EIB Group’s overall communication strategy and assist in setting division priorities and activities.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in graphic art, design or related field.
* At least 5 years of relevant professional experience in graphic arts or design within communication agencies or corporate/institutional environments, of which at least 3 years’ experience in managing design projects
* Comprehensive knowledge of multimedia and print production processes.
* Experience in web design and digital design principles.
* Awareness of the latest AI tools and applications for graphic design.
* Background in advertising is considered an asset.
* Basic understanding of the EU institutional and political framework.
* Strong foundation in UX/UI design and familiarity with AI-enhanced workflows to deliver intuitive, responsive, and visually compelling digital experiences.
* Proficiency in design software, particularly Adobe Creative Suite, and UX platforms such as Figma.
* Excellent command of MS Office and template creation tools; good knowledge of mapping, animation, and infographic software.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications:
 **2nd February 2026**

title: Content- och Webbkoordinator
description:
Brinner du för att skapa innehåll som både engagerar och guidar kunder, och som dessutom förbättrar den digitala kundupplevelsen? Vill du arbeta nära andra digitala specialister på ett bolag med en stark företagskultur, där du får vara med och påverka, utveckla och bidra tillsammans med engagerade kollegor? Då kan vi på Svedea ha rätt utmaning för dig!
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Content- och webbkoordinator som vill ta ett helhetsgrepp om innehållet på vår webb och vara med och forma hur våra kunder möter oss digitalt. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta kundnära, ta ansvar och se till att våra texter på webben verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Content- och webbkoordinator ansvarar du för att hålla samman och vidareutveckla innehållet på vår webb www.svedea.se och www.bilig.se, och säkerställer att informationen är tydlig, relevant och i linje med vårt varumärke.
   

  

 Du kommer främst att arbeta med innehåll på våra produkt- och informationssidor, men också stötta i andra digitala projekt. Det kan handla om att uppdatera texter inför lanseringar till att skapa guider som hjälper våra kunder att förstå försäkring på ett enklare sätt, alltid med kundens behov i fokus.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att:
   

  

* Skriva och redigera texter för webb, framför allt produktsidor och informativa, guidande artiklar.
* Hålla ihop och planera innehållsproduktion tillsammans med kollegor på Marknad, Produkt och Digital.
* Säkerställa att allt innehåll följer Svedeas tonalitet och ger ett enhetligt intryck.
* Hitta sätt att förbättra och uppdatera innehåll utifrån data, insikter och kundfeedback.
* Hjälpa till i större digitala projekt, t.ex. vid nya produktsläpp samt identifiera behov av webbutveckling.
* Bidra med idéer och inspiration kring hur vi kan utveckla vårt digitala innehåll.


 Du kommer att tillhöra vårt team Digital. Vi är ett härligt och glatt gäng på 7 personer, alla med olika expertiser men med ett gemensamt fokus på digital försäljning. Teamet består bl.a av digitala marknadsförare, konverteringsoptimerare, UX/UI-designers och webbanalytiker. Vi arbetar i skärningspunkten mellan kund, affär och teknik.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 På Svedea lägger vi stor vikt vid personlighet och potential. Vi söker dig som tycker om att skriva och du gör det riktigt bra. Du har ett öga för detaljer och brinner för att skapa innehåll som är tydligt, inspirerande och lätt att ta till sig. Du tycker om att samarbeta med andra och du gör det gärna tvärfunktionellt med olika delar av organisationen. Samtidigt är du trygg i att arbeta självständigt och tar egna initiativ och ansvar för att föra uppgifter i mål. Som person är du även nyfiken och positiv, och du har en naturlig förmåga att få saker att hända. Du uppskattar en kultur där man hjälps åt, där det finns utrymme för idéer och där förbättringar välkomnas. Och framför allt gillar du att skapa innehåll som faktiskt gör skillnad för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi tror att du:
   

  

* har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom media, kommunikation, journalistik eller motsvarande
* har minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med innehåll i digitala kanaler (gärna webb)
* har förståelse och ett intresse för SEO, UX och tillgänglighet
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta i CMS; vi arbetar i Umbraco
* talar och skriver flytande svenska då all vår kommunikation sker på svenska samt har känsla för tonalitet


 Gillar du dessutom att nörda ner dig i data eller har erfarenhet av verktyg som Google Analytics eller Clarity är det ett stort plus.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* På Svedea blir du en del av ett gäng som gillar att tänka nytt, samarbeta och hela tiden förbättra oss. Vi har en kultur där man får ta ansvar, testa idéer och vara sig själv. Här kommer du in i ett team som brinner för digital utveckling och där innehåll är en viktig del av kundupplevelsen.
* En inspirerade företagskultur som kännetecknas av laganda med passionerade och engagerande kollegor som förstår vikten av att hjälpas åt och att ha kul tillsammans. Mer om vår kultur hittar du här! 💙
* Möjlighet till visst distansarbete med minst 3 dagar på kontoret/vecka för att balansera privat- och arbetsliv
* En arbetsplats som befinner sig i en spännande expansiv fas där dina tankar och idéer uppmuntras 🚀
* Ett riktigt schysst förmånspaket och möjlighet till en årlig bonus. Läs mer om våra förmåner här!
* Kontor högst upp i ett av Kungsholmens häftigaste hus med 360 graders vy över stan och terrasser i flera väderstreck. Spana in vår Office tour nedan 👇


**Låter det intressant?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi arbetar löpande med urval så vänta inte utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag, sista ansökningsdag är den 22 februari. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Observera att vi enbart tar emot ansökningar via länken i annonsen. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Caroline Sundvik på mejl Caroline.Sundvik@svedea.se eller telefon: 072-141 14 94.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

*Tester och arbetsprov kan förekomma i samband med rekryteringsprocessen.*
**Om Svedea**
 Svedea är en framgångssaga. Våra första 16 år har gjort oss till det ledande bolaget inom försäkring av fritidsfordon som motorcykel, båt och snöskoter och vi är en stark utmanare inom bil-, djur- och företagsförsäkring. Efter önskemål från våra kunder erbjuder vi nu även hem- och villaförsäkring. Idag har vi omkring 430 000 kunder, är över 300 anställda och fortsätter att växa snabbt.
   

  

 Vår vision är att förändra försäkringsbranschen genom att finnas tillgängliga och göra allt för våra kunder. Hemligheten bakom vår framgång är engagerade medarbetare som trivs på jobbet i kombination med en tydlig företagskultur. Nu ökar vi tempot för att fortsätta växa, behålla de mest engagerade medarbetarna och de nöjdaste kunderna\*. Vår resa har bara börjat!
   

  

* Svenskt Kvalitetsindex (SKI) har tilldelat Svedea utmärkelsen Sveriges nöjdaste kunder i kategorin fordonsförsäkring 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 och 2024 samt i kategorin djurförsäkring 2023. Vi är även stolta vinnare av SKI för båtförsäkring 2025.

title: Senior Product Designer - ZEOS Design and Research (all genders)
description:
ZEOS is part of Zalando, leveraging the company’s infrastructure, technology, and expertise to build an operating system for fashion & lifestyle. Established in 2023, ZEOS is developing tools that allow brands and retailers to manage their multi-channel business in one place. We aim to enable seamless e-commerce across Europe from new market entry and expansion to optimization and business steering. The first ZEOS product is called ZEOS Fulfilment, and it gives brands and retailers the ability to fulfil their multi-channel sales using one stock pool, one carrier integration, and one user interface. Being a small unit within a big company enables us to act fast, but with the backup from one of the leading online platforms for fashion and lifestyle in Europe.
   

  

 Over the last years, we learned at Zalando that solving fulfilment related challenges for the good of our merchants helps us to fuel the growth of our platform.
   

  

 Strengthened by this successful growth, we have started the next step in our journey - expanding our business outside of the Zalando ecosystem, exploring both physical and digital services. Zalando launched the ZEOS brand last year (short for Zalando E-commerce Operating System), aiming to build an operating system for the fashion and lifestyle industry that enables brands and retailers to manage their multi-channel business across Europe within one unified platform.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 in the ZEOS Design & Research team, you will be responsible for customer-facing digital experiences for our ZEOS Logistics service offerings. Your joint mission is to empower fashion and lifestyle brands to expand their business and increase their profitability across multiple marketplaces and countries throughout Europe through ZEOS.
   

  

 Using your excellent craft skills and seasoned experience, you will design 0 to 1 experiences that empower brands and retailers to steer their multi-channel logistics for their business from our ZEOS digital touchpoints. This is an important role that will help shape the vision for the user experiences for ZEOS, and requires strong foundational UX skills, exceptional stakeholder management, experience in workshop facilitation, and in crafting and evangelising design strategies and visions.
   

  

  

****INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN****
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusion
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* You would work with cross-functional teams (product managers, product researchers, fellow designers, & developers) to drive the design vision and strategy for our new multichannel offering that will deliver the best possible experience for both our merchants and their end customers.
* You’ll lead the design of complex customer journeys that cut across multiple pillars, services and teams.
* You’ll help lead stakeholders and team members towards innovative and engaging solutions by conducting design thinking workshops and design sprints that leverage user research.
* You’ll apply strategic thinking to visualise ideas and concepts and communicate them effectively and compellingly for internal stakeholders, partners and customers
* You’ll work to validate and refine concepts with internal and external stakeholders including actual merchants and end users
* You’ll lead by example by producing high-quality work no matter how big or small the task may be.
* You’ll foster design excellence by helping to set the bar for design quality through your own work, and will mentor fellow designers via rituals such as critiques and office hours.


**WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
* Experience You are a seasoned design professional with B2B experience that has led the design for complex projects which have delivered valuable end-to-end experiences to your users. You aren’t afraid of ambiguity and you are inspired to dive deep and solve complex and meaningful problems that resonate with customers and their end users. You are adept at bringing various threads together into a unified design strategy that can be understood and executed on by product teams.
* Collaboration You work collaboratively with product managers, engineers, stakeholders and users to understand and define the key problems and desired experiences for solutions, owning the design thread from discovery through delivery.
* Curiosity You are curious about the industry in which you work and the needs of your customers, which allows you to creatively solve their problems.
* Craft You possess expert knowledge in the end-to-end product design process, demonstrating a command of product and design strategy, distillation of problem statements, user needs, journey mapping, wireframing, prototyping, user testing, and the creation of high fidelity visuals. You know how to bring everything together in the form of useful solutions and usable and delightful interactions for our users.
* Experimentation You have a generative approach, strive to solve problems in the best way possible through iteration, leveraging data and insights to drive future iterations and features.
* Delivery You scope and define deliverables and ensure developers have everything they need to build the designed solution. You ensure a remarkable quality of what goes live.
* Empathy You have the mindset and methodologies to understand your customers, colleagues and employees.
* Storytelling You bring not just users but also stakeholders and employees on a journey, enabling them to truly understand the end customer and vision and experience you are setting out to deliver, and the ‘why’ behind your design decisions.


****OUR OFFER****
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

  

* Employee shares program
* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Lounge by Zalando, discounts from external partners
* 2 paid volunteering days a year
* Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 27 days of vacation a year to start for full-time employees
* Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
* Family services, including counseling and support
* Health and wellbeing options (including Wellhub, formerly Gympass)
* Mental health support and coaching available
* Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review

title: Business Analyst within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions supports health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 As a Business Analyst, you will be a part of an agile development team including developers and testers. You will also collaborate closely with product owner(s), other business analysts, informaticians, architects and UX designers. You will investigate and analyze needs, detail requirements, and design solutions for one of Sweden’s leading healthcare journal systems. You are an important link between the developers and the customer, with the mission to understand the needs of our end users and translate them into technical solutions. You often get to follow an initiative all the way from pre-study to development and implementation at the customer's premises. As part of our team, you will do meaningful work where you help to improve and digitize healthcare processes.
   

  

 We are currently looking for Business Analysts who will be working with areas such as e.g. Resource Planning, Bed Management, Link, eVisit modules, Digital Invitation (DI), and Regulatory requirements. You will be working with creating both functional and non-functional requirements.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 You work independently and with your own drive but also thrive when you get the opportunity to collaborate with your teammates, other Business Analysts, as well as other roles across the organization. You like to meet our customers, partners and eHealth organizations and are passionate about finding the best solutions. We believe that you are analytical, well-structured and with strong cooperation skills.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Minimum 3 years of working with business analysis, requirement analysis, product design or similar.
* Great knowledge in how business needs can be translated into software requirements.
* Great ability to collaborate with product owner(s), architects, system developers and UX designers.
* Comfortable using AI tools and eager to explore how they can enhance requirement work.
* Communicates fluently in English and Swedish.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Experience of health informatics, and/or integration work (e.g. API design).
* Knowledge of healthcare standards and specifications (FHIR, HL7v2, RIVTA, OpenEHR, SNOMED CT)
* Previously worked within healthcare
* Experience of COSMIC and related integration solutions
* Experience in working with agile software development
* Experience in UX design


**Place of employment:** 
 Linköping or Stockholm
   

  

**Scope:** 
 Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life. Read more about us here!
   

  

 A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible -explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Founding Frontend Engineer - AI x Music
description:
**Founding Frontend Engineer — AI Music (Onsite, Stockholm)** 




**TL;DR –** 
 We are a team of decacorn alumni backed by global investors. We're seeking an exceptional Founding Frontend Engineer to build the next generation of AI-powered music experiences for businesses.
 



 You’ll help design and scale the core systems that bring intelligence, personalization, and creativity into the world’s sound environments.
 



  





**Why join?** 




 We’re reimagining how businesses use music — blending artistic intelligence with machine intelligence. Our AI generates and curates perfectly tailored soundtracks that adapt to brand identity, customer mood, and context in real time.
 



 We’re an early-stage company headquartered in Stockholm, and we’re assembling a founding team that thrives at the intersection of AI, data, and music.
 



 Founders are serial entrepreneurs who had raised venture capital, build an international customer list and exited companies before, with previous experience scaling companies like Spotify, Wolt & Klarna. Even though we're in Stealth mode, we've attracted founding by top tech investors including a billion dollar fund and decacorn founders and we're already live with customers.
 



  





 This is a unique opportunity to shape both the product and the company — from architecture to culture.
 



 We value:
 


* High ownership and creativity
* Entrepreneurial problem-solving
* Craftsmanship, pragmatism, and speed
* A love for music, technology, and real-world impact



  





  





**What we’re looking for** 



* 5+ years designing, building & scaling frontend systems for production products
* Proficient in JavaScript/TypeScript, with experience building modern web applications using React and Next.js.
* AI native, strong experience with Claude Code and/or Cursor.
* Skilled in React (and React Native), with a proven track record developing high performance apps. Bonus if familiarity with Expo, Reanimated, Nitro Modules, and the broader React Native ecosystem.
* Experience crafting beautiful user interfaces
* Strong product sense — you care about what we build and why, not just how
* Demonstrate a passion for delivering high-quality code, with particular emphasis on polish, performance, and scalability.
* Excellent eye for design, animations, and interactions.



  





**Bonus:** 



* Exhibit excellent problem-solving abilities and effective communication skills, especially when collaborating with customers.
* Backend expertise in Node.js and AI-driven services.
* Interest/Experience working with AI models and APIs (e.g., OpenAI, fine-tuned models, or LLM-based applications).
* Familiarity with cloud-based architectures and serverless platforms, particularly within the Vercel ecosystem.



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Architect, implement, and operate our frontend applications and infrastructure.
* Design and/or integrate APIs and systems powering our real-time music personalization engine
* Work closely with ML, product, and creative teams to turn ideas into live experiences
* Define technical direction, standards, and the culture of the engineering org
* Help hire and mentor the next wave of engineers



  





**How we hire** 



* A short intro call
* A technical conversation focused on systems design and problem-solving
* A deep dive into your most impactful project
* Meet the team in Stockholm and jam with us about the future of AI + music



  





**What we offer** 



* Competitive salary
* Significant equity stake for our founding engineering team (not options, actual equity)
* A culture of excellence and continuous learning
* A chance to impact how billions of people interact with music



  





**About Your Application** 




 Please apply in English — it’s our working language.
 



 We’re open to exceptional builders from all backgrounds, but this role is onsite in Stockholm

title: Principal Product Manager
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the** 
**sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**The role**
 As a Principal Product Manager, you will play a crucial role in shaping the future of Soundtracking. Your role will be to shape the strategy, development, and execution of the AI, ML and agentic capabilities that enable our product teams to build exceptional user-facing experiences.
   

  

 You will act as the strategic bridge between our capability-building teams and user-facing product teams. By anticipating future needs and translating company-level strategies into a concrete roadmap, you ensure our product teams can move faster and deliver differentiated experiences. You will work closely with senior leadership, engineering, research, data, design, and marketing to align work with broader company strategies and ensure we stay ahead of the curve.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Strategy and vision: Shape the cross-company AI/ML strategy by translating industry trends and high-level goals into a long-term capabilities roadmap. You identify where AI can meaningfully improve the customer experience and ensure development is aligned with business priorities.
* Cross organizational leadership: Act as the primary bridge between capability-building teams and client-facing product teams. You lead through ambiguity, translating user needs into clear, scalable technical requirements and driving strategic alignment across all stakeholders.
* Execution and delivery: Lead complex, cross-functional projects from concept to launch. You manage the end-to-end development of AI-powered features, ensuring quality, consistency, and measurable success across user-facing surfaces.
* Customer and market Leadership: Conduct deep market analysis and build strong relationships with partners and stakeholders. You use these insights to identify opportunities where AI can drive distinct value and elevate the overall user experience.
* Organization development and mentorship: Provide thought leadership on AI product direction and influence senior executives on critical tradeoffs. You actively mentor Product Managers and help uplift product practices and strategy development across the organization.


**Requirements:**
* 12+ years of Product Management experience, with strong experience in AI/ML product domains.
* A proven track record of bringing complex, technical, or data-driven products from concept to launch, driving major business impact.
* Proven success in shaping strategy across multiple teams or product lines and driving shared outcomes.
* Deep knowledge of industry trends, emerging AI practices and competitive landscape, with the ability to apply these insights to shape the strategy and roadmap.


**it would also be music to our ears if you have:**
* Exceptional ability to synthesize complex information and translate ambiguous concepts into clear user and business value.
* Strong storytelling and communication skills, capable of defining long-term strategy with clarity and conviction for executive audiences.
* You thrive in fast-moving environments and operate with an organization-first mindset, easily switching between strategic altitude and tactical clarity.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
   

  

**Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound.**
 In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Sam Hall, Chief Product Officer where he shares why he fell in love with Epidemic Sound, what the role of a Product Manager at Epidemic Sound entails and learning to lead in a different culture.
   

  

 Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if it's your vibe.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Senior Product Manager - B2B Experience
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 We are looking for a Senior Product Manager for our B2B Experience Team. This role is located at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 This is an exciting opportunity to lead the evolution of our product by defining and delivering innovative workflows, ensuring our solution is truly fit for purpose for businesses, enterprises, and professional teams.
   

  

 This role owns the vision, strategy, and execution of B2B workflows and experiences that enable teams to collaborate effectively, operate at scale, and realise value from our product across their organisation. You will focus on how multi-user, multi-role teams use our product day to day, and how those workflows support adoption, efficiency, and growth.
   

  

 You’ll be a key part of our B2B Product organisation within Growth Product, whose mission is to attract, retain, and expand enterprise and business customers by delivering scalable, intuitive, and organisation-ready product experiences.
   

  

 You’ll report to the SVP of Product, Growth, and work closely with a highly talented group of engineering, design, finance, marketing, and commercial partners to drive meaningful change. This is a hands-on role with significant scope to influence both the product and the business.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define, own, and evolve the vision and strategy for B2B workflows and experiences, ensuring our product is fit for purpose for teams and organisations while supporting customer and business goals.
* Build and maintain deep relationships with B2B customers and internal partners (Sales, Customer Success) to understand real-world team workflows and translate those needs into clear product direction
* Expertly communicate with internal stakeholders to make sure we are building the right things, tracking success metrics, and communicating developments.
* Collaborate with technical peers in the daily operations to ensure delivery by also keeping an eye on capabilities, happiness, resilience, and growth to empower the team.


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of Product Management experience, in B2B SaaS products.
* Proven ability to solve complex, ambiguous problems, balancing customer needs with scalable, long-term product thinking
* Experience designing multi-user, multi-role workflows and products that serve teams and enterprise customers.
* Strong ownership and decision-making skills, including setting priorities, making trade-offs, and being accountable for workflow outcomes
* Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills, able to influence stakeholders across Product, Engineering, Design and Sales
* Data-driven and outcome-oriented, with experience defining success metrics, tracking adoption, and iterating based on insights
* The ability to lead in complex and uncertain environments and thrive when you drive change and create structure


**Nice to have:**
* Experience working in dual B2C/B2B product environments


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.

 In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Sam Hall, Chief Product Officer where he shares why he fell in love with Epidemic Sound, what the role of a Product Manager at Epidemic Sound entails and learning to lead in a different culture.
   

  

 Thinking about joining us?
 **Tune in** 
 - and see if it's your vibe.
