The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.  
 



  





  




  


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.********

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You are someone who thrives in a high-performance environment, bringing a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle meaningful challenges that have a real impact.
   

  

 In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we’ll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities to help you quickly broaden your expertise, grow into a well-rounded professional, and contribute to work that truly makes a difference.
   

  

 When you join us, you will have:
   

  

* Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
* A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions, all while upholding our unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
* Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
* Exceptional benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


**Your Impact**
 You will work closely with 1-2 of our Senior Partners, providing dedicated support, proactively organizing and managing their complex workday and creating meaningful external relations.
   

  

 You will be in daily contact with national and international colleagues and clients, as well as planning internal and external events. You will work in a warm, caring, and fun work atmosphere in the center of Stockholm with highly motivated professionals as your colleagues.
   

  

 You will become part of a team of professional and dedicated Executive Assistants, who daily daily support each other through knowledge sharing, giving a helping hand when needed, and cover as backup for each other.
   

  

 You will proactively manage your Partner’s calendar and travel arrangements, provide broad administrative support, manage incoming communications, and prioritize emails to help organize and leverage time effectively as well as driving ad hoc tasks of various size and complexity. Moreover, you will assist in preparing presentations and materials, ensuring that the material is complete and accurate. Therefore, it is a prerequisite that you have excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish.
   

  

 As a person you are proactive, entrepreneurial, and resilient with a professional can-do attitude and always willing to go the extra mile. You find it exciting, challenging, and rewarding to successfully solve problems as part of your everyday job. You remain service-minded in your approach, exhibiting a high level of professionalism and exercise discretion.
   

  

**Your Qualifications and Skills**
* +2 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or from a similar fast-paced and high standard environment
* Customer-oriented mindset and approach: your focus is on how to best support our Partners, clients and colleagues
* Entrepreneurial, highly motivated, have great organizational skills, and you enjoy solving calendar scheduling as well as other administrative tasks
* Reliable, flexible and adaptable to changes, detail-oriented and can handle expenses and timesheets with accuracy and care
* Enjoys working in a dynamic environment with caring colleagues
* Proactive self-starter with a positive can-do attitude
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools
* Efficient in driving improvements and embracing challenges as opportunities for development
* Embodies McKinsey culture, adheres to firm policies, and acts as a role model
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English and Swedish at native level

title: Date Center Technician, Data Center Operations
description:
**Description**
 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 We are looking for Data Center Technicians to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. Data Center Technicians are the primary resolver and troubleshoot and solve a range of data center infrastructure issues including, but not limited to: hardware, fiber, networking, and related problems. You will be part of the Data Center Operations (DCO) team, overseeing the operation and maintenance of the IT infrastructure and hardware for data centers in AWS Cloud regions. You will become the primary resolver for your support team, and gain troubleshooting skills on different hardware and software cases. You will be able to troubleshoot and solve most infrastructure issues and engage other appropriate solutions groups on more complex problems to drive solutions.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

**Skills**
 This is a customer-facing role that requires strong technical, communication, and problem-solving skills. Your activities will include (but not limited to):
   

  

* Build relationships with internal teams and customers along with innovating effective solutions to meet issues & problems as they arise
* Conducting site assessments at various facilities to proactively prepare for the onsite installation of AWS equipment
* Installing/expanding/provisioning AWS infrastructure at the third-party premises, data center, and/or non-traditional environment
* Troubleshooting hardware, network installations & configurations and performing network testing, break/fix, rack installations and/or decommissioning and solving complex problems
* Proactively identifying and implementing strategies that prevent support issues and/or further enhance the customer experience
* Process and track purchase orders for data center hardware components
* Monitor spare parts inventory levels and initiate replenishment orders
* Maintain accurate records in internal ordering databases
* Execute asset transfers across global locations
* Track order approvals and provide timely updates to stakeholders
* Identify and report shipment issues, including delays, cancellations, and expedited requests
* Manage shipment label distribution for new equipment and returns
* Coordinate with global teams to ensure timely delivery and resolution of issue
* Conduct day-to-day business, both internally and with external customers
* Required travel up to 25% on average. You will be required to travel between locations to install, service, and retrieve AWS equipment.
* Physical ability to push and/or pull heavy objects into position (regularly lift up to 18kg and participate in team lifts of 30 kg)
* May lead or participate in efforts to develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) and tools that improve operational efficiencies
* May lead larger projects that require cross-functional alignment and support, including large-DC installations, global-reaching business initiatives, and/or development of mechanisms to support growth to ensure compliance with global group standards.
* May be required to work at height to maintain AWS infrastructure equipment while adhering to AWS health & safety guidelines.
* Most of all, you will have a passion for technology along with a desire to be the best at your job every day!


**About The Team**
 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 4+ years of data center engineering or operations experience
* Knowledge of fundamentals of hardware, networking, security, databases (relational or NoSQL), operating systems (Unix, Linux, and/or Windows)
* 2+ years of leading large complex programs experience
* A valid (EU) driving license is required as Data Centers may not have any public transportation available nearby.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree, or 4+ years of relevant technical position experience
* Experience working in a customer-facing environment
* CompTIA A+, CompTIA Network+, Cisco/CCNA, Linux (Redhat), Hardware (installation), AWS, or other industry relevant certifications
* Knowledge of power, cooling, cabling, networking hardware, inventory management, and automation
* Proficiency in network operating systems (Cisco IOS, NX-OS, Junos)


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB - C95
   

  

 Job ID: A3146351

title: E-COMMERCE ASSISTANT, CHANEL SWEDEN
description:
CHANEL SWEDEN is currently looking for an E-commerce Assistant to deliver high service standards to our e-commerce clients and to ensure operational efficiency and accuracy within our guidelines and procedures. The position is for 15 hours per week, with operations currently located in our Fragrance & Beauty flagship boutique in Stockholm. The work is mainly carried out on weekdays, Monday to Friday, primarily from mornings until early afternoon, making it a perfect opportunity for someone who wants to combine the role with ongoing university studies.
   

  

 As an E-commerce Assistant, you will be dedicated to the daily e-commerce tasks and understand the intangible value of delivering exceptional client experience. You will present positive energy, contribute to team collaboration, pay careful attention to details and act in a courteous, professional, and knowledgeable manner. You take pride in working for CHANEL and passionately uphold our standards, objectives, and vision to re-imagine the CHANEL beauty experience.
   

  

**Duties & Responsibilities**
* Pick and pack daily e-commerce orders according to procedures and wrapping guidelines
* Manage all daily orders in our e-commerce system
* Follow up on daily parcel pick up done by courier
* Receive and handle daily e-commerce returns according to procedure
* Manage all e-commerce returns in the e-commerce system
* Follow up on wrapping items and stock and report to the Operations Team for replenishment
* Follow up on monthly samples and report to the Operations Team
* Keep the e-commerce area including packing station neat and tidy
* Maintain a clean and structured organization of back office
* Assist in other back office, e-commerce, and retail operations when needed
* Share best practices with other e-commerce colleagues
* Propose improvements to the e-commerce team


***We are looking for:***
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Experience working within E-commerce and/or retail
* Multitasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and being flexible and spontaneous
* You are a self-driven, positive, and independent person
* You bring a strong set of interpersonal skills, which is essential as the role involves close liaison with all functions and business teams across our entire organization
* Works effectively as part of a team and connects well with coworkers
* As a person, you are approachable, proactive, detail-oriented, thorough and structured in your work
* Passionate about the luxury and fragrance & beauty industry
* You are trustworthy with a high degree of integrity and ethics


 If the description above fits you, then you might be the one we are looking for. Please don't hesitate to apply with your CV and Cover Letter. We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**About Chanel**
 “If you’re born without wings, don’t do anything to stop them from growing.” Gabrielle Chanel
   

  

 Inspired by our founder, Gabrielle Chanel, who constantly pushed boundaries in her personal and professional life, there is no one way forward at CHANEL. They offer a unique work environment where you are encouraged to better understand the brand, the business, and your motivations. At CHANEL, the foundation of success starts with the employees who defend the values of excellence, creativity, style, and modernity that ensured the originality of Coco Chanel in her time and continue to do so today. Within CHANEL, a true "culture of quality" exists where everyone feels involved and shares the values of the Brand that they all are proud to represent. CHANEL is a leading luxury goods brand supporting three key businesses: Fashion; Watches and Fine Jewelry; Fragrance and Beauty. Read more on www.chanel.com.

title: Solution Engineer - Innovation Hub
description:
**Overview**
 Microsoft Innovation Hub empowers customers to overcome their business challenges through innovative engagements that integrate multiple areas of expertise. We drive AI transformation by leveraging evolving needs and emerging business opportunities. As the future of technologists and enterprise technical sellers, we guide customers from envisioning solutions to implementation. We deliver the Microsoft value story through immersive experiences, strengthening customer trust through deep engagements in exceptional environments.
   

  

 As a Solution Engineer in the Microsoft Innovation Hub, you will merge business and technical requirements to craft comprehensive solutions, working seamlessly with various stakeholders. You will conduct discovery sessions to understand customer needs and provide strategic recommendations and best practices tailored to their specific needs. Implementing robust AI transformation solutions and optimizing the integration of various technologies and services will be key aspects of your role. Additionally, you will leverage consultancy skills to foster collaboration among technical resources and stakeholders, ensuring alignment and effective teamwork. This role is Microsoft onsite only.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Delivering customer engagements: Prepare and deliver technical engagements including strategy sessions, envisioning workshops, architecture design sessions and rapid prototyping to demonstrate key capabilities, validate against identified risks and finalize technology choices.
* AI Transformation Leadership: Be the trusted voice within the business and for customers on the latest AI platform and technology trends, guiding their transformation journeys. By prioritizing AI use cases through design thinking workshops, you will lead these journeys effectively. You will be a valued contributor to Microsoft’s strategy in your area, ensuring the Hub is proactively aligned with the right customers to drive real impact.
* Strategic Vision and Planning: Own and execute a clear strategic vision for AI transformation initiatives on a set of targeted accounts, aligning with organizational goals and customer needs by collaborating and orchestrating cross-functional teams.
* Solution Design and Architecture: Develop comprehensive solution architectures based on patterns and practices that are tied to customer requirements and ensure that solutions are scalable, secure and optimized for performance. By utilizing consultation skills, you will uncover and prioritize opportunities, ensuing solutions are addressing real customer needs.
* Cross Platform Collaboration: Adopt a holistic approach to integrate capabilities across the entire cloud platform, identifying synergies and optimizing cross-platform integration. You will work with your peers and stakeholders to make the Innovation Hub the home of Cross Solution AI Transformation.
* Technical Depth: Maintain and grow expertise in creating business value on top of the business applications including sales, services and marketing and Microsoft 365 platform to support AI transformation initiatives. Stay updated with the market trends and collaborate with the technical communities.
* Technical Sales and Sales Leadership: Act as a strategic change agent within the business to shape Microsoft's programs and engineering offerings. Lead the creation of scalable, field-relevant assets through internal communities. Champion Hub engagement success by connecting technical capabilities to sales opportunities and serving as a trusted voice with sales leaders and account teams.


**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field OR Bachelor’s Degree in a related field OR equivalent hands-on experience.
* Several years of experience in technical pre‑sales, technical consulting, or a similar customer‑facing technical role.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.


**Preferred Qualifications** 
**Design Thinking:** 
 Proven experience delivering design‑thinking workshops, ideation sessions, or problem‑framing engagements.
   

  

* Enterprise Architecture: Proven experience designing and delivering large‑scale, complex solutions that align with business and technical requirements. Ability to integrate multiple technologies and platforms into cohesive, scalable architectures.
* Consultative Selling: Proven ability to advise customers, provide strategic recommendations, and navigate complex technical environments to deliver tailored solutions.
* Strategic & Structured Facilitation: Demonstrated experience capturing requirements, prioritising needs, identifying risks and constraints, and quantifying business value to support strategic outcomes.
* AI Solution Design: Experience designing, building, and deploying AI solutions across cloud and hybrid environments. Strong understanding of AI‑related Azure services, architecture patterns, migrations, and industry standards.
* Relevant Certifications: Certifications in applicable technologies or disciplines (e.g., Azure certifications).Azure Certifications (Preferred):
+ AI‑102 Azure AI Engineer Associate
+ PL‑600 Power Platform Solution Architect Expert
+ Or other relevant certifications from recognised vendors.


 This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about
 **requesting accommodations.**

title: Full Stack Engineer (React/WASM) – AI Project
description:
**About the Role** 

 We are looking for a pragmatic, high-impact
 **Senior Full Stack Engineer** 
 to join us for a critical 3-month R&D sprint. You will lead the development of a "Zero-Trust" AI prototype that pushes the boundaries of what is possible in a web browser.
 



 This is not a standard CRUD application. We are building
 **Edge AI infrastructure** 
 where data privacy is enforced by code, not policy. You will be working directly with the leadership team to ship a functional Alpha version by April.
 



  




**The Challenge** 

 Most AI solutions process data on the server. We are flipping the model. You will build a browser-based architecture where sensitive data is anonymized
 **client-side** 
 using WebAssembly (WASM) before it ever touches an external API.
 



  




**What You Will Build** 
* **The Engine:** 
 Integrate
 **WebAssembly (WASM)** 
 libraries (e.g., transformers.js, ONNX Runtime) to run lightweight AI models directly in the browser.
* **The Vault:** 
 Implement secure, persistent client-side storage using
 **SQLite Wasm** 
 (OPFS).
* **The Interface:** 
 Build a clean, responsive React/TypeScript UI for the "Private Chat" experience.
* **The Logic:** 
 Write the "Reversal Engine" that handles real-time tokenization and re-identification of sensitive text.



  




**We Are Looking For** 
* **Expert in React & TypeScript:** 
 You can build complex UIs fast.
* **WebAssembly (WASM) Experience:** 
 You understand how to run non-JS code in the browser and debug memory/performance issues.
* **"Hacker" Mindset:** 
 You are comfortable using bleeding-edge libraries (like local LLMs in-browser) and finding creative workarounds to make them performant.
* **Availability:** 
 You can start
 **immediately (early February)** 
 and commit to a 3-month sprint.



  




**Why Join This Project?** 
* **High Strategic Impact:** 
 You are building the core IP for a major "Sovereign AI" initiative.
* **Modern Stack:** 
 No legacy code. Pure React, Rust/WASM (via libraries), and local-first architecture.
* **Focused Scope:** 
 Clear deliverables, approved budget, and a hard deadline. No scope creep.



  





**To Apply:** 
 Send your CV and a link to your GitHub (or a brief description of a complex frontend project you’ve built). We are interviewing
 **now** 
 for a February start.

title: Security Engineer (Application Security)
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The Role**
 At Legora, we prioritise security. Always.
   

  

 We are looking for Application Security Engineers who can think like an attacker, build like a developer, and operate like an SRE. In this role you will work across our whole tech stack, from our Azure cloud infrastructure, JavaScript and Python services, to our AI integrations and workflows. Your goal is to ensure everything we ship and build is secure-by-default and resilient to evolving threats.
   

  

 At Legora we don't believe that “shifting left” is sufficient, our goal is to build a secure and resilient ecosystem for our engineers so that they can build tomorrows features with confidence and speed.
   

  

* This is a Stockholm-based, 5-day in-office role, we believe building together in person drives better outcomes.


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Embed security into our software development lifecycle; conduct design reviews, threat modelling, and secure code reviews for our JavaScript and Python codebases.
* Architect and implement security controls for our cloud infrastructure, ensuring Zero Trust principles in across our networks, identities, and service-to-service communication.
* Build and maintain secure-by-default tooling, templates, and guardrails for our developers.
* Ensure our AI workflows and pipelines are secured and resilient against prompt injection, data leakage, and abuse.
* Develop and maintain vulnerability management pipelines, triaging and driving fixes with engineering teams.
* Automate security processes in CI/CD, including secret scanning, artifact signing, and policy-as-code checks.
* Partner with our information security team to ensure compliance and automate evidence collection efforts.


**Who You Are**
* You have 3+ years in Software Engineering with a strong interest in Cyber Security, and/or
* 5+ years as in Security Engineering or Product Security roles, ideally in a cloud-first, high-growth tech environment.
* You are able to produce production grade code.
* You have experience building and securing AI workflows, with an interest in adversarial AI threats and mitigations.
* You have hands-on experience securing cloud environments (Azure strongly preferred) and working with Infrastructure-as-Code (Pulumi, Terraform, or similar).
* You understand Zero Trust architecture and can design systems with identity-centric, least-privilege access controls.
* You have experience with secure SDLC practices, application security testing, and vulnerability management.
* You thrive in cross-functional work, explaining security risks to engineers, influencing design choices, and collaborating to deliver secure features on time.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Information Security Consultant
description:
*Hos oss på B3* 
 Secure får du möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad genom att hjälpa företag och myndigheter att stärka sin informationssäkerhet. Vi växer och letar nu efter fler härliga kollegor som vill vara med på resan!
   

  

 Vi tror på att skapa en arbetsmiljö där samarbete, kunskapsdelning och energi frodas. Vi är stolta över att ha erfarna och engagerade kollegor, en flexibel och modern arbetskultur samt en attraktiv ersättningsmodell. Här får du chansen att både bidra med din kompetens och utvecklas vidare – tillsammans med oss!
   

  

**Hur du kommer att bidra**
 Som informationssäkerhetskonsult hos oss får du arbeta i uppdrag där du gör verklig skillnad. Vi hjälper verksamheter att både strategiskt och operativt hantera sina säkerhetsutmaningar – från att etablera ett riskbaserat säkerhetsarbete till att implementera tekniska och organisatoriska åtgärder. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att bygga upp och förbättra säkerhetsarbetet hos våra kunder, såsom att:
   

  

* Vägleda företag och organisationer i att bygga upp och förbättra sitt ISMS (Information Security Management System).
* Genomföra risk- och GAP-analyser, informationsklassning och säkerhetsrevisioner.
* Ta fram policyer, riktlinjer och strategier för säkerhetsåtgärder och efterlevnad.
* Stödja verksamhetsledningar och IT-ansvariga i säkerhetsrelaterade beslut.


 Hos oss arbetar du i en samarbetsinriktad och prestigelös miljö där vi värdesätter förtroende och engagemang. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk roll där du kan utvecklas genom spännande uppdrag, branschforum och vidareutbildningar.
   

  

**Är vi en bra match?**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet inom informationssäkerhet och vill ta en central roll i att stärka våra kunders säkerhetsarbete. Du har erfarenhet att arbeta riskbaserat, identifiera hot och möjligheter samt att vägleda organisationer i strategiska säkerhetsbeslut.
   

  

 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:
   

  

* Har minst fem års erfarenhet av informationssäkerhet, riskhantering eller cybersäkerhet
* Är trygg i att arbeta självständigt och rådgivande på både strategisk och operativ nivå
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska, då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet
* Gillar att samarbeta och dela med dig av din kunskap
* Erfarenhet som konsult är meriterande, men vi välkomnar även dig med intern erfarenhet som CISO, säkerhetsansvarig eller liknande roll


**Vad du får hos oss**
 En arbetsplats där vi värdesätter frihet, gemenskap och balans
   

  

* En trygg anställning med schyssta villkor, konkurrenskraftig lön och fina förmåner
* En härlig wellness-satsning där vi tränar, peppar och inspirerar varandra
* Möjlighet att utbilda dig och certifiera dig inom det du brinner för
* Ett team där vi hjälper varandra att bli bättre – och har kul längs vägen!


**En arbetsplats som gör skillnad:**
 Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till ett av Sveriges fem främsta karriärföretag 2025 – en utmärkelse som speglar vår energi, nyfikenhet och vårt engagemang för att skapa en inkluderande och inspirerande arbetsplats. Här värdesätts olika perspektiv och idéer, och vi tror att det är just det som gör oss starkare.
   

  

 Hos oss får du friheten att styra över dina uppdrag, din arbetstid och din utveckling. Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibilitet att forma din vardag och en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid. Och vi vet att gemenskap är minst lika viktigt som teknik – därför satsar vi på allt från konferensresor och sommarfester till sköna AW:s där vi kan släppa jobbet för en stund.
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.*
*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i* 
 Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.
   

  

**Nyfiken?**
 Vi hoppas det! Hör av dig så pratar vi mer – vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig. 💙

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer to AML & Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Solna
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Do you see the potential in data and want to contribute to accelerating our data driven automation journey using AI, Machine Learning and other data driven automation tools? Then this might be the right challenge for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our data team and lead the creation of scalable AI/ML solutions. You’ll work in the Fraud Prevention Team, helping various business areas use data to automate processes, improve decisions, and fight financial crime.
   

  

 This position lets you work on impactful, real-time machine learning systems in a collaborative and agile setting, where technical skills and ownership matter.
   

  

 As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll manage machine learning solutions from start to finish - including design, deployment, monitoring, and improvement. You’ll collaborate with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers, Software Testers, and other teams to deliver reliable AI solutions that support fraud prevention and protect customers.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with engineers, data scientists, solution architects, and business stakeholders to build AI-powered products that drive innovation and efficiency across the organization.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are an analytical problem solver with solid experience in machine learning, software engineering, and running systems in production. You enjoy tackling technical challenges and always seek to improve your skills and ways of working.
   

  

 You work well with others, take ownership of your solutions, and communicate clearly in English. You are comfortable visualizing data and explaining technical insights to different audiences, and you thrive in a team-focused, responsible, and continuously improving environment
   

  

**Core Responsibilities**
* Lead and help deliver complex AI/ML projects focused on scalability, reliability, and quality.
* Design and implement cloud-based ML systems (preferably on GCP).
* Build and operate real-time ML and MLOps workflows in production.
* Oversee the full lifecycle of ML solutions, ensuring they are robust, high-performing, and secure. Mentor junior engineers and promote best practices.
* Work with business and technical teams to turn requirements into valuable AI/ML solutions.
* Identify and drive AI/ML use cases that improve processes and customer experience.
* Develop, train, and evaluate machine learning models for business and risk challenges.
* Manage technical risks and coordinate across teams.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver production-ready, maintainable systems.


**To Thrive in This Role, You Have**
* MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar—or equivalent experience.
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning and software development, with ML models in production.
* Strong background in designing, building, and running real-time ML and MLOps workflows.
* Deep knowledge of system architecture, performance, scalability, and security.
* Proficient in Python and SQL; good understanding of data warehouse architecture.
* Proven MLOps/DevOps skills, including CI/CD, testing, monitoring, and supporting ML systems in production.
* Experience in data engineering, software engineering, and data science for effective teamwork.
* Strong experience deploying ML models in cloud environments, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Experience with Git, cloud platforms, and remote-first collaboration.


**Nice-to-have**
* Experience with containerized, microservices-based architectures using Docker and Kubernetes in regulated environments (e.g., Fraud Prevention or AML).
* Experience designing and deploying end-to-end ML workflows on GCP for fraud detection, transaction monitoring, or risk scoring.
* Experience running high-throughput, low-latency ML prediction services at scale.
* Experience building real-time ML systems for fast decisioning, alerting, or scoring in fraud and financial crime prevention.
* Strong statistical skills applied to fraud analytics, anomaly detection, and risk modeling, with good software design for scalable systems.
* Experience using Infrastructure as Code (Terraform) to manage and secure GCP infrastructure in compliance-driven environments.


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-life balance.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **2026-01-31** 
 .
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact Delila Mauritzon, Team Manager – Fraud Prevention, at delila.mauritzon@seb.se
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB at** 
**https://sebgroup.com/career**

title: Security Engineer (Detection & Response)
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The Role**
 At Legora, we prioritise security. Always.
   

  

 We are looking for exceptional Detection & Response engineers to help us detect, investigate, and respond to threats as they continue to evolve. In this role you will have the opportunity to shape our technical security capabilities from the ground up and set the president for what modern threat detection and response practices should look like.
   

  

* This is a Stockholm-based, 5-day in-office role, we believe building together in person drives better outcomes.


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead Legora's cyber security incident response efforts across any domain from external attacks to insider threats.
* Develop and manage tooling to enhance detection, investigation and response efforts.
* Develop and maintain detection capabilities, playbooks and workflows to quickly identify, respond to, and remediate potential incidents.
* Drive continuous improvement, based on relevant incident response metrics.
* Coordinate with teams across the whole organization to plan for, and resolve incidents.


**Who You Are**
* You have 3+ years of software engineering with strong security drive, and/or
* 5+ years of detection engineering, incident response or threat hunting experience
* Expert knowledge and understanding of cloud based environments and operations
* Strong self-drive and motivated to build best-in-class solutions
* Exceptional team-player thriving on cross-team collaboration
* Experience working in a high-paced cloud-native scale-up environment
* Knowledge of modern threat detection technologies


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Junior Consultants to Management Consulting - August 2026
description:
*Do you strive to work with highly strategic transformation projects that truly make a difference for top clients? Join us at KPMG Management Consulting! We are growing rapidly and offer great career opportunities.*
**When working at KPMG Management Consulting you will be part of a global organization and work within various industries and areas, together with competent and inspiring colleagues. As management consultants, we advise our clients in their transformation journeys from strategy and design to change management and value realization. We work shoulder-to-shoulder with top executives, and we always seek digital, innovative, and sustainable solutions to our clients’ business challenges.**
**Management Consulting at KPMG**
 At Management Consulting, you will become part of a group of over 200 colleagues with broad and specialized competence within advisory services across multiple sectors and functions. We work in an environment that combines KPMG’s global network with the local expertise of our employees, a combination that enables us to deliver industry-leading support for our clients.
   

  

 We offer transformation capabilities for complex situations and provide support in, e.g., digitalization and technology-driven change, company integrations and separations, business transformation and functional improvements, sustainability initiatives, and cost reduction & efficiency improvement activities.
   

  

 Our teams include:
   

  

* Operations – combines several areas of expertise to transform and optimize our customers' core businesses.
* Finance Transformation – future-proofs our clients’ finance functions, with expertise in e.g., steering models and processes, strategies and business development, finance, and business controlling.
* Customer – provides expertise in customer behavior and innovation – with our tools and methods, the team helps companies design the optimal customer experience and strategies for front office functions.
* Procurement – reduce costs, increase efficiency using digitalization and improved forecasting within procurement functions and processes.
* People & Change – strategic planning in people matters like workforce, competences, change management and HR-analytics.
* Technology Transformation – operates in the intersection between business and technology, where we support our clients’ digital transformations from strategy to implementation.


 Read more about our services on our website at: Management consulting at KPMG - KPMG Sverige
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Together with other KPMG colleagues you will be working on exciting client engagements. During your first years at KPMG Management Consulting, you will be a part of our learning and development program LEAP. In the program, you will acquire knowledge about business sectors, industry trends and KPMG’s customers. You will learn our tools and methods, gain deep knowledge about our capabilities and delivery models, while also improving your leadership and sales skills. Furthermore, you will get a mentor and a dedicated performance manager supporting you in your career.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 We are looking for dedicated recent or soon to be graduates who strive to achieve excellence and are looking for a great career path. More specifically, we want you to have:
   

  

* Preferably a master’s degree in business, IT, and/or engineering,
* High-performing and talented individuals with a business mindset
* Excellent communication skills,
* Multilingual proficiency (fluency English is required, Swedish is an advantage),
* Analytical & problem-solving skills
* Team-players with a genuine interest in seeing customers grow and being part of their journey
* Excellent grades from your studies
* Previous work experience, or other engagements and achievements showing a strong drive, high ambition, and passion, is essential
* International experience is valued highly


 We look forward to welcoming our new recruits who will enjoy great fun, a steep learning curve and work alongside senior colleagues and our clients targeting their critical challenges.
   

  

**Join us**
 Apply online no later than 1 February, 2026. Applicants are advised to apply as soon as possible, as we review applications continuously and the position may be filled before the deadline. Please attach your CV and university grade transcripts. Note that fluency in English is required. Based on mutual agreement, successful candidates will be based in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö and start in August 2026 or as agreed. If you have any questions, please contact our Recruiter Amanda Engberg (amanda.engberg@kpmg.se). Please note that we do not offer visa sponsorship.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 KPMG Advisory
   

  

 Management Consulting

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role sumary**
 You know the power of great execution - how it doesn’t just follow strategy, but shapes it. As Senior Project Manager at Scania’s Project Office, you will lead some of the most critical industrialization programs within Scania, turning strategic direction into tangible business results. Your leadership will make a real difference. You will guide complex, cross-functional programs from decision to delivery, ensuring seamless industrial introductions that meet Scania’s EBIT goals and strengthen our premium offering. Together with executive leaders and other project managers, you will help move Scania’s strategy from vision to value - always with the customer in focus.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Lead large-scale industrialization programs supporting Scania’s strategic goals when industrializing Product Development projects from TRATON GROUP PMO.
* Ensure successful execution of projects that are critical to Scania’s truck business profitability, securing smooth introductions without disruptions to the industrial system.
* Guide and coach other project and program managers at Scania’s Project Office, contributing to a strong and learning project culture.
* Navigate and lead business decisions in forums such as OSG, PDC, PMC, PSC and PQ.
* Collaborate with executive leadership and provide strategic insight into Scania’s project portfolio, supporting both direct management and the executive board in decision-making.
* Drive clarity and alignment across complex interfaces, ensuring that stakeholders stay focused on common priorities and outcomes.


**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced and trusted Project Manager with a strong track record of leading complex, high-impact projects. You bring both strategic perspective and operational precision, and you know how to drive results through others.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

  

* A Master’s degree, preferably in Engineering, Business, or an equivalent field.
* Significant senior project management experience, ideally gained within Scania or the wider TRATON Group. Experience from executive decision-making arenas is highly valued.
* Strong business understanding and the ability to balance strategic objectives with operational realities.
* Proven leadership experience, including leading other leaders and managing cross-functional teams.
* Full professional proficiency in English; Swedish is an advantage.


 Your leadership combines structure and empathy, and you bring stability, focus and collaboration even in high-stakes situations. You are as comfortable discussing strategic directions with executives as you are guiding your team through the day-to-day complexities of execution.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 At the Scania Project Office, we lead programs and projects that define the future of Scania’s premium offering. We act where business and product meet, ensuring that strategy is realized through strong, value-driven execution. We believe in collaboration, coaching and continuous learning. Our mission is to make sure that product development and industrialization deliver real value, to our customers, our business and our people.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Application**
 We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and any relevant certifications to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes!
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, but no later than
 **2026-02-13** 
 . Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**
 Therese Sandberg, Hiring Manager, therese.sandberg@scania.com
   

  

 Maria Edlund, Hiring Manager, maria.edlund@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Project Business Analyst
description:
Join a Nordic transformation that shapes how we work from field to fork.
   

  

 Lantmännen is a farmers’ cooperative with operations from field to fork, creating value from farmland resources in a responsible way. Lantmännen Cerealia, part of the Food division, develops and markets grain-based food such as flour, muesli, crispbread, pasta and pancakes, as well as a range of green foods, to markets across the Nordics and beyond. Our brands include Kungsörnen, Amo, Regal, AXA, Vaasan Koulunäkki, Sopps and FINN CRISP.
   

  

 Lantmännen Cerealia is on a transformation journey where one of our key focus areas is to establish a more efficient way of operating our business. Therefore, we are now recruiting several Project Business Analysts to strengthen a large business and IT transformation of our ERP M3 to cloud and standardized processes in four Nordic countries and our plants.
   

  

 The role and what we offer
   

  

 You will be part of the central M3 project team for approximately 18+ months, assigned to one specific project stream and reporting to the Head of IT Business Development (solid line) and your Stream Lead (dotted line). The streams represent end-to-end processes within our business.
   

  

**You Will**
* Execute activities and deliverables in line with the project plan, budget and time frame within your stream.
* Plan, organize and facilitate workshops, and capture clear, structured outcomes.
* Analyze workshop results, propose solutions and anchor them with stakeholders.
* Contribute to the design and documentation of standardized end‑to‑end processes.
* Support change management, including training materials, communication and follow-up.
* Help secure a smooth handover from project to line organization for your stream.


 You will work closely with almost all participants within the project, such as PMO, Business IT, external specialists and subject matter experts from across the business in an international environment. This will give you valuable relations, network and business insights.

title: Data Engineer
description:
At Hive Streaming, we enable the world’s largest enterprises to use live video as a strategic tool for communication, alignment, and impact. Trusted by more than 130 global customers, Hive combines market-leading video distribution technology with unique communication analytics, helping organizations ensure flawless video experiences and measure how effectively messages reach, engage, and align employees.
   

  

 Our users are IT and Network professionals who rely on Hive every day to ensure flawless video delivery, Event Producers who ensure optimal video experience during internal company events, Leaders and Communications professionals who plan and execute powerful video-enabled strategies to deliver measurable impact.
   

  

 What do we do - really? No better way to explain what Hive actually does than with a video 🎥 Watch the video below to find out more 👇🏼
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a versatile data engineer with strong software engineering skills to join our Partner Ecosystem team. In this role, you will be a major contributor in designing and implementing the big data pipelines - real-time and batch-powering our products. Moreover, you will contribute in enabling Hive Products by working closely with our partner video platforms, such as Microsoft Teams Town Hall and Vimeo!
   

  

**Working As a Data Engineer, You Will**
* Design and implement big data pipelines on top of our data platform.
* Develop solutions leveraging our tech stack: Spark/Scala, Databricks and Delta lake.
* Work on end-to-end delivery of data to our applications.
* Contribute to shaping our product by bringing insights and innovative ideas to discussions.
* Collaborate with the team to engineer high-quality and reliable solutions.
* Help analyze our data to improve our products


**Working In Partner Eco, You Will**
* Design and implement our clients for the collection of data
* Work closely with our partner developers to enable Hive with high quality
* Own the data from the collection to its manipulation
* Align and want to live by our core values: customer-centricity, innovation, and empowerment.


**More Details**
**Role type:** 
 Full-time with a standard probation period
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP, depending on notice
   

  

**Working hours:** 
 Align with CET (Central European Time)
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid: ±2 days/week in the office), can consider Berlin, Germany
   

  

*🐶Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office!*
**Who We Are Looking For**
 We're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation, but just as importantly, the right attitude. At Hive, how you work is just as valuable as what you know. We also don’t expect you to tick every box. If you’re excited about this role and ready to learn, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* Bachelors within Computer Science or a similar field, or equivalent experience
* Expert in Apache Spark and/or other distributed data processing frameworks
* Experience in delivering tested and maintainable code in projects with multiple contributors
* Knowledgeable in cloud environments and familiar with common cloud-native data storages


**We See It As a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience in TypeScript or JavaScript
* Prior experience working with video streaming solutions, networking, and/or peer-to-peer
* Experience with mentorship or informal leadership


**And Just As Importantly, We Believe You Are**
* A team player, who shares information and expertise, promotes team effectiveness by facilitating and building on the ideas of others
* Resourceful, who are quick to change behavior to adapt to changing circumstances
* A problem solver, who loves challenges and finding creative, practical solutions
* A good communicator, seeking first to understand and then to be understood
* Service-minded, who has a visible approach and shows sincere interest in customers and their concerns


**Why join Hive?**
* Global Impact: Partner with 150 of the world’s largest enterprises, helping them achieve alignment and measurable success through live video.
* Dynamic Culture: Join a collaborative, inclusive, and diverse environment that values curiosity, rapid learning, and new perspectives.
* Empowered Leadership: Play a pivotal role in shaping Hive’s future while connecting directly with the customers who rely on our solutions.
* Pioneering Innovation: Be at the forefront of building strategic communication tools that empower enterprises to thrive amidst massive change.
* Great Benefits: Wellness stipend, pension, health insurance, extra vacation days, benefit bikes, and more!
* Flexibility: We value flexibility and trust. Whether you’re balancing personal commitments or exploring new ideas, you’ll find support and autonomy here with flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.


 Recruitment process: what to expect
   

  

 To apply, please submit your CV and answer a few short questions in lieu of a cover letter directly in the application form. Please submit all documents in English.
 **PLEASE NOTE:** 
 All applications will be reviewed after the winter holidays!
   

  

 Our hiring process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:
   

  

* Intro call: Meet our People & Talent Partner for a chat about your background, motivation, and what excites you about Hive. You’ll also learn more about our culture and how we work.
* Hiring manager interview: Meet Claudio, one of our Engineering Managers and your potential future manager. This conversation focuses on your experience, career goals, and how you could contribute to the team.
* At-home assessment: Complete a short at-home assessment on an example task to see how you'd engage in the type of work you'd be doing.
* Technical interview: The at-home assessment will form the basis of a technical discussion with members of the Partner Ecosystem team. Together, you’ll explore your approach to problem-solving and technical design.
* Data engineering interview: Meet a few members of our Data Guild for a final conversation focused on team fit, ways of working, and your approach to data engineering. This is also your chance to ask questions and get a deeper sense of our data culture at Hive.
* Reference checks: We take security seriously and conduct two reference checks as part of our compliance with internal and regulatory requirements.
* Decision: Timely feedback and next steps - our goal is to complete the process in an efficient and timely manner, depending on your availability.

title: Technical Deployment Specialist - EMEA
description:
We're building the unified customer platform for growing lifelong revenue. Planhat is where data meets action. We bring sales, service, and success teams together in one system that combines enterprise-grade power with consumer-ready simplicity. Data is architected for execution. AI is commercially rooted. And the entire customer journey lives in one place. What started with two people and no funding has grown into a 200-strong team powering thousands of teams globally.
   

  

 Our pace is high, our standards are higher, and the opportunity to grow is unmatched. You'll be trusted early, challenged constantly, and surrounded by people who approach their work with the same intensity you do. We're ambitious, we work with our equals, and we're building the customer platform that defines the next era of B2B.
   

  

 As a Technical Deployment Specialist, you’ll bridge the gap between business strategy and technical execution. You’ll lead customers through complex implementations, integrations, and automations, translating goals into scalable, data-driven solutions that deliver real business value.
   

  

 You’ll shape how customers use data, automation, and process design to run smarter and scale faster. Working closely with Sales, CS, and Product, you’ll ensure every deployment creates lasting impact and sets the foundation for growth.
   

  

 In this role you will:
   

  

* Lead customer deployments: Own the full lifecycle of Planhat implementations, from scoping and design to configuration, integration, and go-live.
* Translate strategy into execution: Work with commercial and technical stakeholders to define success and design scalable solutions that make it happen.
* Integrate and automate: Build intelligent workflows and AI-powered automations that connect the customer’s full tech stack, unifying data and processes to drive clarity and efficiency.
* Enable smarter decisions: Use Planhat’s AI and analytics capabilities to help customers see patterns, act faster, and scale what works.
* Collaborate cross-functionally: Partner with Sales, CS, and Product to deliver seamless deployments and continuously improve how we create impact.


 You’ve spent 3–5 years in high-performance environments such as management consulting, implementation, RevOps, or a fast-growth SaaS company, where clear thinking and technical problem-solving were the norm. You combine curiosity with discipline and have a track record of turning complexity into clarity. Experience across data, integrations, or automation is advantageous but not required.
   

  

 You'll thrive here if you are:
   

  

* Technically curious: You understand how systems connect and data flows. You’re energized by complex problems and finding smarter, faster ways to solve them.
* Structured and outcome-oriented: You think clearly, communicate simply, and deliver solutions that drive real results.
* Collaborative across domains: You move easily between commercial and technical discussions, translating goals into execution without missing detail.
* Self-directed and adaptable: You take initiative, learn fast, and maintain momentum in ambiguous situations.
* Ambitious and growth-minded: You set high standards and thrive where performance and pace go hand in hand.


 If you are the person who raises the bar in your team, on the field, or anywhere performance matters, you will fit right in. Planhat rewards pace, precision, and ownership. Our best Technical Deployment Specialists grow into roles across product, operations, and leadership, shaping how the world’s most customer-centric companies scale.

title: Customer Enablement Manager
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 We’re looking for a Customer Enablement Manager to join Legora’s customer support and enablement function.
   

  

 This is for someone who thrives in ambiguity, enjoys building from scratch, and isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves to make things happen. You’ll partner directly with the Head of Customer Enablement and senior leaders across Product, Engineering, and GTM to create a world class customer experience.
   

  

 From refining workflows and systems to personally jumping in to solve complex client challenges, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping how our customers interact with Legora.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build and Lead: Own key aspects of the Customer Enablement function, from support operations and tooling to process design and metrics, while being hands on where needed.
* Solve Big and Small Problems: Step into whatever challenge arises, whether that’s designing a customer health framework or helping debug a live issue for a top tier firm.
* Drive Cross-Functional Impact: Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Legal Engineering to identify and resolve recurring issues, influencing product direction.
* Develop Resources & Systems: Build and maintain internal and external documentation, onboarding guides, and help resources to scale support efficiently.
* Shape the Function: Establish workflows, define standards, and set the cultural tone for how Legora delivers service to the world’s top legal teams.
* Mentor & Multiply: Guide specialists and peers toward excellence, helping the team evolve into a structured, high-performing unit as we grow.


**Who You Are**
* A builder at heart, comfortable with ambiguity and energized by creating clarity and systems from scratch.
* Experienced in customer support, success, or enablement for enterprise B2B SaaS, ideally in legal tech or AI-driven environments.
* Hands-on and scrappy, you don’t wait for permission to fix problems, and you’re equally happy drafting a process doc or jumping into a support queue.
* Technically curious, fast-learning, and able to communicate complex ideas clearly.
* Experienced with support platforms (Intercom, Zendesk, etc.) and comfortable experimenting to find what works best.
* A natural collaborator with strong stakeholder management skills.
* Fluent in English (additional languages are a plus).


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Finance Director Sweden
description:
G+D makes the lives of billions of people around the world more secure. We shape trust in the digital age with built-in security tech in three segments: Digital Security, Financial Platforms and Currency Technology. We have been a reliable partner for our customers for over 170 years with our innovative solutions for SecurityTech! We are an international technology group and traditional family business with over 14,000 employees in 40 countries. Creating Confidence is our path to success. Trust is the basis of our collaboration within G+D.
   

  

 We are the reliable partner for all challenges resulting from the Internet of Things. We offer a complete connectivity portfolio for mobile network operators, automotive manufacturers, technology companies such as chip and module manufacturers as well as transport and logistics providers. Our portfolio includes highly secure solutions in the area of connectivity & IoT, from classic SIM, eSIM and iSIM, to the associated embedded operating systems and life cycle management, through to services for global connectivity and IoT solutions. Do you want to actively shape the digital transformation with us?
   

  

 Are you ready to take the lead in shaping the financial future of a global technology company? At G+D Mobile Security Sweden AB, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced Finance Director to join our local Executive Management team based in Stockholm. This is your opportunity to make a real impact, driving financial excellence, ensuring compliance, and supporting strategic decisions that influence our growth and success.
   

  

**Why now?**
 Our current Finance Director is planning to retire in 2027. We are starting the recruitment process early to ensure we find the right person and create the best possible conditions for a smooth and successful handover. This means you will have time to learn, collaborate, and transition into the role with full support. As Finance Director, you will report directly to the Managing Director and the Head of Finance in Munich, playing a key role in steering our financial operations and representing the Finance function both locally and within the Group Finance community. If you thrive in a leadership role where precision, strategy, and collaboration matter, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 We are looking for a strategic leader with strong financial expertise and a hands on approach. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Oversee and organize all Finance & Accounting (F&A) activities, including accounting, controlling, reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and financial risk management.
* Ensure accurate, timely, and compliant financial reporting in line with IFRS and local GAAP.
* Act as the central financial interface to Group headquarters and external authorities.
* Safeguard company assets through robust internal controls.
* Lead and develop the Finance team, 7 employees, fostering a culture of growth and accountability.
* Support operational management with financial insights to drive profitability and efficiency.
* Manage customer contracts and vendor purchase orders in accordance with the company’s signature approval matrix.
* Deliver audited year end closing packages and ensure compliance with corporate guidelines.
* Represent Finance in the local Management Team and the Group Finance Community.


**Qualifications**
 We see that you are a result driven, analytical and collaborative leader who combines technical expertise with strong interpersonal skills. Moreover, you need to have:
   

  

* Minimum 10 years of relevant professional experience, including at least 5 years in a similar leadership role.
* A degree in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
* Proven knowledge and experience with IFRS and local GAAP.
* Strong understanding of financial and managerial accounting, corporate taxes, and group consolidation.
* Proficiency in budgeting, forecasting, and Microsoft Office tools.


 It is extra good if you have:
   

  

* Experience in an international corporate environment.
* Familiarity with ERP systems and financial process optimization.
* A track record of driving cost savings, working capital improvements, and process efficiency.


 Do you want to contribute to build the future for a seamless and connected society? Then apply today!
 **Practical information**
**Start:** 
 During 2026, date to be discussed
   

  

**Location:** 
 Liljeholmen, Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace
   

  

**What can we offer you?**
 In this role you will have the opportunity to work with talented people in an international and innovative environment. G+D is a well-established family-owned company at the forefront of the market. Besides a dynamic and evolving industry, we offer:
   

  

* An annual wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK to support your health and wellbeing
* Three extra days off per year, in addition to your vacation
* A dedicated weekly hour for sports or physical activity
* A strong collective agreement ensuring fair and secure working conditions
* Access to the Benify portal, offering health-related services and exclusive discounts
* Health insurance through Skandia
* A vacation exchange program for added flexibility
* A hybrid work model, allowing you to work up to 50% remotely
* Weekly breakfast at the office to start your day right


 Get to know us and our team at G+D Sweden better by listening to our Jobcast below: Shaping the next chapter of the digital age Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/71GyhbDv090LgVyukyLf7v?si=f399b1f0d93e47e3
   

  

 Acast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e072f95211700118d82a4 Our DNA is in our people Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/6BpWiUCMXr3q68dSGEr2w7?si=e4328a3c8db34b8d
   

  

 Acast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e070580b8d100110f0e95

title: Domänarkitekt
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens utvecklarupplevelse? Hos oss får du chansen att bygga hjärtat i vår digitala transformation – plattformar och verktyg som driver innovation, säkerhet och användarvänlighet. Som domänarkitekt agerar du också i rollen som tågarkitekt och blir en central kraft i att skapa en världsledande utvecklingsmiljö där DevSecOps och molntransformation står i fokus. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor bygger du grunden för nästa generations digitala tjänster. Är du redo att ta ledartröjan och inspirera till innovation och kvalitet?*
**Om jobbet**
 Som domänarkitekt är du en nyckelperson både i linjeorganisationen, där du ansvarar för arkitekturen inom domänen Process & Dev Tool, och i tågledningen, där du främst arbetar på taktisk nivå i nära samarbete med såväl strategisk som operativ nivå. Inom Process & Dev Tools möjliggör vi systemutveckling i världsklass och lägger grunden för effektiva, säkra och skalbara lösningar genom att etablera principer, plattformar, processer och arbetssätt som skapar en modern och hållbar utvecklingsmiljö.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att definiera och kommunicera en gemensam teknisk och arkitekturell vision för tåget och säkerställer att de system som används och utvecklas passar för sitt syfte och stödjer vår övergripande strategi. Du leder och utvecklar tågets arkitekturella runway, bidrar till planering och prioritering och coachar teamen för att säkerställa att lösningarna håller hög kvalitet och följer den arkitekturella visionen. Du samarbetar med Product Manager, RTE, Business Owners, team, arkitekter och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att våra mål och planer är väl förankrade och att vi håller jämn takt med teknisk skuld. Du är både rådgivare och inspiratör, och driver det tekniska arbetet framåt med moderna metoder och ett DevSecOps-mindset.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Ansvara för att utveckla och kommunicera den tekniska och arkitekturella visionen för tåget
* Säkerställa att arkitekturella behov och möjliggörare (enablers) hanteras i backloggen
* Samverka med tågledningen och relevanta intressenter för att planera, prioritera och koordinera tekniska lösningar
* Bidra till att lösningar håller hög kvalitet och är i linje med verksamhetens mål och strategier
* Coacha utvecklingsteam och främja ett ständigt lärande kring arkitektur och kvalitet
* Tillsammans med resterande tågledning styra tåget för att utveckla rätt lösning utifrån en helhetssyn med utgångspunkt i omvärldens och kundernas framtida behov
* Säkerställa kravställning gentemot leverantör
* Utforma och förvalta "Golden Path" för utveckling och leverans på plattformen, inklusive automatiserade säkerhetskontroller, policy enforcement och audit trails
* Driva kontinuerlig förbättring av plattformens säkerhets- och compliancefunktioner, samt utbilda och stötta utvecklingsteamen i bästa praxis
* Ta en ledarroll i det tekniska arbetet och inspirera till innovation och kvalitet
* Kommunicera och förklara komplexa tekniska frågor på ett pedagogiskt och lättförståeligt sätt för olika målgrupper, samt agera mentor och coach för teamen


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Akademisk utbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap, IT eller liknande
* Djup och bred teknisk erfarenhet av systemutveckling och DevSecOps, gärna i större organisationer
* Erfarenhet av att implementera CI/CD och automatiserade pipelines
* Stark förståelse för DevSecOps, automatisering samt security och compliance by design
