* Erfarenhet av att implementera och övervaka säkerhets- och compliancekrav i moln- och containerplattformar
* God kunskap om säkerhetsverktyg (t.ex. SAST, DAST, secrets management, IAM) och compliance-ramverk, gärna inom bank och finans
* Kunskap om API-strategier och integrationsmönster
* Förmåga att dokumentera och hålla arkitektur och mönster uppdaterade
* Agilt mindset och erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt SAFe eller liknande ramverk
* Mycket god samarbetsförmåga, lyhördhet och ödmjukhet – du övertygar med väl underbyggda argument och söker alltid den bästa lösningen för helheten
* Förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Starkt ledarskap och förmåga att motivera, engagera och utveckla andra
* Pedagogisk skicklighet – du kan förklara komplexa tekniska frågor på ett enkelt och tydligt sätt för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom Azure- och OpenShift/Kubernetes-arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av nätverk, monitorering, logg- och eventhantering
* Kunskap om Key Management, certifikat, autentisering, auktorisering och IAM
* Erfarenhet av IDP-lösningar


 Som person är du nyfiken, drivande och har ett stort engagemang för teknik och utveckling. Du har lätt för att samarbeta och trivs med att arbeta i team, samtidigt som du gärna tar initiativ och leder andra framåt. Du är kommunikativ, pedagogisk och har förmågan att inspirera både tekniska och icke-tekniska kollegor. Du har ett agilt och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt, är prestigelös och ser alltid till helheten. Din analytiska förmåga och ditt strukturerade arbetssätt gör att du kan hantera komplexa frågor och fatta välgrundade beslut.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter:**
 Rekryterande chef:Charlotta.Haldin@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena:Jessica.loow@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:Lisa-Maria.Carensjo@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund.
   

  

 Digital & IT är hjärtat i Länsförsäkringsgruppens digitala utveckling. Vi driver den gemensamma digitala transformationen och levererar förstklassiga IT-lösningar, datadrivna insikter och innovativa digitala tjänster som skapar värde för hela verksamheten. Vårt uppdrag är att bygga en robust och framtidssäker IT-miljö – både på plats och i molnet – som möjliggör kundnära och effektiva affärer i hela gruppen.
   

  

 Hos oss möts teknik, affär och innovation. Vi arbetar tvärfunktionellt ute i verksamheten i agila team där utveckling, drift och strategi går hand i hand. Vi ansvarar för allt från IT-styrning, enterprisearkitektur och leverantörshantering till applikationsutveckling, cybersäkerhet och verksamhetsberedskap.

title: Senior nätverks- och automationskonsult till Telia Cygate
description:
Hallå där! Vill du jobba med det senaste inom nätverk? Vill du vara med och forma framtidens nätverk och automation? Vi på Telia Cygate söker en
 **Senior nätverks- och automationskonsult** 
 som vill bli en del av vårt fantastiska team och arbeta med några av Sveriges mest spännande IT-miljöer.
   

  

 Jag heter Solveig Jagelid och leder vårt spännande konsultteam
 **Networking & Hybrid IT i Region Öst.** 
 Nu söker jag dig som har erfarenhet av nätverkslösningar och automation – och som brinner för att skapa värde nära kund. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa, certifiera dig och vara med på en spännande resa där innovation och kundnytta står i centrum.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra i rollen:**
 Som Senior nätverks- och automationskonsult blir du en nyckelperson i våra kundprojekt. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Planera och designa avancerade nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar med fokus på automation och integration.
* Installera, konfigurera och felsöka komplexa IT-miljöer hos några av Sveriges största företag.
* Självständigt arbete nära kund, med stort ansvar och frihet.
* Samarbeta med experter inom nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT – och få insikt i de senaste teknologierna inom Cloud, Security och Automation.


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 Som person motiveras du av att skapa förändring och har en förmåga att engagera kunder såväl som dina kollegor. Du kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får ge utlopp för tankar och idéer där du använder din verksamhetsförståelse för att omsätta krav till genomförbara lösningar. Förutom det får du tillhöra en växande organisation som uppmuntrar dig på din egen utvecklingsresa; varför inte certifiera dig med oss och utforska det senaste som ex. Aruba, Fortinet, Cisco och automation.
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet inom nätverksteknik eller liknande.
* Djupa kunskaper inom Routing och Switching.
* Erfarenhet av automation (t.ex. Python, NetBox).
* Certifieringar inom Aruba, Cisco och/eller Fortinet – starkt meriterande.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan
 **!**
**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du en fantastisk möjlighet att utvecklas, omfattande förmånspaket, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telia Cygates resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast
 **2026-02-15.** 
 Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat – så vänta inte för länge!
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Solna, Stockholm
   

  

 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår
 **Talent Acquisition Partner** 
 . Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om rollen? Kontakta gärna Solveig Jagelid på solveig.jagelid@cygate.se.
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Backend Engineer - Client Infra
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us — and let the world feel your work.**
**The role**
 As a
 **Backend Engineer,** 
 you will play a crucial role in
 **Epidemic Sound’s Client Infra team** 
 , a core part of the Foundation area responsible for building the technology platform that powers the company’s backend services. Your work will directly strengthen the developer experience, improve productivity across engineering, and accelerate the company’s shift from a legacy monolith to a modern, scalable service architecture.
   

  

 This role is central to
 **enabling developers to deliver new features consistently, safely, and at high velocity** 
 . By designing and building modern platform components, workflows, and integrations, you help ensure that engineering teams across the company can rapidly innovate - an essential capability in a market reshaped by generative AI and evolving content creation needs. Your contributions directly advance Client Infra’s mission: providing robust, reusable, best-practice tooling and infrastructure for Go-based backend services.
   

  

 You will join
 **Client Infra** 
 , a team of
 **six engineers** 
 within the Foundation area, which also includes SRE and the Data Platform. The team is focused on:
   

  

* Building and maintaining a solid technology foundation for all backend teams.
* Providing reusable service templates and best-practice workflows.
* Ensuring developers have excellent local development tooling and ownership insights.
* Owning critical infrastructure components such as authentication systems, CDN, and caching.


**Requirements:**
* Past experience with developing in Go.
* Experience as a heavy user of developer portals like Backstage, Port, etc.
* Experience with GitHub and GitHub Actions for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD).


**Soft skills:**
* Adaptability & Resilience – Thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a rapidly evolving business domain.
* Problem-solving Mindset – Proactive in tackling legacy challenges and continuously improving tools, workflows, and processes.
* Collaboration & Cross-functional Communication – Works effectively with teams across the organization; comfortable teaching, supporting, and guiding others.


**It would be music to our ears if you have:**
* Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), infrastructure as code, and Kubernetes is beneficial as the team builds on top of these technologies.
* Experience in a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) or DevOps role.
* Experience with Python is a bonus, as the company has some legacy Python code.


**Equal opportunity employer**
**We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.**
**Application**
**Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.**
***Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound. In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Rikard Herlitz, Chief Tech Officer where he shares what makes developers most happy, what velocity means to him and how Epidemic Sound is in the sweet spot when it comes to AI.***
***Thinking about joining us?***
***Tune in***
***- and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
****Crane Currency has an immediate position opening for a Marketing Specialist, Based out of TUMBA.****
****Who we are:****
 Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 Through a combination of your strategic and creative thinking you will propose new ways to engage digitally with existing and new accounts. As a Marketing Specialist, you act as the department’s chief architect in content digital delivery, applying, sharing knowledge in the team and maintaining skills needed for conceiving of and executing communication campaigns for International Sales & Marketing. You will be part of a team connecting with heads of state and national, central banks helping them understand the value of entrusting the security of their national currency to Crane Currency. You will conceive of and lead campaigns, building an online presence to engage with and grow Crane’s worldwide customer base. You will craft strategies that help your colleagues to expand the reach of Crane Currency’s products and expertise.
   

  

****As a Marketing Specialist at Crane you will:****
* Guide the company’s digital presence, including oversight of its website and social media platforms.
* Create, manage and champion the digital content delivery strategy to the company’s central bank customers to drive and sustain engagement.
* Support the preparations, execution of and post-event follow-up for Crane branded events, seminars and industry events.
* Coordinate photo and film sessions, including scheduling, logistics, and ensuring that all materials meet brand standards.
* Assist in the execution of targeted customer outreach and co-promotion campaigns via email, website, social media platforms, customer portal, and using in-person events, as well as Crane-branded events to grow and strengthen Central Bank customer engagement.
* Establish engagement metrics useful in measuring the efficacy of the plan and its campaigns.
* Ensure that activities align with company policies and operational systems regarding safety, environment, working environment, and quality.


****Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:****
****Required:****
* Education: Associate’s degree in business-related field or commensurate experience.
* Experience: 7-10 years’ experience in marketing or PR functions with a B2G and/or B2B customer focus.
* Language: Highly proficient in English, written and spoken.
* IT: Strong working knowledge in Microsoft Office suite,
* Demonstrable knowledge and working competence with Social Media accounts, e.g., LinkedIn; familiarity with Wordpress, Umbraco, and other website tools.


**Preferred**
* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, international business, or communications.
* Analytical focused studies (programming or statistics).
* Level B driving license or equivalent.


****Tumba-Benefits****
****How we will care for you:****
 We offer top-notch medical benefits including a wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care, opportunities for personal development, community engagement activities, competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and multiple tiers of retirement plans. Discover more about our benefits here
   

  

**What Drives Our Team**

title: Senior Product Manager - B2B Experience
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 We are looking for a Senior Product Manager for our B2B Experience Team. This role is located at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 This is an exciting opportunity to lead the evolution of our product by defining and delivering innovative workflows, ensuring our solution is truly fit for purpose for businesses, enterprises, and professional teams.
   

  

 This role owns the vision, strategy, and execution of B2B workflows and experiences that enable teams to collaborate effectively, operate at scale, and realise value from our product across their organisation. You will focus on how multi-user, multi-role teams use our product day to day, and how those workflows support adoption, efficiency, and growth.
   

  

 You’ll be a key part of our B2B Product organisation within Growth Product, whose mission is to attract, retain, and expand enterprise and business customers by delivering scalable, intuitive, and organisation-ready product experiences.
   

  

 You’ll report to the SVP of Product, Growth, and work closely with a highly talented group of engineering, design, finance, marketing, and commercial partners to drive meaningful change. This is a hands-on role with significant scope to influence both the product and the business.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define, own, and evolve the vision and strategy for B2B workflows and experiences, ensuring our product is fit for purpose for teams and organisations while supporting customer and business goals.
* Build and maintain deep relationships with B2B customers and internal partners (Sales, Customer Success) to understand real-world team workflows and translate those needs into clear product direction
* Expertly communicate with internal stakeholders to make sure we are building the right things, tracking success metrics, and communicating developments.
* Collaborate with technical peers in the daily operations to ensure delivery by also keeping an eye on capabilities, happiness, resilience, and growth to empower the team.


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of Product Management experience, in B2B SaaS products.
* Proven ability to solve complex, ambiguous problems, balancing customer needs with scalable, long-term product thinking
* Experience designing multi-user, multi-role workflows and products that serve teams and enterprise customers.
* Strong ownership and decision-making skills, including setting priorities, making trade-offs, and being accountable for workflow outcomes
* Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills, able to influence stakeholders across Product, Engineering, Design and Sales
* Data-driven and outcome-oriented, with experience defining success metrics, tracking adoption, and iterating based on insights
* The ability to lead in complex and uncertain environments and thrive when you drive change and create structure


**Nice to have:**
* Experience working in dual B2C/B2B product environments


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.
   

  

**Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound.**
 In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Sam Hall, Chief Product Officer where he shares why he fell in love with Epidemic Sound, what the role of a Product Manager at Epidemic Sound entails and learning to lead in a different culture.
   

  

 Thinking about joining us?
 **Tune in** 
 - and see if it's your vibe.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Project Quality Engineer
description:
Vill du bli en del av ett härligt team och jobba med kvalitetsfrågor på ett företag i tillväxt?
   

  

 MilDef, en global ledare inom ruggade IT-lösningar, söker nu en
 **Projektkvalitetsingenjör** 
 till Stockholm (Rosersberg). Ta chansen att bli en del av en bransch som gör skillnad – varje dag.
   

  

**Din nya utmaning**
 Som Projektkvalitetsingenjör är du en nyckelperson i att säkerställa högsta kvalitet i våra integrationsprojekt. Du arbetar nära både kunder och projektteam och är med från start till leverans.
   

  

 Du får en varierad vardag där du kombinerar strategiskt kvalitetsarbete med praktiska inspektioner. Ibland sker arbetet i vår egen produktionsmiljö, ibland ute hos kund för kontroller i exempelvis olika fordon och båtar. Det är en roll för dig som gillar att se helheten, men också vara hands-on när det behövs.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Kvalitetssäkra integrationsprojekt från start till leverans, med ansvar för flera parallella projekt av varierande storlek och komplexitet.
* Identifiera och analysera kundens kvalitetskrav samt planera hur dessa ska verifieras under projektets gång.
* Utveckla och implementera kvalitetsplaner och processer i enlighet med företagets standarder och ISO 9001/14001.
* Delta i kontrakts- och designgranskningar för att säkerställa att kvalitetskrav och standarder uppfylls.
* Stödja projektteamet med expertis inom kvalitetsfrågor, exempelvis materialval, produktval och implementation.
* Skapa och underhålla kvalitetsdokumentation, inklusive egenkontroller för montörer/installatörer samt slut- och leveranskontroller.
* Genomföra kvalitetskontroller under produktions- och installationsfasen för att säkerställa korrekt montering och funktion enligt specifikation.
* Utföra slutkontroller och leveranskontroller tillsammans med kund inför projektavslut.
* Driva förbättringsinitiativ inom kvalitetsområdet och hantera förebyggande samt korrigerande åtgärder.
* Samarbeta med kvalitetsteamet (QHSE, Configuration Manager och andra projektkvalitetsingenjörer) för att utveckla processer och bedriva förbättringsarbete.
* Resa vid projekt som bedrivs på plats hos kund.


**Det här bidrar du med**
 Vi söker dig som har en stark känsla för kvalitet och trivs med att arbeta strukturerat i komplexa projektmiljöer – men som också har praktisk förståelse för konstruktion och installation. Du är lika bekväm med att analysera krav och utveckla kvalitetsplaner som att kliva in i tekniska miljöer för att kontrollera att allt fungerar som det ska.
   

  

**Vi tror att du har:**
* Erfarenhet av kvalitetsarbete i tekniska projekt, gärna inom installation, integration eller industri.
* God förståelse för kvalitetsstandarder och processer, exempelvis ISO 9001 och ISO 14001.
* Förmåga att analysera kundkrav och omsätta dem till praktiska lösningar och kontroller.
* Grundläggande kunskap om konstruktion, materialval och praktisk montering.
* Bekvämlighet med att arbeta i varierande miljöer – från produktionshallar till fordon eller båtar ute hos kund.
* Förmåga att kontrollera kabeldragningar, böjradier och komponentinstallationer samt hantera enklare mätutrustning.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och trygghet i att ta diskussioner med kunder kring tekniska frågor.
* Körkort och beredskap att resa vid behov.


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Erfarenhet av elektriska installationer och hantering av signal-/datakablar.
* Kunskap om funktionstester och felsökning.
* Erfarenhet av förbättringsarbete och kvalitetsprocesser (ISO, Lean, Six Sigma).


**Varför MilDef?**
 På MilDef får du arbeta i en engagerande och stöttande miljö där dina idéer och insatser värdesätts. Du kommer att ha möjlighet till kontinuerligt lärande och karriärutveckling samt arbeta i en team-orienterad miljö som främjar innovation och samarbete.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
* En engagerande och utvecklande roll i ett ledande företag i en expansiv bransch.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med projekt som bidrar till nationell säkerhet och försvar.
* En samarbetsvillig och stöttande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor.
* Kollektivavtal (Teknikföretagen).
* Wellness-team och generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
* Eget Gym med bastu.
* Regelbundna hälsoundersökningar.
* Happiness-teamet ordnar med roliga och personalvårdande aktiviteter.
* Arbete i helt nybyggda ändamålsenliga lokaler vid Rosersbergs pendeltågsstation.


**Ansökan**
 Om du är redo för en ny utmaning och vill bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team, skicka din ansökan snarast. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på MilDef.com. För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Alexander Sund, Head of Quality Assurance, alexander.sund@mildef.com
   

  

 Vi gör löpande urval och sista ansökningsdag är den 31 januari.
   

  

**Viktig information**
* Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller och drogtest på alla våra blivande kollegor innan anställning.
* Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Säkerhetskontroll kommer genomföras innan anställning påbörjas.
* Du talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska samt har körkort för bil, då resor i tjänsten förekommer.


***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***
*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for military, government and critical infrastructure sectors. MilDef provides hardware, software, and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest. MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia, and through partner networks in more than 40 countries. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*
**Vi undanber oss vänligen kontakt från annons- och rekryteringsförsäljning.**

title: Head of Sales Sweden
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Head of Sales Sweden to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists** 
 .
   

  

**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Head of Sales Sweden who wants to make a difference.
   

  

**The Role**
 As Head of Sales Sweden you will have overall responsibility for driving Truesec’s growth in our biggest market, Sweden. You lead and develop a high-performing sales organization while shaping and executing the national sales strategy. In addition, you play a key role in developing how sales is done at Truesec, including ways of working, sales processes, performance follow-up, and continuous improvement of our commercial model.
   

  

 The role combines strategic leadership with hands-on involvement in key customer relationships and selected deals. You work closely with internal teams to ensure strong collaboration, high customer satisfaction, and long-term value creation. As part of Truesec’s global commercial leadership, you contribute actively to the development of our overall sales strategy and share best practices from the Swedish market to support growth in other countries. You work in close partnership with the Global CRO and are a member of the global commercial leadership team. As a trusted advisor to customers and an ambassador for Truesec, you help strengthen the company’s position as a leading cybersecurity partner in Sweden.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 You have experience leading B2B sales within technology-driven environments and feel comfortable navigating complex customer needs and long sales cycles. You enjoy building strong teams and creating the conditions for others to succeed, while also contributing yourself where it matters most.
   

  

 You bring a commercial and collaborative mindset, with the ability to balance strategic direction with pragmatic execution. Experience from cybersecurity, IT services or adjacent areas is valuable, but most important is your ability to build trust, drive growth, and develop sustainable customer relationships.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Proven track record in sales leadership within B2B, preferably in technology or professional services
* Ability to lead, coach, and develop sales teams over time
* Strong orchestration skills to drive sales strategy, pipeline management, and key account management
* Strong communication skills and relationship-building capability
* Strategic mindset combined with a hands-on, solution-oriented approach
* Experience using CRM systems and sales analytics tools
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken


 Due to the sensitivity of our work, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: CloudOps Engineer till vår kund i Stockholm
description:
Du får en nyckelroll i att driva och utveckla hybrid cloud-miljöer. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar paketering och deployment av appar i Intune, integrationer och automation i Azure, samt arbete med nätverk och säkerhet. Du blir en viktig del av teamet och har stor möjlighet att påverka teknikval och arbetssätt.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera och utveckla cloudlösningar, främst i Azure och Intune.
* Paketering och deployment av appar i Intune.
* Automatisera och förbättra processer med CI/CD pipelines.
* Arbeta med nätverk, säkerhet och integrationer i molnet.
* Delta i incident-, problem- och förändringshantering.
* Samarbeta med kollegor och bidra till en trygg och effektiv IT-miljö.


**Vem vi söker?**
 Du är självgående men trivs i grupp, har ett öga för säkerhet och erfarenhet av logic apps och cloudlösningar. Du har en bred förståelse för molnteknik och har arbetat med integrationer och deployment i Azure. Du ser helheten och har ett mindset för att driva utveckling framåt.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Flera års erfarenhet av cloudmiljöer, gärna Azure och Intune.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD pipelines och integrationer.
* God förståelse för nätverk och säkerhet.
* Vana av paketering och deployment av appar.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Logic Apps är meriterande.
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska och svenska.


**Övrigt**
* Start: efter överenskommelse.
* Uppdragsform: Konsultuppdrag, med möjligt övertag till kund i framtiden.


 PASSAR VI DIG?
   

  

 Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT. Vår uppgift är att hitta rätt person till rätt IT-jobb, genom rekrytering och konsulter. Vi tror på människan i en framtida teknikutveckling och brinner för att bygga relationer, inkludera fler i IT-branschen och naturligtvis matcha rätt kompetens till rätt uppdrag. Vi vill vara en självklar go-to career partner oavsett om kandidaten söker jobb i dagsläget eller inte. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Läs mer om oss, vår kultur och våra värderingar på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 ANSÖKAN
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Johan Karlsson (Johan.Karlsson@wiseit.se). Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.

title: (Sr.) Field Application Engineer
description:
****Job Req ID: 27843****
**About Supermicro**
 Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The (Sr.) Field Application Engineer (FAE) will be part of a growing, dynamic, highly-focused team responsible for developing new or existing opportunities in the global IT market. The FAE will be required to work with customers from ground to executive-level, manage projects hand in hand with internal and external teams, and help grow the business whenever possible. Customer and solution focus, are two key factors for this position, as well as business continuity and support. The FAE must work with multiple departments to ensure new projects and existing projects are initiated or maintained towards customer requirements.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
* Works closely with the sales and extended teams to map end-user customer business, partner requirements and provide most optimized technical solutions
* Provides technical leadership in Pre-Sales and oversee implementation of such solutions
* Highly technical problem solver who understands system architecture, hardware and software interaction
* Should possess basic HW debug skills
* Manage and leads product HW and SW engineers during product development
* Manage and leads teams during investigation and resolution of problems in the field
* Has a good understanding of firmware, drivers, OS, Applications and their interaction that can cause system issues
* Develop and review systems solutions, technical bid responses and presentations
* Work cross-department to ensure customer satisfaction and timely resolution of issues
* Ability to build and demonstrate proof-of-concept that meets or exceeds customer business needs
* Ability to present the corporate brand, product messaging and solutions to customers
* Visit on-site facilities and operations to enable solution integration and issue resolution
* Some travel required (up to 25%)


**Qualifications**
* Bachelors' or Masters' degree in engineering discipline; computer science, computer engineering and electrical engineering preferred
* Excellent communication skills and business sense required
* Minimum 5 year related experience with Compute/Storage Server or Data Center or IT Infrastructure experience desired
* Strong background and experience with x86-based server architecture
* Solid HW system design and diagnostics skills
* Familiarity with Firmware, Linux, Windows and virtualization platforms is a plus
* Strong technical communication and leadership skills to lead investigations with engineers of multiple disciplines
* Individual must be able to work effectively in a high pressure environment
* Fluency in English and Swedish required, other languages are plus


****EEO Statement****
 Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

title: Lead Systems Programmer
description:
As the Lead Systems Programmer, you will play a key role in shaping and evolving the core systems that drive our games technical foundation. This is a hands-on leadership role, balancing individual technical contribution with coaching and developing a team of engineers.
   

  

 You will lead a team of programmers who are responsible for evolving our engine and its core systems such as spawning, memory management, job scheduling, threading frameworks, streaming, TRCs, while profiling, debugging, and optimizing across PC and current-generation consoles. Your work will influence both the project and shared engine technology across the studio in both the short and longer term vision of the project. You will exercise autonomy within the technical direction of the project.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
**Technical Leadership**
* Own and evolve core runtime systems, ensuring stability, performance, and scalability.
* Make day-to-day systems-level decisions in collaboration with the Technical Director and Technical Art Director.
* Drive technical standards, code quality, and best practices across the team.
* Profile, debug, and optimize the game on PC and consoles.
* Contribute improvements to shared systems to benefit the wider studio.


**Team Leadership & Career Growth**
* Mentor and support your direct reports, fostering professional growth. As their manager you are responsible for the entire employee life cycle and everything in between.
* Encourage knowledge sharing and collaboration within the team.
* Promote a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning.
* Provide constructive feedback and career guidance.
* Ensure the team thrives within the project’s technical direction.


**Collaboration & Delivery**
* Work closely with producers and other leads to maintain smooth project execution.
* Remove blockers and support high team productivity.
* Advocate for technical excellence across disciplines.
* Align your team with broader project goals.
* Facilitate effective cross-team communication.


**Who You Are**
* Experienced professional programmer in the gaming industry.
* Strong C++ and low-level systems expertise.
* Experience working with games engines in shipped titles or a live project.
* Experience working with proprietary engines is a plus.
* At least one current generation console title shipped.
* Experience with Console platform SDKs.
* Leadership experience with a focus on mentoring technical teams.
* Deep understanding of console architectures and performance constraints.
* Strong communicator and collaborative team player.
* Commitment to code quality, testing, and robust systems.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Bli en del av vårt team inom #nätverk och #säkerhet!
description:
***B3 Networks***
*är specialistbolaget inom #nätverk och #säkerhet. Med kompetens inom det mesta från* 
***nätverksdrift, automatisering, trådlöst***
*och* 
***SD-Wan***
*till vass kompetens inom produkter som Cisco, Checkpoint, Palo Alto och Aruba har vi garanterat det bästa nätverksteamet i Sverige. Alltid med säkerhetsperspektivet i fokus.*
 Våra nätverksspecialister trivs bäst när de när de får lösa problem hos våra kunder, hänga med kollegorna och snacka teknik. De gillar också att fokusera på kompetenshöjning i alla former, från egen utveckling till kompetensöverföring mellan kollegorna. De är ett starkt team med schyssta värderingar - som ställer upp för varandra och har roligt på jobbet.
   

  

 Vi är är verkligen stolta - och skryter gärna om - att Sveriges vassaste nätverksspecialister jobbar hos oss. Med det sagt vill vi nu bli fler kollegor. Vi söker vassa nätverksspecialister såväl som arkitekter med lång erfarenhet av design inom #nätverk och #säkerhet.
   

  

 För att passa hos oss ser vi gärna att du;
   

  

* har spetskompetens inom #nätverk, #säkerhet och automation.
* är kreativ och skapar lösningar som ger mervärde för kunden.
* tycker om att träffa kunder och har lätt för att snabbt bli en del av kundens team.
* driver din egen kompetensutveckling
* hittar nya tekniska lösningar och är en teknisk stjärna inom nätverk
* har jobbat med produkter som till exempel Cisco, Fortinet, Aruba, Juniper, Python och Checkpoint.
* uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* vill ha roligt på jobbet och bidrar till gemenskap och skratt med kollegor


 Vi erbjuder roliga uppdrag, tight gemenskap, engagerade ledare och kollegor, roliga aktiviteter, en konkurrenskraftig lönemodell, bra förmåner och en skön arbetsvardag att jobba i.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta Åsa som är ansvarig för search och rekrytering eller ansök direkt!
   

  

**Ser fram emot att höra från dig!**
*B3 Networks är en del av B3 koncernen som vid flertal tillfällen blivit utsedd till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser och Sveriges IT Karriärföretag. Våra värdeord* 
***erfarenhet, olikheter***
*och* 
***energi***
*är en del av vår vardag och vi jobbar med hållbarhet i alla led. Vi vet att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bra och därför arrangerar vi regelbundna aktiviteter inom wellness; alltifrån yoga, simning och löpning till musikquiz, stickcafé och föreläsningar om stress och mental hälsa.*

title: Project Controller, Motor Vehicle Industry
description:
Your role
   

  

 As a Global Project Controller, you will play a key role in improving project profitability and efficiency across our global operations. You will work closely with project teams and local controllers to provide insights, standardize processes, and develop tools that support smarter business decisions.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Include**
* Analyze consolidated project gross profit and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Implement global standards for project reporting and costing tools.
* Build dashboards and business intelligence tools to visualize efficiency and cost trends.
* Monitor work-in-progress and proactively flag financial risks.
* Partner with global and local teams to ensure accurate reporting and continuous improvement.


 To succeed, you will need
   

  

 You are proactive, analytical, and thrive in an international environment. You enjoy working with data and turning insights into action. Strong communication skills help you collaborate effectively across cultures and functions.
   

  

**What You Bring**
* A university degree in finance, business, or accounting.
* A few years of experience in controlling or financial analysis.
* Excellent Excel skills and solid accounting knowledge.
* Fluency in English (written and spoken).


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Experience with project costing.
* Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools.
* Familiarity with SAP systems.


 In return, we offer
   

  

* Culture of trust and accountability
* Lifelong learning and career growth
* Innovation powered by people
* Comprehensive compensation and benefits
* Health and well-being


 Job location
   

  

 This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, allowing you to split your time between working remotely and being on-site in Stockholm, Sweden (SE). Our office is in Sickla/Nacka, just 10 minutes from central Stockholm.
   

  

 Contact information
   

  

 For questions about the role or the process, feel free to contact hiring manager Kathy Zhao, kathy.zhao@atlascopco.com.
   

  

**Uniting curious minds**
 Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.

title: Senior Product Manager - API Platform
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us — and let the world feel your work.**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Product Manager** 
 for our Growth Product Area. This role is located at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 This is an exciting opportunity to lead our publicly facing API platform, powering developers, partners to build scalable integrations and experiences. This role owns the vision, strategy, and execution of APIs that are critical to our product ecosystem and business growth.
   

  

 You’ll be a key part of our Growth Product department, whose mission is to attract and retain enterprises, businesses and professional creators that are soundtracking content globally.
   

  

 You’ll report to the SVP of product in Growth and get to work with a super talented group of engineering, design, finance, marketing and commercial colleagues to drive change. This is a hands-on role, where you can make a significant impact.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Form and grow a vision, strategy for the public API team that helps serve our customers and business goals.
* Build strong relationships with our external customers and business teams to ensure we have alignment to unlock the right capabilities.
* Expertly communicate with internal stakeholders to make sure we are building the right things, tracking success metrics, and communicating developments.
* Collaborate with technical peers in the daily operations to ensure delivery by also keeping an eye on capabilities, happiness, resilience, and growth to empower the team.


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of product management experience, including ownership of platforms or APIs
* Strong understanding of REST and/or GraphQL APIs, authentication, versioning, and SDKs.
* Experience shipping and operating public or partner-facing APIs
* Excellent relationship-building skills, helping your team prioritize and communicating that priority in the organization
* The ability to lead in complex and uncertain environments and thrive when you drive change and create structure


**Nice to have**
* Familiarity with API monetization models (usage-based, tiered pricing, freemium)
* Experience working with a saas and enterprise businesses models.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.
   

  

**Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound.**
 In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Sam Hall, Chief Product Officer where he shares why he fell in love with Epidemic Sound, what the role of a Product Manager at Epidemic Sound entails and learning to lead in a different culture.
   

  

 Thinking about joining us?
 **Tune in** 
 - and see if it's your vibe.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Credit Risk Manager
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech bank. In 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to a licensed bank with 1 billion SEK in annual revenue, supporting over 50,000 small businesses. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding fast, fair, and flexible for the people who build our society. We are now looking for a Credit Risk Manager to join our Stockholm office to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**The role**
 In this role, you will be a technical authority within the Credit Domain. You will lead the strategic development of our credit processes across our core business loans and our growing credit card portfolio. This isn't about just following rules; it's about using your expertise to build, challenge, and optimize the frameworks that allow us to scale safely. You’ll work closely with Product, Engineering, and Data Science to ensure our risk models aren't just theoretically sound, but practically superior.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Strategic Optimization: Take ownership of the credit origination and underwriting processes for both business loans and cards.
* Portfolio Management: Define and monitor the framework for credit limit adjustments, balancing automated efficiency with portfolio health.
* Data-Driven Leadership: Build and maintain advanced dashboards to monitor product performance and identify emerging risk trends.
* Technical Collaboration: Partner with the card and loan product teams to automate credit processes while maintaining high quality and compliance.
* Model Refinement: Provide expert feedback to improve risk models and underwriting practices based on real-world portfolio behavior.
* Policy Evolution: Drive changes in the credit policy to reflect market shifts and internal learnings, ensuring we stay ahead of the competition.


**Qualifications**
* A Master’s Degree in Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, or another quantitative field.
* Significant experience in credit and analytics within a bank, fintech, or top-tier consultancy.
* Strong technical skills in Python and SQL for deep-dive analysis.
* Expertise in visualization tools like Amazon Quicksight Power BI, Qlikview or similar.


**Skills That Will Make You Stand Out**
* Experience from credit card businesses, either targeting small businesses or consumers.
* Deep understanding of credit scoring models and their application in lending.
* Project management skills or experience.


**Why join us?**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Director Consulting Services - Data Insights, Stockholm
description:
CGI’s Data Insights business unit is growing, and we are looking for a commercially driven data leader who can take our business to the next level. This role is ideal for an experienced leader with deep expertise in data and analytics who is equally passionate about driving sales, growing client relationships, and building high-performing teams.
   

  

 As Director Consulting Services (DCS), you will have overall responsibility for developing and scaling the Data Insights consulting business in Stockholm. You will combine strong leadership in data and analytics with clear ownership of business development, revenue growth, and profitability, working closely with clients, sales teams, and delivery leaders.
   

  

 CGI’s Data Insights unit delivers advanced solutions within Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Master Data Management, helping clients turn data into measurable business value.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 As Director Consulting Services, you will be accountable for both data excellence and commercial performance, including:
   

  

* Sales & Business Development: Own and drive sales within Data Insights in Stockholm by identifying opportunities, developing client relationships, shaping offerings, and closing new and expanded engagements.
* Data & Analytics Leadership: Act as a senior leader within data and analytics, guiding solution direction and ensuring CGI remains a trusted advisor in data-driven transformation.
* Revenue & Profitability Ownership: Full responsibility for meeting and exceeding revenue, margin, and growth targets for the consulting practice.
* Client Engagement & Delivery Oversight: Maintain senior client relationships and ensure high-quality deliveries, contributing to projects when needed.
* People Leadership: Lead, coach, and develop a team of initially 10–15 consultants, fostering a culture of performance, learning, and engagement.
* Recruitment & Team Growth: Actively attract, recruit, and onboard top talent to support business growth.
* Management Team Contribution: Actively contribute to the Data Insights and M&T management teams, shaping strategy and long-term direction.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 We are looking for a leader with a strong data and analytics background who thrives in a commercial, client-facing leadership role.
   

  

 To succeed as a DCS, you bring:
   

  

* Proven experience leading data, BI, or analytics consulting organizations, preferably with P&L or revenue responsibility.
* A strong sales mindset, with demonstrated success in business development, client growth, and opportunity management.
* Deep understanding of data-driven solutions and how they create business value for clients.
* A passion for developing people and building high-performing, scalable consulting teams.
* The ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment while maintaining strategic focus.


 Additional qualifications:
   

  

* Background as a consultant is highly meritorious.
* Relevant university degree.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 Key Skills & Competencies
   

  

* Sales & Business Development
* Data & Analytics Leadership
* Business Intelligence & Data Management
* Client Relationship & Stakeholder Management
* Revenue & Profitability Management
* People Leadership & Team Development


****More About The Role****
 Location: Stockholm
   

  

 Start date: As agreed.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing, so submit your application today.
   

  

 For further information about the role, please contact Maria Fridén, Vice President Consulting Services, at maria.friden@cgi.com.
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Rail Rolling Stock Sector Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence** 
 . The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Projects Directorate (PJ) – Mobility Department (MOBILITY) - Mobile Assets and Deployment Division (MADE), at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Rail Rolling Stock Sector Engineer.
   

  

 This is a full-time position at grade 5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
   

  

* internal benchmark Sector Engineer


***Panel interviews are anticipated for January***
*Are you passionate about shaping the future of sustainable transport across Europe and beyond? As a Sector Engineer in the EIB’s dynamic MOBILITY Department, you’ll play a pivotal role in assessing and guiding major capital investment projects that impact millions of people. Your expertise will help ensure that rail and transport initiatives are not only technically sound, but also environmentally and economically viable-making a real difference in the way communities connect and thrive. This is your chance to lead meaningful change, working at the heart of Europe’s efforts to modernise and innovate in the transport sector. For further insights, please join our* 
*Jobinar* 
*.*
 Purpose
   

  

 Step into a pivotal role where you will lead the technical assessment of high-impact capital investment projects and programmes in the rail rolling stock sector. Your expertise will also be valued in other transport domains, including rail infrastructure and mobile assets, both within and beyond the EU. You’ll play a key part in evaluating projects from every angle-technical, environmental, economic, and financial-ensuring they meet the highest standards and contribute to the Bank’s mission.
   

  

 Specific Post Environment
   

  

 Join the dynamic MOBILITY Department, which is at the forefront of shaping the future of transport across Europe and beyond. Our team covers a wide spectrum of sectors; rail, road, air, and waterborne transport, as well as mobile assets and innovative technologies. As a Sector Engineer, you’ll collaborate closely with talented engineers and economists, working in multi-disciplinary teams on exciting projects. You’ll also engage with colleagues from Lending, Legal, Transaction Management, and Advisory Services, and build relationships with project promoters and external stakeholders. If you’re looking for variety, the chance to work both inside and outside the EU (and are available to travel), this is the environment for you.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 Reporting directly to the Head of Division, you’ll enjoy regular interaction with colleagues across various Directorates, especially those involved in lending and financial monitoring. Your network will extend beyond the Bank, as you connect with project promoters, borrowers, local authorities, consultants, and other key external partners. This role offers a unique opportunity to build a broad professional network and make a tangible impact on major transport initiatives.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Shape the Future of Transport: You’ll review new projects and programmes at an early stage to make sure they fit with the EIB’s Transport Lending Policy and other requirements of EIB policies.
* Assess Project Viability: You’ll evaluate the technical and environmental aspects of transport projects, especially rail rolling stock, and check that procurement processes, technical, regulatory, and operational standards are met and fit for purpose.
* Work as a Team: You’ll collaborate with economists to ensure that technical risks are identified and managed, supporting the overall economic and financial assessment of projects.
* Oversee Project Progress: You’ll monitor how investments and programmes are implemented, ensuring they comply with loan conditions and EIB policies, both during and after the project implementation if needed.
* Protect the Bank’s Reputation: You’ll work closely with monitoring teams to spot and address any reputational or financial risks for the Bank.
* Communicate Insights: You’ll prepare clear, high-quality reports that summarise your findings and support decision-making.
* Support Decision-Making: You’ll provide technical input for documents used by the Bank’s decision-making bodies.
* Advise and Build Capacity: You’ll offer technical advice and support for projects and investments, help build capacity, and contribute to broader initiatives, both within and outside the EU. This includes giving expert advice, drafting terms of reference, and overseeing external consultants.
* Collaborate Widely: You’ll work with other EIB departments, the European Commission, international financial institutions, and industry associations on transport policy and sector questions.
* Stay Up to Date: You’ll keep up with the latest developments in rolling stock technologies, market trends, and regulations, and support your department with sector-wide tasks.
* Contribute to Knowledge: You’ll help with sector studies, policy papers, and analyses, especially in your areas of expertise.
* Represent the EIB: You’ll represent the Bank at selected sector events, sharing your knowledge and building relationships.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Master) preferably in Engineering. Post graduate qualification and/or professional experience in other relevant fields (e.g. in economics, and/or transport planning) would be an asset.
* At least 5 years of relevant professional experience in transport, preferably in the railway rolling stock sector (in rolling stock procurement (defining the technical specifications, supervision of production and commissioning), manufacturing, operations, asset management or in technical advisory in the above subjects for companies operating in these areas). Preferred experience includes technical or environmental project monitoring throughout the project lifecycle, with expertise in one or more of the following areas: planning, design, construction, supervision, commissioning, procurement, contract management, operations or maintenance.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*\*), with a good command of the other.


**It Would Be An Advantage If You Have**
* Experience and / or knowledge of other sectors covered by the division (car and truck fleets, shipping, aircraft, EV charging), as well as experience in multiple EU countries would be an asset.
* Exposure to PPP/Project Finance, innovative funding structures of investments and private sector participation in transport projects would be an asset.
* Good knowledge of relevant EU sector policies and regulations, and understanding of the political & operational framework in which the Bank operates would be an asset.
* Knowledge of German would be a strong advantage. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Business Controller
description:
Join Dustin as a Business Controller where your hands-on, proactive approach will directly impact business success, collaborating closely with senior leadership in a fast-changing, ambitious environment. If you’re driven to challenge the status quo and thrive on turning insights into action, this is the role for you!
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Business Controller fun**
* Direct exposure to senior management, offering opportunities to influence high-level strategic decisions
* Drive meaningful business impact by contributing to critical financial and operational initiatives
* Collaborate closely with senior business control colleagues, enhancing cross-functional insight and expertise


***My name is Cecilia Rudeberg. I am the Direcor Business Control.***
*As a leader, I strive to create a clear, supportive, and coaching environment where we continuously grow and succeed together as a team.*
**Your role & influence as Business Controller**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for acting as a strategic business partner to managers and senior leadership, with a strong focus on driving performance and insights.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of financial planning, analysis, and follow-up. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with Sales and Operations to ensure aligned strategies and informed decision-making.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Lead financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and performance analysis to support business objectives
* Act as a strategic business partner, collaborating with department heads and senior leadership to drive informed decision-making
* Monitor and manage P&L, ensuring cost control and identifying opportunities for margin improvement
* Develop and deliver clear financial reporting and insights, translating data into actionable recommendations
* Ensure compliance with financial policies, internal controls, and support governance requirement.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
**This Is What We Imagine You Bring**
 We envision you as a curious, driven, motivated, and ambitious individual with a hands-on approach who takes initiative to improve processes and drive meaningful change through strong collaboration and analytical insight. You are proactive and comfortable working in a changing environment.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That**
* You have a bachelor's degree level of working and thinking and you have business controller experience in a large company
* You possess strong collaboration and analytical skills, enabling you to deliver accurate financial analysis
* You have a good command of the Swedish language, both spoken and written


**What can you expect next?**
 To ensure a fair recruitment process free from unconscious bias, we handle your application anonymously and do not accept cover letters. Please refrain from sending one, so that the selection is based solely on professional competencies. We expect the following steps in the recruitment process.
   

  

* Telephone screening with TA Partner Titus Hessel Welin
* 1st interview with Cecilia Rudeberg
* 2nd interview with somebody from the team
* background check


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Titus Hessel Welin via e-mail: titus.hesselwelin@dustin.com
   

  

**Please apply in English. We will start reviewing applications and moving forward in the recruitment process in mid-January. Thank you for your patience, and we look forward to connecting then.**

title: Senior Data Engineer - Connectors
description:
**Why This Role Matters**
 The Connector teams are at the heart of Funnel’s value proposition. Without them, we couldn’t deliver the high-quality, reliable data our customers depend on every day. Our connectors integrate data from hundreds of marketing platforms into Funnel, making it ready for analysis, reporting, and activation.
   

  

 The teams work closely with customers to understand their needs, enrich the data available in Funnel, and continuously refine our data modeling and semantics. We’re also investing in bringing more AI into the data-integration workflow, helping us strengthen our promise of accurate, dependable data.
   

  

**About The Engineering Team & Your Role**
 Our engineering teams own their product areas end to end, making decisions daily in close collaboration both within and across teams, as well as with stakeholders. We work in small, iterative cycles experimenting, learning, and shipping improvements multiple times a day. We also use AI agents to accelerate everything from early prototyping and experimentation to building, shipping, and continuously learning in production.
   

  

 The Connectors team focuses on reliably fetching marketing data from diverse platforms like Facebook, Google, and TikTok. We unify this data so it’s immediately accessible and actionable for marketers through the Funnel Datahub. With more than 500 connectors, the team ensures each one works seamlessly out of the box for our customers.
   

  

 At Funnel, engineers play a broad role: designing architecture, implementing features, deploying services, and monitoring performance. We put customers first and aim to build products that solve real problems and exceed expectations.
   

  

**Skills & Experience We’re Looking For**
* Strong experience with Python and data-frame libraries such as Pandas or Polars
* Hands-on experience with data integration and ETL pipelines
* Default to leveraging AI agents to accelerate the full engineering lifecycle from rapid prototyping to production development and continuous learning
* Familiarity with data-warehouse modeling techniques
* Comfortable working with large datasets, optimizing pipelines, ensuring data quality, and applying the right approach for efficient data processing
* Experience working in agile, collaborative teams, partnering closely with other engineers, adapting to change, and driving initiatives to completion
* Experience improving engineering practices and processes
* Experience leading or steering projects with multiple stakeholders
* Strong communication skills and fluency in English


**Why You Should Join Us**
* Build meaningful tech that powers millions of daily jobs for customers around the world.
* Help shape our next-gen platform as we grow and move toward an AI-first future.
* Enjoy real ownership with the freedom to design, build, and ship every day.
* Work with friendly, collaborative teams who care about quality and each other.
* Grow with us in a company that invests in learning, innovation, and people.


**Location & Eligibility**
 At This Time, We Can Only Consider Applicants Who Are Already Based In Stockholm And Meet One Of The Following Criteria
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship and are currently living in Stockholm
* Have a valid Swedish work permit


**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays. We just like to avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

 \*\*\*A note from the Talent Acquisition team: We will start reviewing applications in late January 2026!\*\*\*
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Group Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Country:** 
 Sweden
   

  

**Application due date:** 
 1/31/2026 23:59:59 UTC
   

  

 Are you an experienced recruiter ready to take your expertise to the next level? Join us in shaping the future of Talent Acquisition while staying close to the action. This is your chance to be part of a dynamic environment where collaboration, dedication, and innovation drives success. In spring 2026, we will launch Oracle and introduce global processes and ways of working - making this an exciting time to contribute and influence our journey forward.
   

  

 Becoming part of the SSAB family means joining a journey. A journey that we believe is essential for the sustainability of this planet. Steel has been one of the most important materials for developing our society and it will continue to be so. In the roofs over our heads, in the bridges connecting our cities and in the cars of tomorrow. At SSAB we are proud of our history and leadership in high-strength steel. But we are also aware that the production of steel is one of the largest emitters of greenhouse gases in the world. That has to change. That is why we have developed the world’s ﬁrst fossil free steel production and has committed to becoming largely fossil-free. As part of SSAB you will be instrumental in realizing this goal and push for the green transformation of the whole steel industry.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As the Group Talent Acquisition Partner at SSAB Group HR, you’ll combine strategic influence with hands-on delivery. You will lead the implementation of our newly established Talent Acquisition Center of Excellence (CoE), overseeing and optimizing SSAB’s global recruitment processes and sourcing platforms. You will also drive collaboration forums to ensure alignment and effectiveness across regions, build shared talent pools, and strengthen global recruitment strategies.
