 In this role, you will also manage global communication assets in line with SSAB’s Employee Value Proposition (EVP) and deliver end-to-end recruitment for Group Function roles - covering everything from sourcing and screening to offer negotiations.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Deliver full-cycle recruitment for Group Function roles.
* Own the global recruitment process and drive continuous improvement.
* Lead recruitment collaboration forums across regions and stakeholders.
* Define KPIs and, in partnership with HR Tech, establish and maintain reporting structures and dashboards for tracking, trend analysis, and actionable insights.
* Support and guide local and regional TA teams in how to apply data insights for better decision-making.
* Set standards for sourcing strategies and the strategic use of external partners.
* Manage vendor agreements for Group Functions and ensure cost control
* Collaborate with Corporate Communication to create global content that strengthens the employer brand.


**About You**
* Several years of experience managing end-to-end recruitment, ideally in a global, decentralized setting.
* University degree in HR Management, or a related field.
* Strong sourcing expertise, including advanced search strategies, LinkedIn, and leveraging personal networks.
* Analytical skills with ability to interpret recruitment metrics and turn data into actionable insights.
* Experience in interpreting and communicating test result from assessment tools (e.g., Alva Labs or similar). Certification is a plus, not a requirement.
* Experience in Employer Branding and managing digital communication platforms is a plus
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish or Finnish and English.
* High proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel for presenting data and insights clearly.


**Our offer**
 At SSAB we strive for a diverse and inclusive environment. We use our values – driven, true and ahead – in making everyday decisions, keeping the customer at the heart of what we do. This makes us all team players, each with the drive to improve. When joining SSAB you will become part of an organization of passionate problem solvers working together on important challenges. We will support your growth by providing a safe and friendly workplace that contributes to work-life balance. If you set out to achieve it, at SSAB you will have the possibility of broadening your skills and grow within your field or beyond.
   

  

 We offer a wide range of appreciated benefits to our employees. Some examples of these are listed here:
   

  

 Profit sharing
   

  

 Life balance through reduction of working hours
   

  

 Wellness grants
   

  

**Recruitment process**
 1. Apply
   

  

 2. Interview
   

  

 3. Come and meet us
   

  

 4. Reference Check
   

  

 5. Health Examination
   

  

 6. Sign
   

  

 Background check may be a part of the recruitment process.
   

  

**Got questions about this position?**
 Please contact Malin Blank, Head of People Development, People, Culture & Sustainability
   

  

 Contact Malin via e-mail - malin.blank@ssab.com
   

  

 Please contact Nina Herke, Group HR Business Partner, People, Culture & Sustainability
   

  

 Contact Nina via e-mail - nina.herke@ssab.com
   

  

 We decline contacts from recruitment agencies and ad sellers regarding this advertisement.
   

  

 Trade union information is provided by Akademikerföreningen, Unionen and Ledarna, which can be reached via our switchboard on phone +46 8 454 57 00.
   

  

**Word from your future manager**
 "After five years in at SSAB, I can assure you: you’ll join a global company where collaboration, innovation, and professional growth are part of everyday life.
   

  

 What matters most to me is how we work together—seeing each other’s strengths, staying curious, and sharing what we learn. I bring energy and a forward thinking attitude, and I value working with people who are transparent, collaborative, and professional. Trust and transparency aren’t buzzwords; they’re how we move forward.
   

  

 In this new and important role, you’ll be my partner in shaping our Group wide talent acquisition craft—from how we tell our story to candidates to how we use insight and data to raise the bar on quality and speed. If you’re self driven, enjoy a fast pace, and like solving challenges in a company of our size and ambition, I’d love to welcome you on this journey toward a stronger, lighter, and more sustainable world."
   

  

 Malin Blank, Head of People Development, People, Culture & Sustainability
   

  

**Join us at SSAB**

title: Product developer, AFRY Automotive
description:
**Company Description**
**About AFRY:** 
 AFRY provides engineering, design, digital and advisory services. We are devoted experts in industry, energy and infrastructure sectors, creating impact for generations to come. AFRY has Nordic roots with a global reach.
   

  

 Our shared principles - Results driven, Client Centric, Empowering and Accountable - guide us in how we work, grow and succeed together. Join us and unlock transitions towards a sustainable and resilient society.
   

  

**About AFRY Automotive** 
**:**
* Shape the Future of Sustainable Mobility


 AFRY Automotive, located in the Stockholm region with office in Södertälje/Solna, operates in a truly international environment, collaborating with several sites worldwide, including Brazil, India, and Gothenburg. We support our customers with expertise in design, engineering, and embedded systems, both through in-house projects and on-site with the customer. AFRY Automotive provides consulting services to the automotive industry and genuinely contributes to a more sustainable future by creating smarter and more sustainable vehicles.
   

  

 The automotive industry is undergoing significant transformation, with vehicles increasingly being designed and produced to become more autonomous and electrified. This shift aims to create a sustainable transport sector for the future, and AFRY Automotive is at the heart of this exciting change.
   

  

**Team Culture** 
**:**
 At AFRY Automotive, we believe in fostering a supportive and inclusive team culture where everyone feels valued and heard. Our teams are built on mutual respect, collaboration, and a shared passion for innovation. We encourage open communication and the sharing of ideas, knowing that diverse perspectives lead to better solutions. Our workplace is one where you can grow both professionally and personally, with opportunities for continuous learning and development. We celebrate successes together and support each other through challenges, creating a positive and enjoyable work environment. Laughter and team spirit are integral parts of our daily work life, making AFRY Automotive not just a place to work, but a place to thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
**About the role**
 Are you passionate about innovation and eager to make a real impact? Do you want to help design the next generation of heavy vehicles? If so, we’d love to welcome you to our team!
   

  

 In this role, you will join us as a
 **Product developer** 
 within the automotive industry. Your assignments may take place both in-house and on-site with our clients, giving you the chance to explore diverse projects and environments. From cab interior to chassis layout, you’ll work on exciting challenges that truly matter.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a supportive and collaborative team where ideas are valued, and every voice counts. We believe in creating an environment where you can grow, share knowledge, and feel empowered to make a difference. Strong communication skills are essential, as you’ll help translate complex concepts into clear, actionable goals.
   

  

**What Our People Say About AFRY**
*"AFRY is known as one of the most inspiring workplaces in the industry. It’s a creative space that brings together people from different cultures and backgrounds."*
*"The culture here is a wonderful mix of professionalism and fun. We work on innovative ideas, collaborate closely, and grow together as colleagues."*
**Qualifications**
**What We’re Looking For**
* Several years of experience in product development within the manufacturing industry
* At least two years of experience with OAS, Catia V5, and Fras
* Background in vehicle development
* A relevant academic degree, such as Mechanical Engineering, Product development
* Proficiency in English (spoken and written); Swedish is a plus


**Who You Are**
 You’re someone who inspires and energizes those around you. You thrive in a team setting, enjoy building relationships, and feel motivated by challenges. You have a genuine interest in technology and a passion for developing your skills as an engineer and innovator.
   

  

**Join us at AFRY and be part of shaping a sustainable future. Your ideas matter here.**
**Additional Information**
 At AFRY, you’ll have the opportunity to grow in an environment where technology, structure, and care go hand in hand. We believe in the power of collaboration, continuous learning, and creating solutions that make a real difference – for our clients and for society as a whole.
   

  

 Welcome to submit your application, the deadline is
 **2026-01-31**
 Please note that selection will be ongoing, but due to the up coming holidays, responses to your application may be delayed until after the holidays.
   

  

 Don't forget to update suitable information for this position in your CV.
   

  

 We only accept applications thrue this system. Apply by clicking the "Apply now" button. Applications by e-mail will not be considered.
   

  

 Contact persons for questions:
   

  

**Sara Mukkala** 
 , Service Area Team Manager
   

  

 sara.mukkala@afry.com
   

  

 We kindly ask not to be contacted by staffing and recruitment agencies or salespeople offering additional job advertisements.
   

  

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

title: Senior Software Engineer – AI Product Experience
description:
**Why This Role Matters**
 This team is central to how we deliver AI to our customers. From the infrastructure and RAG pipelines that power intelligence behind the scenes to the conversational UI that brings it to life, this team owns the entire experience. As a senior engineer, your impact will be immediate and highly visible you’ll help define how customers interact with Funnel’s AI capabilities and shape the future of AI-driven marketing insights.
   

  

**About The Engineering Team & Your Role**
 Our engineering teams have deep ownership of their product areas, making daily decisions in close collaboration across teams and with stakeholders. We work in small, iterative cycles- experimenting, learning, and deploying to production multiple times a day. We work closely with AI agents to accelerate the full engineering lifecycle, from rapid prototyping to production development and continuous learning.
   

  

 As a senior engineer on this team, you will drive technical direction across the full AI feature stack: infrastructure, RAG pipelines, Amazon Bedrock integrations, and the web UI that delivers the experience. You’ll play a key role in making architectural decisions, improving systems, and ensuring our AI features are robust, scalable, and intuitive.
   

  

 We primarily use
 **Python and TypeScript, and our entire platform runs in AWS** 
 .
   

  

 At Funnel, engineers own the full lifecycle from architecture and design to implementation, deployment, and monitoring. Senior engineers also mentor others, elevate engineering quality, and help shape product strategy through technical insight.
   

  

**Skills & Experience We’re Looking For**
* Experience building applications with LLMs, including techniques such as RAG, embeddings, vector search, and prompt engineering
* Hands-on experience setting up and maintaining cloud-based AI workloads
* Strong backend engineering skills in TypeScript, Python, or similar languages
* AI mindset: leveraging AI agents to to accelerate the full engineering lifecycle, from rapid prototyping to production development and continuous learning
* Experience designing and operating scalable infrastructure, including APIs, data pipelines, and observability
* Comfortable working with web technologies and building user-facing features (e.g., React, Next.js, or similar frameworks)
* Comfortable working in agile, collaborative teams, partnering closely with fellow engineers and keeping initiatives moving smoothly
* Experience leading or steering projects involving multiple stakeholders
* Strong communication skills and fluency in English


**Why You Should Join Us**
* Build meaningful tech that powers millions of daily jobs for customers around the world.
* Help shape our next-gen platform as we grow and move toward an AI-first future.
* Enjoy real ownership with the freedom to design, build, and ship every day.
* Work with friendly, collaborative teams who care about quality and each other.
* Grow with us in a company that invests in learning, innovation, and people.


**Location & Eligibility**
 At This Time, We Can Only Consider Applicants Who Are Already Based In Stockholm And Meet One Of The Following Criteria
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship and are currently living in Stockholm
* Have a valid Swedish work permit


**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays. We just like to avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

 \*\*\*A note from the Talent Acquisition team: We will start reviewing applications in late January 2026!\*\*\*
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Sales Specialist – Services
description:
Are you a proactive and results-driven sales professional with a passion for Managed Services? As a Sales Specialist at Dustin, you'll have the opportunity to drive Managed Services sales such as Security Services (Powered by Truesec), Network as a Service, Modern workplace — while growing your expertise in a dynamic and supportive team environment!
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Sales Specialis** 
**t unique**
* Take a proactive role in identifying customer needs and driving Managed Services sales, helping our customers focus on their core business
* Join a dynamic and collaborative sales environment where you work closely with Account Managers and other specialists to maximize customer success
* Enjoy a role with vast opportunities for professional growth, continuous learning, and the ability to shape the future of Managed Services sales at Dustin


 My name is Johan Huhtanen, and I am the Manager for our Managed Services and Software Sales teams in Sweden. As a leader, I strive to create an inclusive and engaging environment where every team member feels valued and empowered to contribute to our shared success.
   

  

**Your role & influence as
 **Sales Specialist****
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for driving Managed Services sales by proactively identifying opportunities, advising customers on the best solutions, and collaborating with Account Managers to maximize business growth within the commercial sector in Sweden
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of driving Managed Services sales and delivering tailored solutions that meet customer needs. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with Account Managers and Customer Success Managers to identify opportunities, create value, and ensure long-term customer success
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Prospecting and proactively identifying new sales opportunities
* Closing deals by negotiating and delivering Managed Services solutions
* Advising customers on the best Managed Services options to optimize their business operations


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe we offer so much more than what benefits on a list can say. But you won’t know that until you join us. So, we will still want to list a few:
   

  

* A one-time home office allowance of 3.500 SEK to buy home office equipment
* Collective agreement, pension plans according to ITP1, parental pay, and insurance
* Employee discount for products through our Dustin web shop
* A flexible work life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
* Bring your dog! – we have an office area specifically for you and your best friend


**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who proactively identifies opportunities, challenges customers to find the best Managed Services, and stays up to date with the latest industry developments.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That**
* You have a bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* You have experience from Managed Services Sales
* Experience with sales, presales, and technical sales, ideally within the IT or Software sector
* Knowledge of vendors such as Microsoft, with certifications being a plus


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone check-up with Talent Acquisition Partner Ida Wannebro
* Personality and cognitive assessment
* 1st interview with Director Solution Sales Sara Nordin
* 2nd interview with Manager Managed Services and Software Johan Huhtanen


 For questions about the position, please contact Ida via e-mail: ida.wannebro@dustin.com

title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Platform Infrastructure
description:
**Why This Role Matters**
 Our data platform sits at the heart of everything we do. Every day, it powers over 9 million download jobs and 1.7 million customer queries and exports across the globe. As part of the Data Platform team, you’ll work on the core systems that make this scale possible. Three tightly aligned teams own the responsibilities of job scheduling, data retrieval, storage, transformation, and exposing data across the product.
   

  

 We’re evolving our platform and technology stack, and we’re looking for someone who can bring deep expertise in distributed systems, data infrastructure, and large-scale architecture. This is a high-impact role with meaningful influence on our technical direction—and plenty of opportunity to learn, innovate, and grow.
   

  

**About The Engineering Teams & The Role**
 Our teams own their product areas end-to-end, making daily decisions in close collaboration within and across teams, as well as with stakeholders. We work in small, iterative cycles- experimenting, learning, and deploying to production multiple times a day. We work closely with AI agents to accelerate everything from early prototyping and experimentation to building, shipping, and continuously learning in production.
   

  

 Our data platform is primarily built in Rust and runs in AWS. We use open-source technologies such as DataFusion, Arrow, Parquet, and Iceberg, and extend them with our own tooling to meet the unique needs of our product.
   

  

 At Funnel, engineers are responsible for the full lifecycle: from designing system architecture to implementation, deployment, and monitoring. With a customer-first mindset, we continually strive to build products that solve real problems and exceed expectations.
   

  

**Skills & Experience We’re Looking For**
* Experience with systems programming languages such as Rust, C/C++, Java, or Scala
* Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and operations (AWS preferred)
* A default to AI mindset: leveraging AI agents to accelerate your work and impact
* Background in building distributed systems and addressing scalability, reliability, and fault-tolerance challenges
* Familiarity with large-scale batch processing systems
* Comfortable working in agile, collaborative teams
* Strong communication skills and fluency in English


**Why You Should Join Us**
* Build meaningful tech that powers millions of daily jobs for customers around the world.
* Help shape our next-gen platform as we grow and move toward an AI-first future.
* Enjoy real ownership with the freedom to design, build, and ship every day.
* Work with friendly, collaborative teams who care about quality and each other.
* Grow with us in a company that invests in learning, innovation, and people.


**Location & Eligibility**
 At This Time, We Can Only Consider Applicants Who Are Already Based In Stockholm And Meet One Of The Following Criteria
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship and are currently living in Stockholm
* Have a valid Swedish work permit


**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays. We just like to avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

 \*\*\*A note from the Talent Acquisition team: We will start reviewing applications in late Januray 2026!\*\*\*
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Senior Account Executive
description:
**Senior Account Executive till Aon**
 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en del av ett världsledande företag inom försäkring och riskhantering? Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta som generalistförmedlare sakförsäkring med några av de största företagen globalt, där din proaktivitet och ditt engagemang verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Senior Account Executive med stort intresse för riskhantering och internationell affärsverksamhet. Om du vill vara med och forma framtidens lösningar inom försäkring och riskhantering är detta tjänsten för dig!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en erfaren försäkringsförmedlare till vår affärsenhet Corporate. I denna nyckelroll ansvarar du för att leverera Aons tjänster inom sakförsäkring till dina kunder och samordnar kundteamet kring respektive uppdrag. Du arbetar med medelstora och större svenska och internationella företag och är den som bäst förstår dina kunders verksamhet, risker och behov.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter - Exempel för rollen**
* Huvudansvarig för högkvalitativ leverans av Aons tjänster till dina befintliga kunder
* Resultatansvar för dina kunduppdrag
* Driva kors- och merförsäljning för att vidareutveckla samarbetet med dina kunder inom Aons tjänsteområden
* Analysera kundens verksamhet, identifiera risker och föreslå ändamålsenliga försäkringslösningar i samråd med kunden
* Upphandla, utvärdera och förhandla försäkringslösningar med försäkringsgivare
* Stötta kunden i löpande frågor, såsom inkludering av nya bolag, produktområden eller geografiska områden
* Kontraktsgranskning ur ett försäkrings- och riskperspektiv
* Analys av skadestatistik
* Vara kundens rådgivare i löpande frågor kring risk- och försäkringsfrågor
* Bidra till att stärka vårt team med din tekniska kompetens inom sakförsäkring och
* Samarbeta nära med övriga enheter inom Aon för att säkerställa att kunden får ta del av hela Aons samlade erbjudande


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig med gedigen erfarenhet från försäkringsbranschen, gärna minst åtta års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet samt stor förståelse för internationella försäkringsprogram. Akademisk utbildning är starkt meriterande, men för oss väger personliga egenskaper och praktisk erfarenhet tungt. Är du registrerad försäkringsförmedlare in om sakförsäkring är det en stor fördel.
   

  

 För att lyckas som Senior Account Executive har du:
   

  

* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.
* Hög social kompetens och lätt för att bygga och utveckla långsiktiga relationer
* Ett mycket proaktivt, affärsorienterat och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta ansvar, samtidigt som du bidrar aktivt till ett välfungerande teamarbete
* God insikt i försäkringsmarknaden och hur den fungerar
* Goda IT-kunskaper, särskilt i Microsofts applikationer


 Tjänsten är både utvecklande och utmanande, med stora möjligheter att påverka såväl kundernas affär som din egen professionella utveckling inom Aon.
   

  

**Intresserad? Hör av dig!**
 Kontakter och urval sker löpande, ansök senast 2026-02-15, men vi förbehåller oss rätten att stänga ansökan tidigare. Vid frågor om tjänsten eller Aon som arbetsgivare är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Térèse Stéen, +46 73 421 3120 eller HR, Amanda Hansson, +46 76 127 71 87. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 2572042

title: Sales Development Representative - Nordics
description:
****About Workato****
 Workato transforms technology complexity into business opportunity. As the leader in enterprise orchestration, Workato helps businesses globally streamline operations by connecting data, processes, applications, and experiences. Its AI-powered platform enables teams to navigate complex workflows in real-time, driving efficiency and agility.
   

  

 Trusted by a community of 400,000 global customers, Workato empowers organizations of every size to unlock new value and lead in today’s fast-changing world. Learn how Workato helps businesses of all sizes achieve more at workato.com.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a
 **flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles** 
 . We are driven by
 **innovation** 
 and looking for
 **team players** 
 who want to actively build our company.
   

  

 But, we also believe in
 **balancing productivity with self-care** 
 . That’s why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.
   

  

 If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!
   

  

**Also, Feel Free To Check Out Why:**
* Business Insider named us an “enterprise startup to bet your career on”
* Forbes’ Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world
* Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America
* Quartz ranked us the #1 best company for remote workers


****Responsibilities****
 Workato is looking for talented and highly motivated results-oriented individuals to join our expanding sales team. In this role, you will be able to demonstrate a successful track record in remotely managing a large diverse territory. You will be comfortable embracing a start-up environment where personal performance is critical and will have the flexibility and determination to participate in any activity to ensure success.
   

  

 As a
 **Sales Development Representative** 
 , You Will Be Responsible For Uncovering And Developing New Opportunities From Outbound Activities, And Building a Strong Pipeline Of Sales Opportunities To Deliver On Sales Targets. The Prospect Profile Can Vary From IT, Business Operations, To Sales / Marketing / Support Operations. You Will Focus On Sales Opportunity Generation Programs And Their Execution Including Email And Telephone Activities. Excellent Collaboration And Proactive Participation With Our Marketing, Sales And Customer Success Teams Is Critical To Success. As Well As Contributing Through Achievement Of Your Goals, You Will Bring Enthusiasm, Expertise And Creativity To Our Company. You Will Also Be Responsible To:
   

  

* Set up meetings for the Sales Team and help build the company pipeline.
* Work closely with the Marketing Team on campaigns and GTM efforts.
* Work closely with the Sales Team to refine strategy for targeted territories/segments.
* Consult existing customers to understand how they are using Workato currently and where they want to get to as a business
* Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
* Reach out to customer leads through cold calling and email
* Continuously improve through feedback


****Requirements****
**Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills**
* 6 months - 1 year of Sales Development experience preferred. Fresh graduates may apply
* Knowledge of business applications, especially applications used in Sales, Marketing, Customer Support such as Google Apps, Outreach, Zoominfo, Slack and SFDC
* You must speak Finnish or Swedish to be considered for this position


****Soft Skills / Personal Characteristics****
* High energy, positive attitude with the ability to take initiative; strong work ethic, self-directed and resourceful; Discipline to conduct and manage sales cycle process from initial contact through to initial qualification
* Strong customer orientation, dedication, and passion for delivering a great customer experience
* Strong collaboration skills; ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact
* You must have any of the Nordic languages as your native language to be considered for this position
* Ability to convey information clearly and analyze customer requirements as needed to help customer make buying decisions
* Some technical aptitude and the ability to become deeply fluent in integration and automation solutions.

title: Chefsarkitekt
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Lantmännen Cerealia befinner sig i en omställning där både affären och IT‑landskapet behöver moderniseras, standardiseras och bli mer kostnadseffektivt. IT‑ansvaret har flyttats närmare verksamheten och bolaget står inför ett stort M3‑molnprojekt samt införande av gemensamma arbetssätt över flera länder. Nu etableras rollen som Chefsarkitekt i syfte att ta ett helhetsgrepp om målarkitekturen, förenkla och konsolidera dagens systemmiljö och skapa styrning för framtida beslut. Genom att etablera en arkitekturfunktion blir det möjligt att både sänka IT‑kostnaderna över tid och samtidigt stärka Cerealias affärsförmåga, innovationskraft och leveranssäkerhet. Du arbetar både strategiskt och mycket hands-on där du dels genom affärssystemsprojektet och även parallellt bygger upp en arkitekturell styrning för att optimera affär och IT.
   

  

 Du tillhör Business IT, ingår i IT-ledningsgruppen och rapporterar till CIO för Cerealia. Tillsammans med CIO och övriga chefer och medarbetare inom Business IT kopplar du ihop strategi, målarkitektur och portfölj till en tydlig IT‑roadmap. Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm (alternativt Malmö) och innebär nära samarbete med såväl centrala funktioner som verksamheten i fabriker och länder.

title: Group Lead Commercial Counsel – Consumer and Fair Competition
description:
**The Company**








 Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services.  We currently protect over 6 million families and small businesses across 18 countries in Europe and Latin America.  Our mission is to provide our customers with peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.
 







 With over 35 years of experience and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services and customer-centricity.  Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry.
 







 We have had some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer services, demonstrating our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.
 







**Group Lead Commercial Counsel – Consumer and Fair Competition**








 Verisure is seeking a talented, dynamic and versatile Counsel to provide
 **leadership on consumer and fair competition matters across the Verisure Group’s European footprint** 
 .
 







 This new, combined role is a strategically important one.  Compliance with ever-increasing EU and national rules on consumer protection and competition across Europe is vital; it is also a component of winning, building trust with and satisfying our customers.  The Counsel will have pan-business oversight of these areas and the opportunity to develop and direct our strategy.   
 







 The Counsel will have a high profile with legal peers and senior management across the Verisure Group.  They will be a part of our fast-growing Legal team and will report to our Group Commercial and Innovation Legal Director.
 







 The successful candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, agile, international, and entrepreneurial business environment.  The role offers an opportunity to develop as the business evolves and it is an exciting opportunity to deliver value from day one through innovative and leading-edge legal thinking.
 







**Key responsibilities** 








**CONSUMER MATTERS ACROSS THE VERISURE GROUP’S EUROPEAN FOOTPRINT** 







* Provide strategic legal advice and leadership at Group level on consumer areas including:
	+ marketing claims and pricing strategies;
	+ sales practices, processes and sales materials for Verisure’s core alarm system services and ancillary personal protection services;
	+ customer T&Cs and contracting models; and
	+ consumer-facing aspects of new methods of getting to market.






* Lead and develop (in close collaboration with Verisure country counsel) our consumer and fair competition programme, involving:
	+ guidance, templates and training materials on common topics;
	+ consumer protection audits; and
	+ close collaboration with the Group Compliance team on Group internal minimum standards, Group policy and standards.






* As needed, support Verisure country counsel on complex regulatory inquiries.






* Monitor, assess and share information about consumer and fair competition enforcement cases and trends as well as proposals for EU consumer protection legislation.






* Together with the Group Legal Regulatory Advocacy team, develop and lead a strategy of engagement with relevant external stakeholders, which may include consumer associations, trade associations, regulators and legislators, both at a national and EU level.






* Together with other functions, analyse and interpret regulations.







**LEGAL ADVICE ON FAIR COMPETITION LEGAL STRATEGY AND COMPLIANCE** 







* Lead fair competition legal strategy the Group, ensuring compliance across key business initiatives and monitoring fair competition in the market.






* Support Verisure country Heads of Legal and work with our Iberia & LatAm Competition Counsel to provide expert legal advice on antitrust and unfair commercial practices, aligning legal requirements with commercial goals.






* Conduct internal audits and implement compliance programmes, as relevant.






* Act as primary Group Legal contact for internal Legal and business colleagues on fair competiton topics, translating legal requirements into actionable business guidance.






* Manage external counsel and budget.







**Candidate profile** 








 The ideal candidate
 
 must
 
 :
 


* be a qualified lawyer in a European jurisdiction, with a minimum of five years of relevant experience;
	+ have excellent knowledge of EU consumer protection and fair competition legislation and practical experience of its implementation in at least one of Verisure’s European operating countries;
	+ have experience from consumer protection related litigation and enforcement actions of national consumer protection authorities.







 It would be
 
 advantageous
 
 to have experience of:
 


* commercialising technology and related services;


* working as an in-house lawyer.







 In terms of competencies, the ideal candidate will:
 


* be adaptable and have the proven ability to thrive in dynamic and fast-paced environments;
* have a pragmatic approach, seeing the legal function as a responsible business enabler;
* have a proven track record of leading projects;
* have very high EQ and level of judgment – be a strong, confident but humble leader that exerts influence through persuasion.
* be enthusiastic and a high energy individual, with a strong drive to create a positive work environment;
* be curious, creative and pragmatic;
* be an independent problem solver that can set priorities, clearly articulate defensible opinions and enable efficient decision making;
* have the ability and willingness to take a "hands on" approach, while maintaining an ability for a high level or strategic view of activities.







**Company DNA** 








 Finally, there must be a strong fit with our company DNA:
 






* **Passionate in Everything We Do**
 : Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.
* **Committed to Making a Difference**
 : When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.
* **Always Innovating**


 :
 

 We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.
* **Winning as a Team**


 :
 

 Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.
* **With Trust & Responsibility**
 : Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.







**Location** 








 Geneva (Group head office) preferred, but it could be in any European city in which a Verisure country has its head office, subject to regular working visits (every two-to-three weeks) to the Geneva office and additional travel to other European cities as required.
 







**The Legal team** 








 Our global combined legal, compliance, privacy and regulatory advocacy and public affairs team consists of over 140 lawyers and other professionals across the organization that come from 18 countries, representing four continents, with a strong gender balance across all levels of the team, including in the Group legal management team. We are well-integrated, working closely together across countries as well as the organization to leverage each other’s experience, to develop best practices, and to deliver our colleagues best-in-class legal partnership.
 







 Our vision is to be business enablers, and our mission is to deliver value through innovative and leading-edge legal thinking, impactful regulatory advocacy, and leadership in protecting our reputation and building trust with customers and key stakeholders for sustainable business growth. We are currently on a digital transformation journey, integrating AI and other digital solutions into how we operate, led by our Group Legal Operations Manager reporting into the Group CLO. 
 







 Our team has also been recognized as one of the leading in-house legal functions in the Legal 500 GC Powerlist Switzerland in 2019, 2023, 2024 and 2025 and the Legal 500 GC Powerlist Europe LATAM Specialists in 2023. For over 30 years, The Legal 500 has been analyzing the capabilities of law firms across the world, turning its attention to in-house legal functions which are driving the legal business forward.
 







 The Legal team also offers the ability to continuously grow, with several examples over the past period of moves, growing responsibilities and promotions within the Function.
 







 Join us to become one of us – business enablers and essential contributors to sustainable business growth.

title: Senior Full-Stack Platform Builder
description:
**Pulse Penguin | Flexible, with Stockholm office presence expected** 




 Pulse Penguin is building a governed AI decision platform — a real business OS. Not a chatbot wrapper. Not AI theatre. Operational AI with financial grounding, auditability, security, and real workflows.
 



  





 We’re early on purpose. This isn’t “pick up a ticket in JIRA and merge to main.” You’ll shape the architecture, the product, and how engineering gets done here.
 



 We ship fast using AI-assisted loops — but we don’t ship sloppy. Tests, guardrails, modular contracts, single source of truth. Speed with correctness.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Build and ship end-to-end across
 **React/TypeScript + Supabase**
* Write and maintain tests (DevHub checks, integration tests, regression guards)
* Keep the system clean: modular handlers, no duplicate paths, no chaos creep



  





**You** 



* Strong
 **TypeScript + React** 
 in real production environments
* Comfortable owning backend/APIs + data modelling
* You like constraints, quality, and fast iteration



  





**Compensation** 




 Competitive salary (experience-based)
 



  





**Work setup** 




 Flexible arrangements with an expectation for presence at our Stockholm office. We’re deliberately building an office that feels like home. No sterile “office-vibes”, no corporate theatre. It’s cosy, high-trust, and where fast decisions happen. Dogs are welcome energy :) 
 



  





**Find all the details at** 
**https://pulsepenguin.ai/careers** 




  





**Apply by** 




 Emailing
 **jobs@pulsepenguin.ai** 
 with your CV, cover letter, and proof you ship: links/examples of products you’ve built (anything real).

title: Senior eCom Experience Planner
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As our Senior eCom Experience Planner you will be working in the intersection of Marketing, Technology and Business. Together with Content Managers, CRM specialists, UX/UI designers and copywriters you will be responsible for driving execution within the Experience team that will create the optimal brand experience and business value. You will report to the Director of eCom Experience.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Lead a team of Content Managers to ensure that we show up in an optimal way and are following roadmaps and priorities. Foster a collaborative, solution-oriented, and high-performance team culture
* Working close to Director of eCom Experience to act as a key liaison between strategic planning, Brand teams, Regional teams, Product launch team and Internal design agency to execute across website and CRM, connecting insights to activation
* Translate strategies and business objectives into clear briefs, execution plans, timelines and oversee end-to-end execution
* Develop and maintain the eCom Experience project board and calendar across website and CRM, ensuring alignment with brand priorities, product launches and promotional plans while maximizing team capacity
* Ensure all experiences are compliant with brand standards, optimized and cohesive across all touchpoints on website and CRM, and delivered on schedule
* Collaborate cross-functionally to align needs, anticipate dependencies, and proactively identify and resolve bottlenecks that could impact execution or timelines
* Review performance to identify opportunities for optimization, improvements to workflows, processes, and planning to enhance operational efficiency


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You love to execute plans, work in teams and are excited to learn new skills and curious about how to always improve. You like to create visual depictions of approaches, suggestions and insights. The role requires you to be highly structured with an attention to details and a great ability to prioritize and make things happen. You easily cooperate across business units and like to work in a multicultural, complex, and global organization. You have very strong collaboration skills, have an eye to details and are very interested in exploring new ways and improving ways of working.
   

  

* Strong project management skills with experience leading cross-functional digital initiatives
* Exceptional communication, organization, and stakeholder-management skills.
* Familiarity with CMS, CRM, and digital campaign workflows.


**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* 5+ years' experience from working in a project managing role within eCom, digital marketing, content operations or related fields
* Proven experience of leading high performing teams
* Hands-on experience with tech platforms such as CMS and eCommerce systems to effectively plan, explain and execute creative ideas
* Experience in working with the consumer from a 360-degree perspective in a technical and creative environment. It’s natural for you to work towards a seamless brand experience and user journeys across touch points.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers. We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Compliance and Labour Law Specialist
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose smoke-free enjoyment. How? By offering people other nicotine products online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with 11 store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 300 team members in Sweden, US and a couple of other European countries. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more smokers to smoke-free alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are looking for a Compliance Officer with 5+ years of experience to join our Legal & External Affairs Team. As part of our commitment to compliance and sustainability, you’ll play an important role in building and optimizing the compliance program which is the foundation of our business. You will work broadly within various compliance fields, including but not limited to labour law compliance and occupational health and safety.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity for a driven and collaborative person who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You will contribute to developing and maintaining our compliance program and advise stakeholders in our various markets, while growing your compliance skills alongside experienced colleagues.
   

  

 You will report to our Head of Compliance, and step into a team that thrives on collaboration and open dialogue. We foster a culture of curiosity and knowledge sharing, where every idea is valued and has the potential to shape the future.
   

  

**KEY RESPOSIBILITIES**
* Advise: Advise organisation on labour law to ensure compliance with applicable legislation
* Design: Set and implement global compliance policies and procedures
* Assess: Coordinate and lead occupational health and safety assessments globally
* Investigate: Lead investigations and sanctions globally
* Educate: Deliver employee training on the compliance program


**Professional Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in compliance with a strong focus on labour law
* A degree in law, international business, risk management, Human Resource Management or related field
* Hands-on experience of designing global policies and procedures
* Experience in internal controls and investigations
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively
* Strong global perspective, with professional experience supporting multiple international regions and deep knowledge of Swedish employment legislation
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with different stakeholders.
* Experience in mid-sized (200–1000 employees) international organisations
* Fluency in Swedish and English


**YOU WILL PROBABLY THRIVE HERE IF YOU**
* Have a builder mindset: energized by creating from scratch
* Drive results with pragmatism: balances strategy with execution
* Communicate with clarity: simplifies complex topics
* Lead with integrity: committed to fairness and transparency
* Influence through collaboration: thrives across functions and geographies


 We welcome applications from all candidates, and while everyone is encouraged to apply, we will give priority to those already based in Stockholm or in the process of relocating.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values We team up, Innovation Drives Us, Inclusion and Non-Hierarchy and Going the Extra Mile at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With 11 e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: Butikschef
description:
2nd Store Manager till Mall of Scandinavia – Ta steget till din nästa framgångsresa
   

  

**Är du en resultatinriktad ledare som älskar att driva försäljning, skapa kundupplevelser i toppklass samt , inspirera och utveckla medarbetare?**
**Då är detta din chans att ta nästa steg – som 2nd Store Manager hos oss på Twilfit by CHANGE**
 Vi söker nu en driven, engagerad och affärsmässig ledare till vår butik i
 **Mall of Scandinavia** 
 .
   

  

 I denna roll rapporterar du till och har ett nära samarbete med Flying Store Manager för butikens resultat, teamets utveckling och kundernas upplevelse.
   

  

 Du spelar en nyckelroll i vårt uppdrag att hjälpa alla kvinnor att känna sig bekväma och vackra i våra underkläder, oavsett storlek.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Som 2nd Store Manager är du en viktig del i att säkerställa butikens dagliga framgång. Du coachar, leder och utvecklar teamet till att nå både individuella och gemensamma mål – och du visar vägen genom att vara en förebild i kundmötet.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden inkluderar bland annat:
   

  

* Försäljningsansvar och daglig uppföljning av KPI:er
* Leda och coacha teamet
* Arbeta med säljträning och feedback för att utveckla teamet i service och försäljning
* Personalplanering och optimal schemaläggning enligt timbudget
* Säkerställa en inspirerande och säljdrivande butiksmiljö
* Ansvar för administrativa uppgifter och att hålla deadlines


 Du rapporterar till Flying Store Manager som har det yttersta ansvaret för butiken, men som också finns där för att stötta och utveckla dig i din nya roll.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är en naturlig ledare och en serviceinriktad säljare – med energi, närvaro och tydliga ambitioner.
   

  

 Vi tror att du:
   

  

* Har tidigare erfarenhet från detaljhandel, gärna i en ledande roll
* Strukturerad och affärsmässig, med vana att arbeta mot uppsatta mål
* Älskar försäljning och att leda ett team för att nå satta mål
* Brinner för att skapa resultat genom andra och trivs med att coacha team, sätta förväntningar och skapa engagemang
* Positiv, lyhörd och med en förmåga att få människor att växa
* En säljande ledare som älskar att vara ute i butiken med kunder och personal
* Serviceminded med fingertoppskänsla i mötet med kunder och kan skapa trygghet i en personlig köpupplevelse


**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 Du får bland annat:
   

  

* En grundlig introduktion och onboarding
* Ett strukturerat stöd från butikschef och huvudkontor
* Tillgång till HR-rådgivning, budgetverktyg, rapportstöd, IT-system
* En värderingsstyrd arbetsmiljö där vi satsar på våra ledare
* Du får arbeta som ledare i en våra mest omsättande butiker
* Fast lön samt möjlighet till bonus baserat på butikens resultat
* Möjlighet till utveckling och en karriärväg till Store Manager med möjlighet till vinstdelning i vårt Store Manager Partner-program


**Är du redo för förändring?**
 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och CV redan idag .
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta gärna:
 **Tatjana Jovanovic, HR Business Partner, tatjov@change.com**
*Observera att vi endast tar emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem. Ansökningar via e-post beaktas ej.*

title: Underhållsingenjör elkraft och belysning, komplexa väganläggningar
description:
Vill du ha en nyckelroll i att hålla Stockholms vägtunnlar och öppningsbara broar trygga, upplysta och driftsäkra? Vi söker en driven underhållsingenjör inom elkraft till enheten Infrasystem väg i Östra Underhållsregionen - en roll där du får vara med och påverka, utvecklas och bidra till utveckling och förvaltning av vägsystemets uppkopplade anläggning.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Verksamhetsområde Underhåll ansvarar för att förvalta, underhålla och utveckla det befintliga och framtida väg- och järnvägssystemet genom upphandling, styrning och uppföljning av underhållsprojekt. Inom enhet Infrasystem arbetar vi med projekt som omhändertager underhåll av tekniska installationer i väganläggningen och system som övervakar och styr de tekniska installationerna.
   

  

 Enheten består av tre sektioner: Installation, Tekniska System och Centrala System. Enheten Infrasystem består idag av cirka 30 medarbetare fördelade över flera olika teknikområden.
   

  

 I rollen som underhållsingenjör inom elkraft och belysning är din uppgift att säkerställa drift och underhåll av kraftförsörjningsinstallationer och belysning som Trafikverket har i de stora vägtunnlarna och på de öppningsbara vägbroarna i Stockholmsområdet.
   

  

 Tillsammans med en projektledare ansvarar du för att planera, leda och följa upp underhållsåtgärderna inom ramen för aktuella projekt. Rollen har ett tydligt fokus på teknik och anläggning men har även administrativa uppgifter. Du har tät kontakt med de kontrakterade entreprenörer som utför underhållet samt projektörer och du säkerställer att rätt saker blir utförda på rätt sätt, i rätt tid och till rätt kostnad. Du har en varierad arbetssituation med många olika uppgifter och stora möjligheter att påverka hur du lägger upp arbetet. Den ena dagen är du inne på kontoret med administrativa uppgifter, håller fysiska eller digitala möten och samverkar med dina kollegor. Nästa dag är du i anläggningen och undersöker dess tillstånd, följer upp dina entreprenörers arbeten och samverkar på plats med olika parter. Du bidrar med motivation och inspiration till ditt projektteam och bidrar till en god arbetsmiljö. Som en del i din utveckling kommer du även att självständigt driva projekt och reinvesteringsåtgärder.
   

  

 En typisk arbetsvecka kan innehålla
   

  

* byggmöten, teknikmöten och interna projektmöten
* att biträda projektledaren vid behov
* uppföljning av utförda leveranser ute i anläggningen
* uppföljning av leveranser i underhållssystemet GUS
* ajourhålla anläggningsinformation samt säkerställa att relevanta underlag dokumenteras korrekt i underhållssystemet GUS
* att samverka och samordna med interna och externa projektintressenter


 Eftersom många möten sker digitalt finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till två dagar i veckan. Avdelningen har även valt att ha två gemensamma kontorsdagar i veckan vilket ger fler av oss möjlighet att mötas i vardagen.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas som underhållsingenjör är du självgående och har en god analytisk problemlösningsförmåga. Du är strukturerad och konstruktiv och har förmågan att lösa komplexa arbetsuppgifter. Du trivs med att arbeta i team och motiveras av ett högt tempo. Det märks att du har ett naturligt driv att förbättra och nå goda resultat. Att samverka och kommunicera både inom myndigheten och med våra entreprenörer är en självklarhet för dig. Du har en naturlig fallenhet för att leda och bidra till en god stämning och laganda.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
* teknisk högskoleutbildning om minst 180hp (120p) eller annan utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig
* flerårig aktuell erfarenhet från att arbeta med kraftförsörjningsanläggningar 0,4 kV - 36 kV i relevant del av anläggningsbranschen
* erfarenhet av en arbetsledande roll, exempelvis som projektledare, byggledare, projekteringsledare eller motsvarande
* god datorvana och erfarenhet från arbete med verksamhetsnära IT-stödsystem
* goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
* giltigt körkort för personbil


**Det är meriterande om du har**
* erfarenhet av arbete i eller i nära anslutning till vägtunnlar och komplexa trafikmiljöer
* erfarenhet av entreprenadupphandling


 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Tjänstens placeringsort är Solna. Vill du ha en flexibel vardag med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån? I den här rollen kan du jobba på distans upp till två dagar i veckan.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering används webbaserade tester som en del i urvalet. Vi planerar att hålla digitala intervjuer den 17-18/2.
   

  

 För att undvika att du missar viktig information om din ansökan behöver du se till att hålla dig uppdaterad via "Min karriärsida"! Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta ansvarig chef för rekryteringen så att din ansökan blir hanterad enligt särskilda rutiner. Du hittar namn och kontaktuppgifter till chefen i annonsen.
   

  

 Inom verksamhetsområde Underhåll ansvarar vi för leveransen av säkra och tillgängliga vägar och järnvägar. Genom att förvalta, underhålla och utveckla det befintliga och framtida väg- och järnvägssystemet lägger vi grunden för näringslivets godstransporter och miljoner människors resande - varje dag, året om. Kompetensutveckling står högt på vår agenda, oavsett vilken roll du har eller var du befinner dig i yrkeslivet. Hos oss gör du skillnad!
   

  

 På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.

title: Finnish speaking Customer Advisor to Pre-Collection (Part-time)
description:
**Please note that we are not able to hire people that live in Finland. To be able to work with us, you need to be located in the Stockholm area, as the office is our main place to work.**
 We are now looking for new part time colleagues, as we call "temps", to Collections. Collections is an outbound-focused role where you will primarily contact customers who, for various reasons, have fallen behind on their payments. In some cases, there are simple solutions, while in others, you will need to work with the customer to develop a long-term payment plan. You will also handle some inbound calls from customers who reach out to us. Alongside the calls, there is some administrative work, but the role itself is phone-based, which is why we are looking for someone who enjoys customer interaction and sees every conversation as an opportunity to help!📞
   

  

 To succeed in this role, it is important that you are engaged and proactive - both in customer interactions and in your own development. We value team members who actively contribute to discussions and meetings, even in situations where they may not yet have the deepest expertise. 💡
   

  

 We operate in a highly regulated industry, and it is crucial that you understand the responsibility that comes with working at a bank, especially in adhering to the regulatory frameworks we must follow. Examples of relevant regulations include GDPR, banking secrecy, AML (Anti-Money Laundering) regulations, and identity verification requirements. We must also be mindful of how we communicate with our customers, both verbally and in writing. 📓✔️🖊️
   

  

**Training**
 This position starts with a full-time introduction for two weeks in the office. In order for you to have good conditions to start working, attendance as high as possible is required during these two weeks. After the two weeks, while you are still in training, the shifts will be scheduled during daytime in the office. When you can work independently, you will also have the option to work from home.
   

  

**Shifts**
 Your shifts will mostly be scheduled during the 30th-5th and 15th-17th every month.
   

  

****To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:****
* Service-oriented & communicative: You have the ability to listen and understand different people’s needs while also having the confidence to set clear expectations in conversations. 🌱
* Results-driven: You are motivated by achieving results and goals, such as customer satisfaction. 🏆
* Flexible: You can adapt to different situations that arise at work and excel at prioritizing tasks. 🤸‍♀️


 It is also important that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.
   

  

**We Are Looking For You Who**
* Have worked with service/people in some way, preferably over the phone
* Speaks and writes fluently in Finnish and English, preferably Swedish as well
* Can and want to work part-time for at least 1 year (hopefully longer!)


**Practical Information**
**Start:** 
 By agreement
   

  

**Place:** 
 Stockholm, Gävlegatan 22
   

  

**Employment form:** 
 Temporary employment
   

  

**Salary:** 
 Hourly 💰 The salary for this position ranges from 160–170 SEK per hour and is determined individually based on relevant knowledge, experience, and education.
   

  

**Hours:** 
 07:30-16:00
   

  

**Have you heard about

 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you have the opportunity to shape your own development while having fun on the journey toward our goals – all in a workplace with a little extra sparkle! ✨ Read more about our employee promise on our

title: Software Configuration Management-(Embedded)
description:
**Professional Galaxy** är ett IT- och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, mjukvaruutveckling, SAP, inköp, elektronik och mekanisk konstruktion. Vi samarbetar med erfarna seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och analytiskt krävande projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och tydliga, mätbara resultat.


Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.


Ansök gärna redan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande.


Vi söker nu en senior konsult inom **Software Configuration Management** till ett längre uppdrag hos vår kund inom försvarsindustrin. Uppdraget är en viktig del av kundens mjukvaruutveckling och omfattar ansvar för hela konfigurationshanteringskedjan, med nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam och releasefunktioner. Rollen passar dig som har djup teknisk förståelse för inbyggd mjukvara och som trivs i en coachande och styrande funktion.

**Om uppdraget**  

I rollen ansvarar du, under övergripande ledning, för samtliga faser inom Software Configuration Management, inklusive planering, identifiering, ändringshantering, kontroll, rapportering och revision. Du säkerställer att mjukvaruleveranser sker enligt uppsatta krav, inom rätt tid och med rätt kvalitet och kostnadsnivå.


Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteamet och projektorganisationen och bidrar aktivt i arbete kring milstolpar, releaser och kontinuerlig integration. En viktig del av uppdraget är även att stötta, utbilda och coacha utvecklingsteamet i konfigurationshantering, versionshantering och arbetssätt.

**Arbetsuppgifter och ansvar**  

Ansvara för och driva alla faser av Software Configuration Management  

Stötta teamet i lösningar kopplade till Continuous Integration och DevOps-arbetssätt  

Delta i projektaktiviteter kopplade till milstolpar och release management  

Stötta vid utvärdering av milstolpar och inför releaser  

Säkerställa status på mjukvara och mjukvarukomponenter inför release  

Stötta och driva nödvändiga åtgärder vid mjukvarureleaser  

Granska och stötta framtagning av mjukvarudokumentation, exempelvis:


Software Control Document  

Software Version Description  

Coacha utvecklingsteamet inom Configuration Management  

Ansvara för utbildning och support kring versionshantering enligt företagets arbetssätt  

Sätta upp källkodsstruktur i versionshanteringssystem i linje med PDM-artikelnummer  

Definiera mjukvarubyggen med namn, etiketter och versioner kopplade till PDM  

Sätta upp och underhålla CI/CD-flöden och mjukvarubyggen  

Stötta arbetsflöden för mjukvarukomponenter gällande koddelning och konfigurationshantering

 **Krav**  

3-7 års erfarenhet av Software Configuration Management  

Erfarenhet av inbyggd mjukvara (embedded software)  

God erfarenhet av DevOps och CI/CD-miljöer  

Praktisk erfarenhet av verktyg som exempelvis:


Jenkins  

Bitbucket  

Artifactory (eller liknande plattformar)  

Erfarenhet av arbete i försvarsrelaterad eller annan säkerhetskritisk verksamhet  

Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, driva processer och stötta team  

Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska

**Location**: City:Kalmar, Stockholm (KALMAR, STOCKHOLM)

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2026-02-04


Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.  

Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Devops
description:
### **Din roll**


Som DevOps hos oss arbetar du som konsult och stöttar våra kunder med att bygga och förbättra deras DevOps-miljöer. Du ansvarar för att designa, administrera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines samtidigt som du skapar effektiva arbetsflöden i nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam. En viktig del av rollen är att hantera Git-repositorier och använda Infrastructure as Code (IaC) för att automatisera och förenkla processer.


Du kommer också att arbeta med modern containerteknologi och orkestreringslösningar som säkerställer skalbara och hållbara system. Utöver det får du arbeta med monitorering, analys och optimering av prestanda för att kontinuerligt förbättra CI/CD-livscykeln.


Med varierande projekt och uppdrag kommer du att få insikt i olika branscher och tekniska miljöer, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att utvecklas och bredda din kompetens.

### **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:

* Mjukvaruutveckling och automation med **Python**.
* Administrera och optimera **CI/CD-pipelines**, med förståelse för arkitektur.
* Git repository management, Git workflows och branchingstrategier.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC) och att sätta upp pipelines med verktyg som exempelvis **Terraform** eller liknande.
* Konfigurationshantering med verktyg som **Ansible**, **Puppet**, **Chef** eller liknande.
* Containerlösningar som **Docker** och orkestrering med **Kubernetes**.
* Monitoreringslösningar samt typer av metrics användbara i CI/CD-flöden.
* God förståelse för grundläggande cloud concept.
* Du behöver vara flytande i engelska och svenska.

### **Meriterande erfarenheter**


Det är extra meriterande om du:

* Har erfarenhet av **Golang-programmering**.
* Har arbetat med CI/CD-automationsflöden som inkluderat egen hårdvara, till exempel egengjorda testriggar.

### **Varför Knowit?**


På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en innovativ och lärande miljö där du kontinuerligt utvecklas. Vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder och samhället. Som konsult hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent team som brinner för samarbete, delning av kunskap och att lösa spännande tekniska utmaningar.


Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss? Besök vår hemsida eller kontakta oss direkt!

### **Låter detta som en roll för dig?**


Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.
